loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Teresita dreams that one day she will be able to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with seven children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of goods to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Delia dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justine is a 32-year-old, hardworking, committed mother of one child who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda.
She deals mainly in shoe and clothing sales and works seven days a week.

Her highest dream is to boost her business so that she can earn more income and expand into a wholesale business. However, this is not possible since she lacks the capital to meet the rising costs of shoes and clothes. Justine hopes to become rich and be well-off in the future.

Justine used her previous loan to buy more secondhand clothes to sell. She is requesting a new loan to purchase more shoes and clothes to sell during the upcoming festive season.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes and clothes to sell for the festive season.

loans.name: Pirayu Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo Pirayu Poty está en su ciclo número 5º del programa de comité de mujeres, se formó en la ciudad de Itá, con amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Nancy, quien cuenta con una heladería y ventas de confites donde ella trabaja día a día con  mucho esfuerzo para lograr el crecimiento y bienestar de su familia.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de todos los ingredientes para la elaboración de tortas y confites, y compra de helados, todo esto  le ayudará  a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Pirayu Poty Group is in its fifth cycle of the committee of women program. It formed in the city of Ita among friends and neighbors of the city.

One of the members is Nancy who has an ice cream shop and sales of sweetmeats, where she works every day with great effort in order to be facilitate the growth and well-being of her family.

She requests this loan in order to be able to invest in the purchase of all the ingredients for making cakes and sweetmeats and to buy ice cream. All of this will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making cakes and sweetmeats and to buy ice cream.

loans.name: Esperanza Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo se encuentra dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder capacitarse y poder salir delante de esa manera.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ronaliz, quien se dedica a las ventas de todo tipo de productos en la mercería que tiene, ella además vende asaditos que se encarga de preparar ella misma. Comenta que trabaja con sacrificio para poder dar a su familia una vida digna.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de artículos de mercerías variados, y también para la compra de insumos para su venta de asaditos. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
This group is in the Poverty Stoplight program. Each member is making a major effort to learn and be able to get ahead in this way.

One of the members is Ronaliz, who works selling all kinds of products in the haberdashery she has. She also sells kabobs which she takes charge of preparing herself. She comments that she works and sacrifices to be able to provide her family with a dignified life.

She is requesting this loan to buy various haberdashery items and supplies for her kabobs. She is grateful for this opportunity she is receiving to be able to continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy various haberdashery items and supplies for her kabobs.

loans.name: Jesus Misericordioso Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Jesus Misericordioso es un grupo nuevo formado en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, como in medio de poder conocerse y mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Froila quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo que hace en sus ventas de comidas, viene esforzándose para poder mejorar cada día, se define a sí misma como una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder hacer sus comidas y venderlas, quiere comprar verduras, carne, condimentos, hortalizas y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Jesus Misericordioso group was formed in the city of San Lorenzo, they are participating in the elimination of poverty program, as a way to know one another and improve their lives.
Froila is one of its members and thanks to her continuous hard work preparing meals she's being improving every day. She considers herself a fighter that just wants to get ahead.
She is asking for this loan to buy supplies to prepare meals such as vegetables, meat, spices, greens and other items to keep working on her small business.

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare meals such as vegetables, meat, spices, greens and other items

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia is 62 years old and resides in the rural town of Clarin. She earns a living by raising and selling hogs. She sells them to the locals and town settlers in her place. She is married and has six grown children.

She would like to boost her earnings by raising more quality hogs and having a sufficient supply of feeds to become sustainable. Slowly, she could able to set aside enough savings to invest in any business opportunities.

Apolonia has requested a loan to purchase three piglets and feed.

In the future, she is looking forward to having a stable source. She thanks Kiva for the support.

loans.use: to purchase three piglets and feed.

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en:
Fausta is a 53-year-old married woman with six children.

Fausta works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store. She has been running the general store for 11 years and she also earns income from raising pigs.

Fausta has borrowed and repaid 6 previous loans from NWTF. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Fausta aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Fidela

texts.en:
Fidela is 60 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Fidela has a business making rugs in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more materials like fabric, etc. for her business. She has been in this business for 21 years. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Fidela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like fabric, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She fattens pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Mary Grace dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Rodelyn dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nongtaaba De Nahourtenga Group

texts.fr:
Mr SAIDOU est le responsable du groupe  NONGTAABA  NAHOURTENGA.  Il se porte bien. Il est Marié, père de 05 enfants.  Il a un enfant de  21 ans et un enfant de 05 ans. Il  a 03 enfants qui  vont  à l’école et  05 personnes en charges.
Mr  fait de l’agriculture. Il pratique cette activité depuis  10 ans.  Il s’approvisionne  dans le marché  de Mogtedo. Ses clients sont les commerçants  de  ouaga.
Avec  l’argent octroyé,  il compte  acheter  03 sacs d’engrais  pour  améliorer ses cultures.  
Il va utiliser les bénéfices du prêt  pour  acheter des produits pour ses  cultures. Les ambitions sont : pour l’affaire, il veut agrandir la superficie de son champ, pour la famille, il veut  paye la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Saidou is the representative of the NONGTAABA  NAHOURTENGA group.  He is doing well.  He is married and the father of five children.  His oldest child is 21, the youngest is 5 years old.  Three of his children attend school.  He has five people under his care.

Saidou is a farmer.  He has been involved in this activity for the past 10 years and buys his supplies at the Mogtedo market.  His customers are merchants from Ouagadougou.

Saidou is planning to use his loan to buy three bags of fertilizer to improve his cultures.  He will use the profits from his loan to buy agricultural inputs.  His professional goal is to increase the size of his field.  His personal goal is to be able to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy three bags of fertilizer to improve his crops.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Meet 25-year-old Hala from Jenin. She is single with no kids. Five years ago, Hala started her business in her parent's house by buying one sewing machine and sewing some clothes for her family and neighbors.

Hala has a disability that challenges her business, as she is deaf and dumb. Hala began her sewing business because she needed a permanent source of income. She stated that her only source of income comes from this business. She has two full-time employees and one part-time employee. The other main challenge to her business are the competitors in the marketplace.

Hala requires this loan in order to buy two sewing machines and some sewing materials like buttons and yarns. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standards of living.

In the future, Hala plans to see her business grow. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy two sewing machines and some sewing materials like buttons and yarns.

loans.name: Wisam

texts.en:
Wisam is a 29-year-old, married woman from Jabalia city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, next to the Refugee Camp with the same name. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but she wants to make her family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

So, Wisam took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable her to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Wisam will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Wisam’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Wisam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Marjorie  Keneth

texts.en:
Marjorie Keneth is a hard-working woman who earns a living through selling snack foods. She sells banana chips, baked polvoron and macaroons to neighbors in her place. She is also seeking ways to improve her quality of life so she wants to improve her yield and also her earnings. She is married and has two young dependents.

She is asking for a loan from CEVI to buy additional supplies like sugar, bananas, milk, flour, desiccated coconut and cooking oil. In this way she hopes to improve her financial income. She will prepare a variety of products to be sold. She is doing her best to handle her livelihood efficiently to become progressive.

With her previous loan, Marjorie Keneth managed to invest in food vending, for which she is very grateful.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies like sugar, bananas, milk, flour, desiccated coconut and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a merchant from the town of Cortes. She sells household wares like hangers and lighters, footwear like sandals and slippers, and blankets and kitchen utensils. She is a married woman and has three dependents, two of whom are still attending school. Her husband earns a living by working in construction.

She would like to gain higher earnings, but she has very limited capital to cope with demands. Mercy would like acquire additional funds to purchase assorted household supplies, to cater to the needs of her customers. In that way, her income will be augmented and she could now start to invest in other business opportunities to become more sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase assorted household supplies.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is a 39-year-old married woman with three school-aged children. She raises hogs to earn a living. Her husband’s way of earning a living is by being a factory worker. Aside from hog raising, she also engages in farming. She grows and sells rice to get additional income for the family.

For a quite period of time she has sold hogs to the local settlers in her community. Belinda has requested a loan to buy feed and fertilizer. These will help boost and improve her earnings. Her farm will have a bountiful harvest and she will be able to raise quality hogs, too. Thus, she could be able to provide her family with nutritious meals and continue to support their respective studies.

For the future, Belinda is aiming to have a healthy family and a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy feed and fertilizer

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
For the past four years, Dionesia has woven native baskets made of buri (a native palm). She lives in the town of Antequera. She is married and has three children, one of whom is still attending school. Her income mainly goes for food and school expenses.

She would like to improve her output in a particular week, but she does not have enough materials to do this.

Dionesia has requested a loan to purchase additional materials like buli (palm) and wicker (pliable twig). These resources are vital in her day-to-day livelihood activity. They will improve the number of finished products, causing her income to grow. She could now start to expand her business. Other revenues will be set aside for future use.

She is thankful for the funds and is determined to manage them successfully to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like buli (palm) and wicker (pliable twig)

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a 66-year-old pensioner woman from Kutaisi city. She lives with her pensioner husband and grandson, who is temporarily unemployed. As the family has only income from pensions, they find it hard to make financial stability.

Loreta decided to be involved in a trading business and somehow increase her family's living condition. All the financial institutions rejected her loan requests because of her unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Loreta applied for credit to MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the poor people to start or re-start businesses.

Loreta plans to purchase stock of various clothing with the requested amount and sell in her community with price mark-ups. She is a very enthusiastic and motivated person with a great desire to ensure her family members with a better style of life. This credit will be a great support for the family. Loreta is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase stock of clothing and start selling.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is a 53-year-old married woman from Zestaponi. She lives with her husband, who has his own small business and gets insignificant income. They find it hard to meet all the family expenses, that's why Tamar decided to be involved in her own business.

Tamar seeks credit but she couldn’t receive it from the local financial institutions because of their requirements to have business experience or stable revenue, until the Start Up program began, which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. The program allows poor people like Tamar to get a chance for starting or re-starting business.

A loan of 1,000 GEL will be great help to this motivated woman and her husband, as she will become the second breadwinner in the family. Their living conditions will significantly improve, and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need. Tamar awaits your support.

loans.use: to start clothing sales and generate her own income.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Ablavi est une femme mariée qui vit avec cinq enfants à charge à Tokoin. Ablavi est une revendeuse de friperies qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend en circulant dans les quartiers environnant. Pour avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin de répondre à nombreuse attentes de ses clients, Ablavi sollicite ce crédit pour commander des balles d’habits et de culottes de friperies en vue mieux revendre et de gagner des bénéfices pour venir en aide à  son mari aux diverses charges quotidiennes éprouvées par la famille.
texts.en:
Ablavi is married and lives with her five dependent children in Tokoin. Ablavi sells used clothing that she buys once a month at the market. She sells this clothing while walking around the local neighborhoods.

In order to have enough stock to maximize her profits and respond to the needs of her clients, Ablavi is asking for this loan to buy bales of clothing and used undergarments. She wants to become a better seller and earn more so that she can help her husband with the various household expenses.

loans.use: buy six bales of clothing and one bale of used undergarments.

loans.name: Lalao

texts.fr:
Lalao est une femme entreprenante âgée de 34 ans. Elle est mariée avec 4 enfants à charge. Elle vit à la campagne et pratique l’élevage bovin et l’élevage porcin. 
Elle a déjà pris des prêts auparavant pour ouvrir une épicerie. Pour ce prêt, elle compte acheter des aliments pour les porcins. En effet, elle veut engraisser ses porcins et les vendre aux bouchers de la ville. 
Les bénéfices vont permettre d’assurer l’éducation des enfants. Une partie sera mise de côté pour faire face aux imprévus.
texts.en:
Lalao is an enterprising 34-year-old woman.  She is married and has four children under her care.  She lives in the countryside and raises cows and pigs.

Lalao has taken loans before, which have helped her to open a grocery shop.  She now plans to use this loan to buy fodder for her pigs.  Her goal is to fatten them up and then resell them to the butchers in town.

Lalao will use her profits to take care of her children's education and will also save a part of her earnings to be able to deal with unforeseen circumstances.

loans.use: to buy pig fodder in order to fatten them up and resell them to butchers.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino, who is a 30-year-old young woman, lives in Kutaisi, West Georgia. She lives alone and has no source of income to satisfy even her basic needs. Nino lives in poverty and requires a stable source of income to tackle her financial difficulties. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living.  So, she decided to start a trading business with a loan, but local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers.  Nino’s credit requests were rejected several times because she was unable to satisfy their requirements. She received the credit from a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Their Startup Program gives poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the loan Nino will purchase working materials and start making crafts on her own. She will sell the handmade things locally at a good price.

This will give her a chance to earn an income and have a better living condition for herself, as well as, expand the business in the future. Nino relies on the good will of Kiva lenders and will be very thankful for the financial assistance.

loans.use: to start making crafts to sell locally.

loans.name: San Lucas Group

texts.es:
El grupo “San Lucas” está en su 1º ciclo, las integrantes están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3  de las 20 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema.
Cada una de ellas pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder crecer, pero se destaca entre ellas la Sra. Susana, una persona muy trabajadora, que por medio de su esfuerzo esta ganándose la vida de una manera digna y honrada.
Pide este préstamo ya que quiere surtir su despensa con productos variados, como ser carne, verduras, frutas, bebidas, panificados y otros, y así seguir mejorando en su negocio y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
San Lucas group is on its 1st loan cycle. They are participating in the elimination of poverty survey, where 3 of the 20 members fall under the poverty line, that is, extreme poverty.
Each of them puts all they've got to grow, but Susana stands out. She is hardworking and thanks to her efforts she's been able to earn her living honestly and earnestly.
She is asking for this loan to stock her grocery store with a variety of products such as meat, vegetables, drinks, bread and other items, to keep improving her business and keep up with her customers.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as meat, vegetables, drinks, bread and other items

loans.name: Ra'ed

texts.en:
Ra'ed is a 24-year-old, single man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, next to the Refugee Camp with the same name. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

So, Ra'ed took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Ra'ed will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Ra'ed’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Ra'ed appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Yahea

texts.en:
Yahea is a 24-year-old, single man from Rafah City, which is located in the Gaza Strip, next to the refugee camp with the same name. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.
 
So, Yahea took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Yahea will be able to decrease electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas).  Yahea’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Yahea appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Iyad

texts.en:
Iyad is a 43-year-old, married man from Jabalia City, which is located in the Gaza Strip, next to the refugee camp with the same name. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.
 
So, Iyad took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Iyad will be able to decrease electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas).  Iyad’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Iyad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is a 54-year-old married woman and has six children, two of whom are still attending school. She earns a living by selling snack food such as banana chips and banana cue (deep fried banana with caramelized sugar) to the locals in her place. She resides in Antequera, Bohol.

She is a hard worker who is trying desperately to develop her business, but she is also a sacrificing mother who deprives herself for the sake of her children. She has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner CEVI to buy more ingredients like flour, bananas, edible oil and sugar. In that way her production will improve.

Genara hopes to expand her business more in the future by investing in another source of income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like flour, bananas, edible oil and sugar.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria's source of income is weaving native baskets made of buri (palm). She resides in the town of Antequera with her husband and her eight children, one of whom is still attending school.

She would like to gain higher output in a week but she has very limited resources to make her baskets. Maria has joined CEVI to access a loan to cater to her financial needs. She has requested a loan to invest in materials like nito, buli (a variety of palm) and wicker (pliable twig).

In the future, Maria is hoping that she will become successful in her project to improve the family’s living conditions and continue to finance the schooling of her child in preparation for a brighter tomorrow.

loans.use: to invest in materials like nito, buli (a variety of palm) and wicker (pliable twig).

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Michelle is 31 years old and all four children are attending school.

Michelle has a business buying and selling lumber in the Philippines. Michelle requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more wood for her lumber business.

Michelle has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more wood for her lumber business.

loans.name: Lalyn

texts.en:
Lalyn is 38 years old. She is married with two children, both of whom are in school.

Lalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries like canned goods, body lotion, spices and other groceries.

Lalyn has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from clothing retail.

Lalyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like canned goods, body lotion, spices and other groceries.

loans.name: Action De Grace Group

texts.fr: Bajagahe est un entrepreneur, qui gère un poulailler à son domicile, membre du groupe solidaire «Action de Grace», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 27 ans, mariée, mère de 3 enfants dont 2 scolarisés et 1 est encore bébé. Elle est vendeuse des poussins dans la ville depuis 2 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 500 poussins et leurs aliments. Elle commença son business avec le capital reçu de la tontine. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Bajagahe is a business owner who manages a henhouse at her home. She is a member of the collective group "Action de Grace" (Thanksgiving), a client of IMF Hekima. Bajagahe is 27 years old, married and the mother of three children, two of whom are in school and one is still a baby. She has been selling chicks in the village for two years. She began her business with capital received from the group. She will buy a flock of 500 chicks and their feed. She wants to increase her credit, educate and feed her children. Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support provided to unbankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy a flock of 500 chicks and their feed

loans.name: Luvisminda

texts.en:
Luvisminda is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Luvisminda is 40 years old and all three children are attending school.

Luvisminda has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines. Luvisminda requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy wheels and other tools for her tricycle passenger.

Luvisminda has been in this business for three years. In the future, Luvisminda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wheels and other tools for her tricycle passenger.

loans.name: Consuelo Elizabeth

texts.es:
Consuelo de 30 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, es madre soltera de 3 hijos pues su pareja la abandonó y ella sola ha tenido que sacar adelante a su familia.

Consuelo trabaja en un colegio católico, ella es la encargada de atender el chalet donde realiza ventas a los estudiantes, además de vez en cuando se dedica a la agricultura actividad que aprendió de su madre,  ya que esta fue la fuente primordial para su desarrollo y ella se lo enseñó desde muy pequeña, y también se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Ella quiere iniciar una tienda de forma independiente, es por eso que solicita este crédito para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, café, bebidas, golosinas, frijoles, pan, etc. Y surtir la tienda.

Su mayor sueño es brindarles a sus hijos lo necesario con el estudio, es decir que estos se conviertan en personas profesionales con una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Consuelo, 30 years old, doesn't have the opportunity to study. She is a single mother of 3 children since her partner abandoned them, and she alone has had to help her family along.

Consuelo works at a Catholic school. She is in charge of running the snack bar, where she sells snacks to the students. In addition, she sometimes works as a farmer. It was her primary source of development, she having learned it at a very young age from her mother. She also does domestic work.

Consuelo wants to start a store of her own. This is why she is requesting a loan to purchase products like rice, sugar, coffee, beverages, sweets, beans, bread, etc. to stock her store. Her greatest dream is to give her children what they need in order to get an education so they can become professionals with a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase products like rice, sugar, coffee, beverages, sweets, beans, bread, etc. and stock her store.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan de 39 años de edad es agricultor, solo estudió hasta quinto grado de educación primaria, actualmente está acompañado y tiene tres hijos de los cuales los tres están estudiando y su esposa ayuda en los oficios del hogar.

Desde hace mucho tiempo, Juan trabajaba con su padre en la agricultura, luego un amigo le enseñó a  trabajar en la carpintería, oficio del cual aprendió mucho y luego puso con mucho esfuerzo su propio taller en su casa también cuida sus animales como lo son vacas y sigue con su actividad de agricultura pues actualmente cultiva dos hectáreas de maíz.

El crédito que él solicita lo necesita para comprar unas herramientas para su taller de carpintería  y otra parte para comprar insumos agrícolas para terminar su cosecha.

Su objetivo principal es mejorar su taller ya que se siente deficiente con las herramientas que le hacen falta.
texts.en:
Juan, 39 years old, is a farmer. He only studied until fifth grade of primary education. He is currently in a relationship and has three children of which the three are studying; his wife helps in the household chores.

Since long ago, Juan worked with his father in agriculture. Then, a friend taught him to work in carpentry, a trade which he learned a lot from. Later, he painstakingly put his own workshop at home. He also takes care of his animals such as cows and continues his farming occupation as he is currently cultivating two hectares of corn.

The loan that he is requesting will be needed to buy some tools for his woodworking shop and another part to buy agricultural inputs to complete his crop yield. Juan's main objective is to improve his workshop since he feels deficient with the tools that he lacks.

loans.use: to buy some tools for his woodworking shop and to buy agricultural inputs to complete his crop yield.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.fr: Agée de 67 ans, Lydia est une femme mariée et mère de trois enfants. Pour exercer ses activités, Lydia vit à Adidogomé et vend des objets en plastiques à domicile et en circulant les quartiers environnant pour  gagner son revenu. Lydia s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et désire ce crédit pour commander des unités de bassines en plastiques de cent et deux-cent litres en vue de bien revendre et trouver un gain nécessaire pour aider son mari dans l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants et avoir un épanouissement.
texts.en: Aged 67 years old, Lydia is a married woman and mother of three children. To operate her business, Lydia lives in Adidogomé and sells plastic objects at home and as an itinerant vendor in nearby neighborhoods to earn an income. Lydia buys her supplies twice a month at the market and is requesting this loan to order units of 100 and 200 liters of plastic bassins. She hopes to make better sales and profits to help her husband in her children's education and to be fulfilled.

loans.use: to buy 12 units of 100l bassins and 12 units of 200l bassins.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Abra est une femme divorcée âgée de 39 ans qui vit à Adidogomé. Mère d’un seul enfant, Abra s’efforce  pour gagner son revenu  en revendant des articles de mercerie et des tissus dans sa boutique. Pour s’approvisionner, Abra se rend une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des pièces de tissus pantalons et des rouleaux de doublures, Abra nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera suite à une bonne revente, Abra va pouvoir aider son enfant dans son éducation scolaire et agrandir son commerce.
texts.en: Abra is 39 years old, divorced, ans she lives in Adidogomé.  She only has one child. She works very hard to make a living and resells sewing supplies and fabrics in her own shop.  She stocks up at the market once a month.  She is taking this loan to buy a few units of pants' fabrics as well as some rolls of lining cloth.  Thanks to the profit margin that she will be able to make with increased sales, Abra will be in a position to take care of her child's education and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy four units of pants' fabrics and two rolls of lining cloth.

loans.name: Sultan

texts.en:
Sultan is a 56-year-old married man from Jabalia city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, next to the refugee camp with the same name. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all of the family's needs, and he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

Sultan took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Sultan will be able to decrease their electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Sultan’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Sultan appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Fahid

texts.en:
Fahid is a 31-year-old married man from Jabalia city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, next to the refugee camp with the same name. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all of the family's needs. He wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

Fahid took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family's house. By taking this loan, Fahid will be able to decrease their electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Fahid’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Fahid appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Iyad

texts.en:
Iyad is a 39-year-old married man from Jabalia city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, next to the refugee camp with the same name. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all of the family's needs. He wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

Iyad took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family's house. By taking this loan, Iyad will be able to decrease their electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Iyad’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Iyad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy general merchandise like sugar, soap, and drinks.

loans.name: Maram

texts.en:
Maram is 26 years old, is single, and lives with her parents in Baqaa which is a refugee camp. She sells cosmetics and perfumes from her house. Her home-based business aims to take good care of her family. She depends on herself to cover her needs and improve her standard of living.

Since her business income currently is specialized for their family's daily living needs, Maram requested a youth loan from Kiva which she will use to increase her business merchandise and purchase cosmetics and perfumes. She hopes to develop her business in the future so that when she finds a suitable time, she can move the business outside her house.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise and purchase cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Ángel Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ángel de 38 años de edad, no posee gran nivel de escolaridad, actualmente está acompañada y tiene dos hijos de los cuales uno de ellos está estudiando bachillerato y el otro está estudiando educación básica.

Desde que era una niña, Ángel trabajaba en la agricultura junto con sus hermanos, pero luego se acompañó y su pareja le ayudó económicamente a poner un pequeño negocio de comida el cual posee desde hace 10 años, este puesto lo tiene en el mercado de su pueblo.

El dinero de este crédito lo necesita para pagar a aun arquitecto que le está ayudando a ampliar su negocio.

El propósito que ella tiene es mejorar su negocio, ya que si lo mejora tendrá mejoras ingresos y así podrá pagar los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ángel is 38 years old. She doesn't have a high level of education and she is in a relationship and has two children, one of whom is studying in high school and the other is in elementary school.
Ángel had worked in agriculture along with her siblings since she was a child, but then she got into a relationship and her partner supported her financially to launch a small food business which she has now had for ten years. This stall is located in the market of her town. 
She needs the money from this loan in order to pay an architect who is helping her expand her business. Her aim is to improve her business, since improving it will increase her income and enable her to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for an architect to expand her business.

loans.name: Abla Akpédzé Nicole

texts.fr: Mariée,  Abla est  âgée de 38 ans et mère de trois enfants. Abla vie à Adidogomé où elle produit et vend des amuses gueules d’arachides et des boissons. Abla s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché chez un grossiste et le revend au bord de la route dans son quartier. Abla sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des bols d’arachides et des cartons de boissons vins. Ce crédit lui permettra  d’avoir une plus grande quantité de marchandises, ce qui lui permettra de réaliser plus de revenu et mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en: Abla is 38 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  She lives in Adidogomé where she sells drinks and also prepares and sells snack foods made with groundnuts.  She stocks up three times per month from a wholesaler at the market and resells her merchandise on the side of the road, in her own neighborhood.  She is taking this loan to buy a few bowlfuls of groundnuts and some crates of wine.  Thanks to this loan, she will increase her stock of merchandise, which will in turn allow her to boost her income and take better care of the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy seven bowlfuls of groundnuts and three crates of wine.

loans.name: Muneer

texts.en:
Muneer is a 40-years-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and two kids in a simple house. Muneer works as an employee in a local company where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. He would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy some necessary items.

Muneer took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family house. By taking this loan, Muneer will be able to provide clean water, especially for his kids. Muneer appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva earns a living by selling dried fish. She rents a stall inside the marketplace in her town. She is a 49-year old married woman and has four children, one of whom attends school. Her husband is a carpenter.

Dried fish is currently in high demand. Unfortunately, Eva has very limited capital to continue to finance her business. She wants to purchase variety of dried fish and salt, which will allow her quantity and improve her income.

Eva hopes that she can continue to strive to support the welfare of her family and to have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of dried fish and salt.

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani is a 40-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and four kids in a simple house. Hani works as an employee in a local company where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. He would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy some necessary items.

Hani took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family house. By taking this loan, Hani will be able to provide clean water, especially for his kids.
Hani appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 45-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and four kids in a simple house. Ahmad works as an employee in a local company where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. He would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy some necessary items.

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family house. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to provide clean water, especially for his kids.
Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Lorejane

texts.en:
Lorejane is 25 years old and married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lorejane has a frozen food retailing business in the Philippines. Lorejane requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more frozen food to sell.

Lorejane has been in this business for two years. In the future, Lorejane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more frozen food to sell.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is a hard working 37-year-old entrepreneur.  She is married and has two children, one of whom attends school.

For 2 years Jonah has operated a general store business in the Philippines.  She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods and personal care products to sell in her store.

In the future, Jonah would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods and personal care products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Vicente Dimas

texts.es:
Vicente, de 53 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está acompañado y su pareja vende en su tienda, juntos tienen tres hijos pero dos viven en sus propias casas y solo uno está estudiando.

Vicente, tiene venta de leche desde hace 15 años; inicio esta venta gracias a su madre quien le enseño como se hacía el negocio, pero también posee una tienda en su casa junto a su pareja, la cual se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para iniciar a vender.    
 
Vicente, necesita el préstamo para comprar tres bovinos pequeños de repasto, el préstamo mejorara su ganadería y tendrá más ingresos.

Vicente, sueña con tener más ganado bovino para producir más leche e incrementar la venta.
texts.en:
Vicente, who is 53-years old, went to school until fifth grade. He is married, and his wife runs a small store. Together, they have three children. Two of their children live in their own homes and one goes to school.

Vicente has had a business selling milk for fifteen years. He was able to start the business thanks to his mother, who taught him how to run the business. Vicente and his wife also run a small store out of their home. Vicente gets up at 5 o'clock in the morning to start his sales.

Vicente needs the loan to purchase three small grazing cows. The loan will improve his cattle business and he will earn a larger income.

Vicente hopes to have more cattle to produce more milk and increase his sales.

loans.use: to purchase three young grazing cows.

loans.name: Bilal And Ola Group

texts.en:
As a husband and wife, Ola and Bilal started their own business to provide a living for their children. They have four sons and they need a lot of care. Bilal is working for a low income and he cannot cover all of his family's needs, especially after the Syrian crises, since Jordanian and Syrian refugees are competing in the labor market. Because Syrians are accepting lower salaries, many business owners are not hiring as many Jordanians as before. Monthly salaries now range between 120-150 dinars.

That's why Ola decided to help Bilal by starting her small business. She opened a grocery which sells food supplies and ready clothes. After that, Bilal felt that Ola's business was working well and doing well at improving their life with their children. Thus he thought to partner with her and develop the business to increase their income. Ola said that she is excited to work with her husband. She believes that the business will be better with him. Therefore, they applied for a group loan to take the first step and buy a large quantity of food supplies such as candies, chips, and soft drinks and to add new kinds of products, as well as to buy more winter clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of food supplies such as candies, chips, and soft drinks, and to add new kinds of products, as well as to buy more winter clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 22-year-old single man who lives with his parents. He runs a sheep farm in Khanyounes in the Gaza Strip. The farm is next to his parents' house.

Mohammad works alone on his farm. He has taken a loan from the Arab Center for Agricultural Development to start his business with the purchase of sheep and materials needed to prepare his farm. The farm is the sole source of income for Mohammad and his parents. In addition to the hard political situation in Gaza, Mohammad says that the challenges for his business are livestock price fluctuations and the high expense of fodder.

The extra income from this loan will help Mohammad to improve his family's standard of living. In the future, he would like to expand his business and sell additional livestock on his farm.

Mohammad thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy new sheep so he can start his business.

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr: Hélène est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomé. Hélène est une revendeuse de friperies d’habits et de chaussures qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend en circulant dans les quartiers environnant .Pour avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin de répondre à nombreuse attentes de ses clients, Hélène sollicite ce crédit pour commander des unités de robes et des chaussures de friperies en vue de gagner des bénéfices pour venir en aide à  son mari aux diverses charges quotidiennes éprouvées par la famille.
texts.en: Hélène is a married woman who lives in Adidogomé.  She buys and sells used clothes and shoes and stocks up at the market three times per month.  She resells her merchandise as an itinerant seller in the surrounding neighborhoods.  Hélène wants to increase her stock of goods, maximize her profits, and meet her customers' many needs, which is the reason why she is taking this loan to buy dresses and used shoes.  Thanks to this loan, she will be able to  make some profits which will in turn allow her to help her husband take care of the various expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy 20 dresses and 20 pairs of used shoes.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a 41-year-old married woman with five children residing in the town of Clarin. Her husband earns a living as a bus driver. In front of the house she owns, she runs a sari-sari (variety) store that caters mostly to locals in her area. She sells various items including beverages, seasonings, noodles, canned goods, and toiletries. In addition, she also raises and sells hogs and sells gasoline.

Florencia has requested a loan to purchase beverages, noodles, additional piglets, and purchase supplies of gasoline. She would like to improve her earnings by making bulk purchases of out of stock commodities.

In the future, Florencia is looking forward to having a stable source of income and extends thanks for the support.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, noodles, additional piglets, and supplies of gasoline.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 58 years old and married with two children.  She works very hard to provide for her family.

For 2 years Betty has operated a general store in the Philippines selling a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo, sanitary pads, diapers, toothpaste, and noodles.  She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more of these items to sell.

Betty would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, shampoo, sanitary pads, diapers, toothpaste, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en: Noor is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. Her husband earns a low income which isn't ‎enough to cover his children's needs. Because of that, Noor has started her own business selling wedding dresses in a shop which is ‎rented to her husband for her. Because her business was profitable, she is planning to expand it in the future by opening her ‎own dress store to raise her profits. Now she is seeking a loan to transfer her dresses and her products to a new shop that she has rented ‎to expand her business.‎

loans.use: to transfer her dresses and her products to a new shop that she has rented ‎to expand her business.‎

loans.name: Saera

texts.en:
Saera, 36, is married and lives in Baqaa, Jordan. Three years ago without anyone’s help she started selling blankets and tablecloths to earn an income.

Saera’s difficulty is that she has little in capital to invest in her business. She has applied for a 516 JOD loan through Kiva's field partner National Microfinance Bank to buy more blankets, bedspreads and tablecloths to increase her profits and so increase ‎her liquid assets.‎

loans.use: to buy more blankets, bedspreads and tablecloths to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia de 61 años de edad es una mujer muy emprendedora y luchadora quien vive junto con su hijo el cual trabaja como docente en un centro educativo.

Desde que era una niña a Alicia le gustaba mucho las actividades de comercio y desde hace seis años se dedica al negocio de venta de pólvora para las fiestas navideñas.

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar cohetes y mucha variedad de juegos pirotécnicos, pues quiere aprovechar la temporada navideña.

El sueño que ella tiene es que este año pueda tener bien surtido su negocio de pólvora para obtener excelentes ganancias.
texts.en:
Alicia is 61-years old. She is a very enterprising and hard-working woman. She lives with her son, who works as a teacher at an academy.

Since she was a girl, Alicia has liked business very much. For the last six years, she has made her living selling explosive powders for Christmas festivities.

Alicia needs this loan to purchase fireworks and a large variety of pyrotechnic toys, as she wants to make the most of the Christmas season.

Alicia's dream is to have her business well stocked fireworks this year so she can earn an excellent profit.

loans.use: to purchase fireworks and a large variety of pyrotechnical toys as she wants to make the most of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Fayza

texts.en:
Fayzeh was born in Irbid in 1965. She is married and a mother of four children. Fayzeh is married to a man who is very poor and he cannot cover all of his family's needs. Fayzeh believes that she has to raise her children in a good environment and to ensure that they get a good education so that they will be able to find good work in the future.

But the life difficulties were more strong from Fayzeh's ability. Fayzeh did not stop trying to help her husband with their life expenses generally, especially after he fell ill. She opened a grocery beside her home to help her husband to pay for his treatment and to help him with the expenses. Her small business was covering her family's needs with support from her husband's work as a salesman in bakery.

Fayzeh started her business five years ago and now she needs to develop and expand it. Therefore she applied for a loan to expand her grocery and buy more products such as canned foods, chips, candies, soft drinks, food supplies, juices, etc. Fayzeh is a mother who is ambitious and patient and she deserves that support from you to become an example for the other women.

loans.use: to expand her grocery and buy more products such as canned foods, chips, candies, soft drinks, food supplies, juices, etc.

loans.name: Wadha

texts.en: Wadha is a 38-year-old single woman living in Hebron, Palestine. Wadha has a clothing store. She has a successful story with ACAD, previously completing one loan. Now she chose to take a loan to increase her stock and improve her income. She wants to expand her store and improve her standard of living. The main challenge in running her business is not finding the ideal place for her store, and the other challenge is the high competition in the same market. In the future, Wadha plans to change her store location and open a new one in a typical location in downtown Hebron. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothing for her store

loans.name: Lilia Elena

texts.es:
Lilia es una mujer trabajadora e independiente de 50 años de edad. Está casada y vive en la Ciudad de México. Estudió la licenciatura en diseño gráfico, se dedica de lleno a su empresa, la cual tiene desde 1998 y se brinda específicamente diseño de señalizaciones.
Durante muchos años, Lilia fue gerente de mercadotecnia en una empresa aseguradora y tuvo la oportunidad de alcanzar grandes objetivos profesionales. Sin embargo, esa empresa sufrió un recorte de personal en el cual Lilia perdió su trabajo.
Más tarde, a Lilia le ofrecieron dirigir un proyecto el cual cancelaron al poco tiempo. Ante esto, Lilia supo aprovechar una nueva oportunidad que se le presentó y fue como inició su propia empresa.
Su empresa, es ahora una referencia en diseño gráfico, está reconocida por la organización “We Connect International” la cual certifica empresas lideradas por mujeres. Esta organización permite a las 87 empresas que certifica, tener un acercamiento con grandes compañías para que incrementes sus ventas y prosperen más. 
Siendo nombrada por tercer año consecutivo como “caso de éxito” y con la motivación de realizar un contrato con una constructora que le brinda la oportunidad de “vestir” un estacionamiento, Lilia solicitó un crédito para poder financiar material y topes y de esa manera llevar a cabo la alianza.
texts.en:
Lilia is a hardworking, independent woman. She is 50 years old, she's married and she lives in Mexico City. She studied graphic design and she is fully devoted to her company since its founding in 1998. Her main focus is street signs design.
Lilia was a marketing manager for serveral years at an insurance company and she had the chance to achieve many of her professional goals. However, the company suffered a series of lay off and Lilia lost her job.
Later on, Lilia was offered the opportunity to lead a project, but it was canceled shortly after. In light of this, Lilia took advantage of an opportunity she came across and decided to start her own company.
Today, her company is a reference in graphic design, she's been recognized by “We Connect International” who certifies companies led by women. This organization allows the 87 companies it certifies to get in touch with large companies to increase sales and to prosper.
Having been named a "sucessful case" three years in a row, and with the motivation to sign a contract with a construction company that will allow her to renovate her facilities, Lilia asked for a loan to finance the purchase of supplies to form a partnership.

loans.use: to buy supplies to be able to form a partnership

loans.name: Mamdouh

texts.en:
Mamdouh is a 25-year-old single man from Rafah City, Palestine.  He lives with his family in a small house.  The family owns a metal workshop, a very good business, where the entire family cooperate together to work.  

Mamdouh is learning how to sell and how to operate the business, so he took a USD loan from FATEN in order to buy a new machine for the family workshop.  This investment in a fixed asset will help them to increase their sales and income.  

With the increase in income, Mamdouh and his family hope to expand their project.  Mamdouh appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new machine for the family workshop.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is an amazing mother who lives in Bethlehem City. She has two children. She is working hard to ensure a good life for them and ensure that they do not need anything. Faten's husband works as an employee, but he is not able to cover all of the needs for his big family. She wants to help him in any way she can because she is a very productive and ambitious woman. So she decided to open her own business.

Faten started her business 10 years ago. She manufactures souvenirs from holy olive wood to sell. After she felt that she had a good experience in this business, she decided to expand and develop her work. Therefore she applied for a loan to help her buy a new machine to engrave to increase her income. She needs your support to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: buy a new  machine to engrave to increase her income.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a married woman with 5 children, 2 of whom still attend school. She lives with her family in the town of Sierra Bullones. Florencia's main source of income is raising hogs, which helps her cover the expenses of the entire household. She sells hogs to the locals and town settlers in her community.

Florencia has requested a loan to invest in feed and piglets. She would like to boost her earnings by raising more quality hogs and having a sufficient supply of feed to become sustainable. With the additional income, she could set aside enough savings to invest in additional business opportunities.

In the future, Florencia is looking forward increasing her livelihood, expanding her business, and becoming sustainable. She extends thanks for the support.

loans.use: to invest in feed and piglets.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a married woman with five children, with 1 child still in school.  She is 53 years old and is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

For 3 years Florencia has operated a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines.  She requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers.

Florencia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
‎ Rahimeh is 50 years old and lives in Dairalla with her husband and her children. She is a very adorable woman and wants to ‎provide a good life for her children. She is working hard to see her family live comfortably and not need anything. ‎Rahimeh is helping her husband. She has been selling blankets and table covers. She felt that her business was working ‎well, therefore she added ready clothes to her business to increase her income. ‎

Now Rahimeh is thinking of expanding her business, therefore she applied for a loan to help her buy more ready clothes to ‎sell. Since she does not have money, she applied for a loan to help her do what she wants. ‎

loans.use: to help her buy more ready clothes to ‎sell and purchase more blankets.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casada y su esposo  trabaja como albañil y tienen un hijo que ya comenzó a estudiar.

María, tiene una tienda de productos de primera necesidad desde hace 1 año, pues a través de este negocio le ayuda a su esposo económicamente, la tienda está en su casa y nadie se involucra en su negocio y su horario de trabajo    comienza a las seis de la mañana.   

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar detergentes y granos básicos para incrementar su negocio, el préstamo mejorara sus ventas porque tendrá más mercadería.

María, sueña con tener una tienda más amplia, para que las personas encuentren todo tipo de productos en un mismo lugar.
texts.en:
María is 31-years old. She went to school until ninth grade. She is married, and her husband works as a brick layer. They have one son, who has started school.

For the last year, María has had a store selling basic needs items. Through her business, she helps her husband financially. The store is located in her home, and nobody else is involved in the business. María starts work at six o'clock in the morning.

María needs the loan to purchase detergents and staple grains so she can expand her business. The loan will improve her sales because she will have more merchandise.

María hopes to have a larger store so that her customers can find all manner of products in one place.

loans.use: to purchase detergents and staple grains so she can expand her business.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Sur la photo, Korotimi est la femme assise en tenant le tourteau dans un récipient. Elle a 39 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont  4 écoliers. Elle fait l’élevage de bœufs et de moutons depuis huit ans, son mari est un cultivateur. Korotimi fait recourt au prêt pour acheter plus de bœufs et moutons pour son élevage enfin de gagner beaucoup de bénéfices. Elle respect ses échéance de remboursement depuis qu’elle travaille avec le RMCR.
Korotimi est analphabète mais elle se souci de la  scolarisation de ses enfants. Les bénéfices du prêt l’aide à prendre en charge sa familiale dans le domaine de la santé de l’alimentation etc... Elle s’approvisionne au marché local de n’togonasso et ses ventes se vont en détail au même marché. Elle réalise un bénéfice mensuel de 5 000f CFA après ses dépenses. Les obstacles auxquels elle se heurte  est que souvent aliment bétail devient un peu chère au marché elle rêve de devenir un jour une grande femme d'affaire pour apporter sa contribution dans le développement de sa localité.
texts.en: Korotimi is the one seated and holding a dish in the photo. She is 39 years old, married with seven children, four of whom are in school. She has been breeding beef cattle and sheep for eight years and her husband is a farmer. Korotimi is requesting this loan to buy more cattle and sheep for breeding to increase her profits. She respects the reimbursement terms since she has been working with the RMCR. Korotimi is illiterate but she cares about her children's education. The benefits of the loans will help her support her family in terms of health, food etc... She buys her supplies at the local market of n'togonasso and sells retail at the local market. Her monthly revenue, after her business expenses, is 5,000 CFA francs. The rising market prices on animal feed are often a challenge for her. She dreams to become a great business women one day to contribute to the development of her community.

loans.use: to raise cattle and sheep for sale

loans.name: Khaledah

texts.en:
Khaleda is a married woman and a mother of two children living in Salt. She is an ambitious woman who has a strong ‎sense of responsibility towards her family. She started working in mosaic at various showrooms and gained experience ‎from them. She improved her talent in making mosaic and started working on her own at the house. She brought mosaic ‎tools and a cupboard that are needed for her work. She also brought a mixer which distinguished her work by making it ‎easier and more professional. ‎

It was hard for her to find a place which was commensurate with her financial situation when she decided to open her own ‎mosaic showroom five years ago. But eventually she got awards for her great work, and she took more than loan, which ‎helped her establish her showroom and add racks and tools.‎

Khaledas’ great work gave her the opportunity of participating in showrooms. Her project didn’t stop growing. She was ‎also a helpful woman, and employed 11 girls and 3 men at her showroom to help them support their families. She also ‎bought a car to do some marketing for her business. Her talent has improved her standards, and now she wants to buy ‎raw materials, color for the mosaic, and gypsum to make more products to sell and increase her income. ‎

loans.use: to buy ‎raw materials, color for the mosaic, and gypsum to make more products to sell and increase her income.

loans.name: Rowaidah

texts.en:
‎ Rowaidah is 52 years old and lives with her children in Baqaa, which is a refugee camp. Rowaidah's husband is ‎working as accountant in one of the companies in Jordan but his income is not enough to cover all of his family's needs. They ‎have a son, Yazan, who appears in the photo instead of Rowidah because she is a conservative woman. ‎

Yazan is studying to be lawyer in the future and he is very excited to graduate and start his job. However, his father could not ‎cover his semester fees. Rowidah mentions that it is a great hardship with all the needs to be able to pay for Yazan's ‎education in a limited period of time. She asks for an educational loan in order to pay the tuition fees for Yazan's first ‎semester.‎

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees.

loans.name: Jovenes Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
El comité  de Jóvenes Emprendedores  está en su  2º ciclo, todos  tienen sus actividades que le generan ingresos y que les ayudara para una mejor calidad de vida, con lo cual también ayudan en sus casas con los gastos del día a día.
Una de las integrantes es Sara quien  se dedica a la venta de Flores y Velas en su casa y también se dedica al fútbol femenino. Es una joven con mucho entusiasmo, quiere salir adelante, es por ello que pone todo de si.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de flores variadas y velas para poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Jóvenes Emprendedores committee is on its 2nd loan cycle. They all have their individual activities that generate income that help them improve their quality of life, and also help their household expenses day by day.
One of its members, Sara sells flowers and candles out of her home and she also plays women's soccer. She is a young woman full of energy that wants to get ahead, so she's all into this project.
She is asking for this loan to to buy a varierty of flowers and candles to keep up with her sales.

loans.use: to buy a varierty of flowers and candles for sale.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her bakery business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Evelyn's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a 21-year-old married woman with one child.. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Arlene has a business buying and selling fruit in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fruit to sell in her food stall.

Arlene has been in this business for two years. In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 38 years old and married with three children.

Ofelia is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

Ofelia has been farming rice for six years now. She has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF, and more recently from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en:
Lorie is 34 years old and married with one child.

Lorie is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Lorie requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lorie has been farming rice for three years now. She has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF, and more recently from Kiva, to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school.  She is 33 years old and is a very hard working entrepreneur.

For 4 years Florencia has operated a general store business in the Philippines.  She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.  She successfully repaid her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Florencia would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Romeo Alexander

texts.es:
Romeo, de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está soltero y vive con su madre y una sobrina.

Romeo, tiene 15 años de trabajar en la siembra de granos básicos y en la crianza de ganado bovino, estos oficios los aprendió de su padre; actualmente siembra 14,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz y cría ganado, los terrenos que cultiva están cerca de su vivienda y las labores las realiza junto a su madre, pues de esas dos actividades generan los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos de la casa.

Romeo, necesita el préstamo para comprar ganado e incrementar su ganadería.

Romeo, sueña con estudiar para cocinero y además le gustaría seguir invirtiendo para que crezca el número de ganado.
texts.en:
Romeo, 29 years old, has his high school diploma, is single, and lives with his mother and a niece. He has been working for 15 years as a farmer of basic grains and in cattle ranching, and learned them both from his father.

He currently farms 14,000 square meters of land for corn and cattle. The land he farms is close to his home, and he works alongside his mother. These two activities generate the income they need to cover the household expenses.

Romeo needs a loan to purchase cattle to increase his herd. He dreams of studying to become a chef and would also like to continue investing to increase his herd of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to increase his livestock.

loans.name: Hilda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Hilda, de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja como agricultor y ganadero, juntos tienen cuatro hijos que ya viven aparte y solo una menor vive con ella.

Hilda, tiene una venta de panes y refrescos desde hace 1 año, este negocio lo inicio con su madre; pero aparte de eso también vende perfumes y cremas, antes solo se dedicaba a los oficios de su casa; ahora su hija se involucra en el negocio y su horario de trabajo comienza a las 10 de la mañana, hasta que termina la venta.  
                                                                                                               Hilda, necesita el préstamo para comprar bebidas y golosinas para incrementar su negocio; el préstamo le ayudará para mejorar sus ventas.

Hilda, sueña con colocar una tienda más amplia, donde los clientes encuentren todo tipo de productos y a través de ella mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Hilda is 40-years old. She went to school until ninth grade. She is married, and her husband works as a farmer and rancher. They have four children who live on their own; only one young daughter lives with them.

For the last year, Hilda has run a shop selling bread and beverages. She started the business with her mother. In addition, Hilda sells perfumes and lotions. Previously, Hilda was a homemaker. Now, her daughter is in involved in the business. Hilda starts work at 10 o'clock in the morning and works until the sales have finished.

Hilda needs the loan to purchase beverages and sweets so she can expand her business. The loan will help her to improve her sales.

Hilda hopes to open a larger store where her customers can find all manner of products. And through the store, she would be able to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase beverages and sweets to expand her business.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona hails from the town of Carmen. She is a 43-year-old married woman and has four dependents, one of whom still attends school. She earns a living selling dried fish at the local market in her community. She has sold dried fish for many years, serving mostly town dwellers.

Chona successfully repaid her previous loan and now has requested a new loan to further better her livelihood. She has requested a loan to buy more supplies of dried fish and increase her yield. With a higher yield, her earnings will improve and she will be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more supplies of dried fish

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven de 24 años de edad, es una persona trabajadora y honesta,  por falta de capacidad económica no pudo tener un alto nivel de estudio y ahora se encuentra casado.

Este joven tiene 6 años de trabajar en la crianza de pollos y además tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace 3 años, ahora que tiene su esposa han tomado a bien superarse en lo que es el negocio.

El préstamo lo va utilizar para comprar mas pollos y mas productos de primera necesidad para su tienda.

Él sueña con que su negocio sea próspero para salir adelante y que en su hogar no falte lo necesario.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 24-year old young man. He is a hard-working and honest person. Due to a lack of financial resources, he wasn't able to go to school very long. Carlos is now married.

This young man has been raising chickens for six years. In addition, he has run a small store for three years. Now that he is married, Carlos and his wife have seen the brighter side of improving their situation through the business.

The loan will be used to purchase more chickens and more basic necessities for their store.

Carlos's hopes are for his business to prosper and to get ahead so that his household never lacks anything necessary.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens and more basic necessities for his store.

loans.name: Thafer

texts.en:
Thafer is a 22-year-old student, single, and lives in a sector of Jordan called Ramtha.  He is in his third year at the university majoring finance. 

Thafer is in a bad financial situation.  He is applying for a loan to pay off his university fees and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to pay off his university fees.

loans.name: Donaldo Enrique

texts.es: Donaldo, tiene 39 años de edad, está casado, tiene 3 hijos y reside en el municipio de Yoro. Donaldo siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, lleva 15 años de dedicarse a vender productos de achinería como ser reloj, lentes, carteras, billeteras, fajas, accesorios para teléfonos, protectores y cargadores de celulares, y otra mercadería que le piden sus clientes. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante. El préstamo que solicita es el cuarto ciclo en ODEF y es por 7,500 Lempiras con el cual va comprar más mercadería como ser carteras, accesorios para celulares, billeteras, reloj y otros. El piensa aprovechar a comprar de contado y con descuentos para poder vender en esta temporada de fin de año y obtener mejores ganancias. Su plan a futuro es mejorar su casa, eso le motiva seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Donaldo is 39 years old. He is married with 3 children and he lives in the municipality of Yoro. Donaldo has always been a businessman. He's been in the business for 15 years selling gift shop items such as watches, glasses, purses, wallets, sashes, cell phone accessories, protectors and chargers and other items upon customers' requests.
He sells items door to door. This is his fourth loan with ODEF for 7,500 Lempiras that he will use to buy merchandize such as purses, cell phone accessories, wallets, watches and other items. He wants to use this loan to buy in cash and at discounted prices to sell during the holiday season and make some extra money.
