His future plan is to improve his house, so he stays motivated to keep on working.

loans.use: to buy merchandize such as purses, cell phone accessories, wallets, watches and other items to sell.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion lives in the town of Sierra Bullones. She is married and has two grown children. Her husband earns a living by farming and he is also a carpenter. He toils the land and grows rice.

Concepcion raises hogs to pay for the needs of her household. She wants to raise more livestock to improve her earnings, but she has very limited capital to make it happen.

Concepcion joined Kiva's field partner, CEVI, to take advantage of its financial programs. She has requested a loan to invest in pigs. With more pigs, her income will increase, enabling her to continue to improve her livelihood.

In the future, she hopes that she will successfully improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in pigs

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 59 years old and married with four children, with one child still in school.  Josephine works very hard to provide for her family.

For 1 year, Josephine has operated a general store in the Philippines selling a variety of items such as sugar, rice, soft drinks, beer, detergent soap, and cooking oil.  She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Josephine would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ana Lilian

texts.es:
Ana, de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, no pudo seguir estudiando, está casada y su esposo es pensionado del servicio que ofreció como militar, juntos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo 3 viven con ella.

Ana, tiene un negocio de compra y venta de madera, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 6 años y su esposo comenzó comprando madera para vender y luego ella se hizo responsable del negocio, el negocio está en su casa y sus hijos se involucran en el negocio, ella abren desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m. 

Ana, necesita el préstamo para comprar madera como cuartones, regla vara, regla pacha y otros para comercializar, porque su negocio le demanda mucho pedido.

Sus sueños son, ampliar el negocio de venta de madera y construir un techo para tener la madera y que no se moje; además espera que sus hijos terminen de estudiar y aprendan a manejar el negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is 37 and studied up to high school after which she was not able to continue with school. She is married and her husband has a pension received from military service. Together they have four children, but only three live with her. Ana has been running a business buying and selling timber for six years now. Her husband started by buying timber to sell, and then she assumed control of the business. She runs the business out of her home and her children are involved in the business. She is open from 7 am until 5 pm.

Ana needs this loan to purchase beams, scantlings and other timber products. Her dreams are to grow the timber business and build a roof for the wood to keep it from getting wet. Also, she hopes her children complete their schooling and learn how to manage the business.

loans.use: purchase beams, scantlings and other timber products to sell.

loans.name: Albino

texts.en:
Albino owns a rice paddy. He toils the field and grows rice. He is a 52-year-old man and has one grown child.

Currently, Albino is facing challenges to his farming livelihood. The first challenge is his lack of capital to continue to expand, and the second is the high cost of farm maintenance.

Albino has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer. With this, he could maximize his resources and augment his yield quickly.

He dreams of having a reliable small business to support his family for the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a hardworking, woman entrepreneur with eight children. She runs a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell in her food stall.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Violeta dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money in order to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 28 años d edad, estudió hasta primaria ya que sus padres ya no le pudieron seguir dando más el estudio por la situación económica, vive con su esposo que se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura y su hija que tiene un año de vida.

Gloria desde muy pequeña se ha dedicado a trabajar, ayudaba a su madre en los oficios domésticos y a su padre en los cultivos agrícolas y a la crianza de ganado,  luego después que se casó ya no se le hizo difícil adaptarse los quehaceres, todos los días prepara los alimentos para que su esposo los lleve al trabajo y también le ayuda en algunas tareas necesarias en la preparación de las tierras para los cultivos.

Los fondos de este crédito serán destinados para comprar 2 vacas de ordeño ya que quiere otro ingreso más para su familia 

Ella quiere tener varios animales de granja para que este pueda ser un ingreso más para su familia, y poder construir un cuarto más para su casa.
texts.en:
Gloria is 28 years old. She dropped out after primary school as her parents weren't able to provide her with an education due to their financials. She lives with her husband who works in agriculture and her 1-year-old daughter.
Gloria has had to work since she was very young, she used to help her mother with the household chores and her father in the fields and raising livestock. After she married, it wasn't hard for her to get used to running her house. Every day, she makes food for her husband to take to work and she also helps him getting the field ready for cultivation.
She wants to have several farm animals to have an additional income for her family and to be able to build a new room in her house.

loans.use: to buy to milk cows

loans.name: Ma`ruf

texts.ru: Маъруф житель Кубадиянского района, женат и отец пятерых детей. Маъруф спокойный и трудолюбивый человек. Он занимается сельским хозяйством на притяжении 15 лет. Его жена помогает ему в его работе. Они дружно растят своих детей и хорошо их воспитывают. У них очень милые дети. Основным источником дохода в их семьи является растениеводство. Маъруф каждый сезон сажает разных виды овощей. Сейчас он намерен посадить хлопок, однако у него не хватает средств, чтобы купить семена хлопка и минеральных удобрений. Поэтому он обратился за кредитом. Маъруф надеется, что Вы поддержите его в трудную минуту.
texts.en:
Ma'ruf is a resident of the Qubadiyon region. He is married and has five children. He is a peaceful and hardworking person who has been working in agriculture for 15 years. His wife helps him with his work. They are raising their children happily and well. They have very nice children.

Agriculture is the primary source of income in their family. Ma'ruf plants various vegetables every season. Now he intends to plant cotton; however, he doesn't have enough money to buy seeds and fertilizer. Therefore he is looking for a loan. He hopes that you will support him in this difficult time.

loans.use: to purchase cotton seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Leonila

texts.es: Doña Leonila, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo y reside junto a él en una aldea del municipio del Progreso Yoro.  La señora Leonila obtenía ingresos de lavar ropa a mano, pero hace 4 años decidió dedicarse a la venta de ropa usada, ofreciendo de forma ambulante ropa para damas como blusas short, pantalones, camisas, y ropa de niño. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por la cantidad de 5,000 Lempiras  con el cual va comprar ropa nueva como blusas, faldas, pantalones, camisetas y ropa de niños, con el fin de incrementar las ventas. Tiene como meta establecer su negocio en un local de su casa y seguir dándole educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Leonila ia 53 years old. She is a single mother of a son and they live together in a village in the municipality of Progreso in Yoro. Leoniola used to hand wash clothes for money, but 4 years ago, she decided to start selling used clothes, door to door, she sells blouses, shorts, pants, shirts for women as well as children's clothes.
She's decided to ask for a loan for 5,000 Lempiras to buy new clothes such as blouses, skirts, pants, undershirts and children's clothes. Her goal to set up her own store out of her home and continue providing her son with an education.

loans.use: to buy new clothes such as blouses, skirts, pants, undershirts and children's clothes.

loans.name: ًworood

texts.en:
Worood is 22 years old, and she lives in Irbid, a city in the north of Jordan that accepted 100,000 Syrian ‎refugees, which had a negative impact on the people who live in Irbid. 

Worood is a student in university ‎majoring in Islamic banking and is an example of an ambitious girl.  She believes that tomorrow will be more beautiful on ‎all levels, and is seeking to end her education and move on to a good job.  This will let her help her family with the household ‎expenses and perhaps help her father with the household expenses. 

To be able to complete her studies at the ‎university, Worood applied for a loan to pay for tuition fees to reach the goals that she has always dreamed of.‎

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: José Libardo

texts.es: José es un microempresario habitante de municipio de Bogotá que en compañía de su cónyuge inició su almacén de ropa en el año 2010. Su idea de negocio surgió cuando se encontraba prestando el servicio militar y decidió ahorrar de su sueldo una buena suma de dinero, para cuando finalizara el servicio inmediatamente empezara a trabajar. Todos los días de la semana su almacén está abierto al público a partir de las 9 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m., y encuentran una variada gama de ropa para dama y caballero. En la actualidad José aplicó a una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y ofrecer una nueva línea de ropa infantil.  Esta financiación será de éxito al contemplar que la demanda de ropa para toda la familia en la temporada de fin de año es bastante significativa y José está totalmente convencido que le generará buenas utilidades. Su meta a futuro es tener otras sucursales en la ciudad y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
José micro-entrepreneur and resident of the city of Bogotá. Together with his partner, he started his clothing business in 2010. The idea for his business began when he was in the military and decided to save a good portion of money from his wages so he could start working immediately after finishing his service.

Every day of the week, his shop is open to the public from 9 a.m. to 9 p.m., and he sells a wide spectrum of clothing for men and women.

Currently, José is applying for a loan, a Kiva credit, to link his financial life to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and offer a new line of infant clothing. This financing will successfully provide for the clothing demand of entire families in the last season of the year, which is quite significant.

José is totally convinced it will generate good profit. His future goal is to have other branches in the city and his own house.

loans.use: to buy a new line of infant's clothing.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder capacitarse e ir mejorando cada día. Son mujeres muy trabajadoras que se esfuerzan por sus seres queridos para poder darles una mejor calidad de vida.
Una de las que integra este grupo es la Sra. Norma, quien se dedica a la venta de ropas y calzados, y es por medio de su trabajo que tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y demás seres queridos. Es una persona muy trabajadora, y pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la venta, como así también de calzados variados, y agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
This group is included in [Fundación Paraguaya's] program for poverty eradication. Every member is putting forth their best effort to advance their capabilities and to keep improving every day. They are very hardworking women who strive to give their loved ones a better quality of life.

One of members who formed this group is Señora Norma, who sells clothes and shoes. It is through her work that she has the means to help her family and also her loved ones. She is a very hardworking person, and requests this loan to buy a variety of garments and footwear to resell. She gives thanks for the opportunity to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy a variety of garments and footwear to resell

loans.name: Martha Lilian

texts.es:
Martha, de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casada y su esposo  trabaja en Estados Unidos, tienen cuatro hijos que viven con ella y están estudiando.

Martha, trabaja como vendedora de perfumería en revistas desde hace 4 años, decidió trabajar en este negocio porque una empresa le dio la oportunidad de generar buenos ingresos; antes solo atendía una granja de pollos de otra persona.

Martha, necesita el préstamo para comprar material para construir una granja, porque quiere iniciar con este otro negocio, ya que tiene conocimientos de como se mantiene una granja.

Martha, sueña con tener su propia granja y también sueña con que sus hijos se graduén de una carrera universitaria y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Martha is 45 years old. She finished high school and she is married but her husband works in the US. They have four children that attend school.
Martha has worked selling perfumes out of a catalog for 4 years. She decided to start this business after a company offered her the chance to make a decent income. She used to ran a chicken farm owned by someone else.
Martha needs this loan to buy materials to build a farm, because she wants to start a new business, as she has the know-how to manage the farm.
She dreams of having her own farm and she also hopes her children can graduate from college and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a farm

loans.name: Wendy Marisol

texts.es:
Wendy de 45 años de edad, ha procreado 4 hijas, ahora está soltera pues por problemas tuvo que separarse de su pareja.

Wendy es una persona honesta, responsable y trabajadora, junto a su madre se crio ayudando en los quehaceres del hogar, como lo son los oficios domésticos y en una venta que tenía de donde sacaban sus ingresos para poder con los gastos de la familia, hoy en día Wendy tiene una venta de pupusas lo cual le sirve para obtener algunos ingresos y mejorar las condiciones de su hogar.

Ella solicita este crédito para comprar insumos como maíz, quesillo, chicharrón, frijoles, loroco, aceite, etc. para continuar con la venta de pupusas.

Ella sueña con ampliar su negocio para que le genere más ingresos y tener la satisfacción de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Wendy is 45 years old. She has 4 daughters, but she is single. She separated from her husband due to them having problems.
Wendy is honest, responsible and hardworking. She was raised by her mother helping out with the household chores and domestic activities. They also had a booth where they could make a living and cover the home expenses. Today, Wendy sells popusas (traditional meals) that help her make some money and improve her living conditions.
She is asking for a loan to buy basic items such as corn, quesillo, beans, loroco, oil, etc. to continue selling pupusas.
Her dream is to expand her business and make more money and make her customers happy.

loans.use: to buy basic items such as corn, quesillo, beans, loroco, oil, etc. to continue selling pupusas.

loans.name: Roberto Efraín

texts.es:
Roberto de 28 años de edad, estudió primaria y por dificultades económica ya no pudo seguir sus estudios, vive con su campanera de vida que es cosmetóloga y con su hijo.

Desde muy pequeño, Roberto aprendió la pesca artesanal, esto lo hace todos los días por la madrugada de tres a seis de la mañana, lo hace con su hermano o a veces solo, tiene que rentar una lancha ya que no tiene propia, su compañera de vida se dedica a trabajar como cosmetóloga haciendo trabajos domiciliares y así le ayuda a él con los gastos del hogar.

 Los fondos del crédito serán destinados para comprar una lancha pesquera ya que quiere tener una propia para realizar a gusto su trabajo.

Su sueño es sacar adelante a su familia, construir su propia casa ya que por el momento están rentando.
texts.en:
Roberto, 28, went to primary school but couldn't continue his schooling due to economic difficulties. He lives with his life partner, who is a cosmetologist, and their son.

From a very young age, Roberto learned artisanal fishing. He does this every day from 3 a.m. to 6 p.m. with his brother, or sometimes alone. He has to rent a boat since he doesn't have his own. His partner works as a cosmetologist and does domestic work, thus helping him with household expenses.

The loan money will be used to buy a fishing boat because he wants to have his own to be comfortable for his work. His dream is to bring up his family and build his own home, as he is renting at the moment.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat because he wants to have his own to be comfortable for his work.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina, who is 57 years old, lives in the village of Natakhtari in Georgia.  She is a widow and lives alone.  Marina earns a living working at the local hotel as an administrator where she earns a fixed income.  Marina has a great desire to earn income from agribusiness and start dairy farming. 

She is seeking credit among local financial institutions to purchase 2 dairy cows.  The startup program, that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables the rural poor and inexperienced people to obtain a loan for starting or re-starting businesses.  Her application was approved under the framework of this program to obtain a loan of 2,800 GEL. 

After the cows are purchased, Marina will start producing dairy products such as cheese and yogurt to sell.  Marina is a very hard-working and motivated woman, with a great desire to improve her living conditions and save money for the future.  She awaits Kiva lender support and kindness and will be very thankful for the financial support.

loans.use: to start an agribusiness and purchase 2 dairy cows.

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es: Sandra de 32 años es  habitante del municipio de Nemocón en el departamento de Cundinamarca, ella vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijas menores de edad en esta misma localidad y en su granja cría gallinas ponedoras de huevos semicriollos, los cuales comercializa entre los moradores del municipio. Ella cuenta con un año de experiencia en esta labor con excelentes resultados y desea mejorar las condiciones de su granja, es por ello que realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y comprar mayas nuevas, techos en lámina galvanizada, madera y compra de maíz para sus gallinas. Esta inversión permitirá que sus aves de corral estén en mejores condiciones tenga más espacio, así mismo pueda hospedar a  una mayor cantidad de aves lo que le incrementará su producción y con ello sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Sandra is 32 years old and a resident of the municipality of Nemocón in the department of Cundinamarca. She lives with her three daughters, all minors, and her husband in this very place, where on her farm she keeps hens for laying "semicriollo" eggs which she sells among the other residents of the town.

She has one year of experience in this type of work with excellent results, and she wants to improve the conditions of her farm. For this reason she has requested a loan through Kiva, an opportunity to connect with the financial community through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and buy new mesh netting, galvanized metal roofing, wood, and corn feed for her chickens.

This loan will ensure that her poultry has better living conditions and more space, and that she is able to house a greater quantity of birds, which will increase her production and therefore her profits.

loans.use: to purchase new mesh netting, galvanized metal roofing, wood, and corn feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Oscar Astul

texts.es:
Oscar de 28 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos padres, tiene poca preparación académica pues tenía que trabajar,  está soltero y aún no tiene hijos.

Oscar trabaja desde muy joven en la agricultura ya que esta actividad fue enseñada por su padre quien se dedica a lo mismo, actualmente él trabaja una  hectárea de jícama y tiene 3 años realizando dicha actividad.

Él solicita este crédito para pagar a mozos que le ayuden a sacar el cultivo ya que es tiempo de realizar la venta.
 
El sueño que tiene es poder trabajar muy fuerte para poder construir una casa en donde buena vivir independientemente.
texts.en:
Oscar, 28, lives with his parents, has little formal academic preparation since he had to work, is single and has no children yet.

Oscar has worked from a very young age in agriculture, since this occupation was taught to him by his father, who works in the same. He currently works a hectare of jicama and has 3 years in this occupation.

He is requesting this loan to pay workers to help him harvest the crop since it is time to sell. The dream he has is to be able to work very hard in order to be able to build a good house in which to live independently.

loans.use: pay workers to help him harvest the crop since it is time to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Binghay

texts.en:
Ma. Binghay is 42 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Binghay requested a 16,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more variety of fish to sell.

Ma. Binghay has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Hussien

texts.en:
Hussien is a 19-year-old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Ramtha, which is affected a lot by the Syrian refugees and because of the Syria political situation.

Hussien is studying in his second year to be a doctor, and he wants to specialize in surgery. He always dreams to be a known surgery doctor.

Hussien is applying for a loan to help him cover the rest of the semester fees.

loans.use: to cover the rest of the semester fees.

loans.name: Jose Walter Jeovany

texts.es:
Walter, de 34 años de edad, solo estudio hasta sexto grado, porque la situación económica era muy difícil, está soltero y vive con su madre. 

Walter, desde que era muy pequeño se dedica a la agricultura y a trabajar con ganado, todo lo aprendió de su padre, porque él lo llevaba a trabajar cultivando y le enseño a ordeñar, ahora trabaja en una pequeña hacienda y se levanta muy temprano porque tiene que entrar a trabajar a las 4:00 de la madrugada para ordeñar las vacas y después tiene que ir a dejarlas al potrero para darles pasto. 

Walter, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaca lechera, con la cual espera tener ingresos para él y su madre. 

Su sueño es llegar a tener varias vacas lecheras y construir su propio corral y construir una casa para él, porque la casa donde vive es de su madre.
texts.en:
Walter is 34. He only studied until 6th grade because his economic situation was very difficult. He's single and lives with his mother.

Since he was very young, Walter has earned a living through agriculture and livestock. He learned everything from his father, because his father brought him to work planting and taught him to milk. Now, he works on a small farm and gets up very early because he has to begin working at 4 a.m. to milk the cows before taking them to the pasture to graze them.

Walter needs the loan to buy a milk cow, with which he hopes to earn income for himself and his mother. His dream is to have several milk cows, build his own corral and build a house for himself because the house he lives in now is his mother's.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Lolowou

texts.fr: Lolowou est une femme mariée dynamique qui vit à Adidogomé avec ses deux enfants à charge. Lolowou est âgée de 44 ans et  s’active parfaitement  pour avoir une bonne situation financière. Lolowou est une revendeuse de pagnes qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Lolowou sollicite ce prêt pour commander des pièces de pagnes en vue de bien revendre afin de répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière remarquable  pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Lolowou is an energetic married woman who lives in Adidogomé with her two dependent children. She is 44 years old and really hustles to be in a strong financial position. Lolowou is a pagne reseller, and buys her inventory three times per month in the market. Lolowou is requesting this loan so she can order the pagnes and resell them to achieve her goals of meeting the expectations of her clients and having solid financial independence to help her children with their school education.

loans.use: to buy 9 pieces of cloth (pagnes)

loans.name: Jeanilee

texts.en:
Ma. Jeanilee is 39 years old, married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Ma. Jeanilee has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from selling frozen foods.

Ma. Jeanilee aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman is 21 years old. He is one of four siblings in a sector in Jordan called Ramtha, which is affected by the Syrian refugees.

Sulaiman has only a part-time job as bus driver because he is attending university to get his bachelor's degree, majoring in engineering. He wants to help his parents with his earnings.

Now Sulaiman is applying for a loan to help him cover the cost of the rest of the semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for the rest of the semester fees.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Amani from Ramallah. She is married with four kids. Three years ago, Amani started her business by buying a small sewing shop with one sewing machine and no employees. But now she has two full-time employees.

The main challenges to Amani's business are competitors in the marketplace and currency fluctuation. Amani requires this loan to add another new sewing machine to her store as well as purchase some sewing materials.

Amani hopes that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to expand and improve her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and required sewing materials.

loans.name: Seham's Group

texts.en:
Seham, like all mothers, is working hard to provide a good life for her children and wishes the best for them. She has an ‎amazing daughter who appears with Seham in the picture, and her name is Marwa.

Marwa is studying in university, ‎majoring in the English language, and lives with her mother in Zarqaa city. Marwa is an example of the dreamer lady, and she is a ‎hardworking girl who wants to complete her education to be able to work in good job with a good salary to help her family in the ‎household expenses.

Marwa and her mom, Seham, decided to apply for a group educational loan to help Marwa pay for her ‎university fees and achieve her dreams. ‎

loans.use: to help her daughter pay for her ‎university fees and achieve her dreams.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a married woman, and she has a daughter who appears in the photo instead of Iman because she is a conservative woman.

Iman is a mother who wants to provide a good life for her daughter; she is working hard to live a comfortable life with her family.

Her daughter is a student in university, majoring in marketing. She is seeking to graduate and find a good job with a good salary to help her parents and to carry a responsibility from them.

Iman feels that her daughter will be someone important in the future, and she cannot wait to see her in the graduation dress. Because of the financial crises that Iman and her husband have faced, she asked for an education loan to pay for her daughter`s semester fees and to buy her need books.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter`s semester fees and to buy her need books.

loans.name: Yamileth Del Socorro

texts.es: Hace cuatro años que Yamileth se dedica a la venta de pescado, gracias a los créditos obtenidos anteriormente ha logrado salir adelante a pesar de las adversidades, su hijo es su principal apoyo. Esta vez solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar mayor cantidad de pescado y lograr surtir la demanda de sus clientes de esta manera podrá obtener mejores ingresos y mejorar la estabilidad de su familia.
texts.en:
For four years, Yamileth has been selling fish. Thanks to the loans she's received earlier, she's been able to get ahead in spite of adversities. Her son is her main support.

This time, she's seeking a loan to buy a larger amount of fish and be able to meet her customers' demands. In this way, she'll be able to earn a better income and improve her family's stability.

loans.use: to buy a larger amount of fish.

loans.name: Evangelina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Evangelina, de 35 años de edad,  estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja en la agricultura, no tiene hijos y nadie  más vive con ella.

Evangelina, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol desde hace aproximadamente 10 años, la parcela donde ella trabaja con su pareja está a 15 minutos de su casa.

Evangeliana, necesita el préstamo para  comprar insumos agrícolas para aplicarlos a sus cultivos.
Evangelina, sueña con tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Evangelina, 35, went to school until sixth grade. She's partnered and her partner works in agriculture. She doesn't have children and no one else live with her.

Evangelina has earned a living growing corn and beans for about 10 years. The field where she works with her partner is 15 minutes from her house. Evangelina needs the loan to buy agricultural inputs to apply to her crops.

Evangelina dreams of having a dignified life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to apply to her crops.

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
Ammar is 21 years old and single, and he lives with his family that consists of 7 members in Irbid city, which had a bad ‎negative impact because of the refugees’ camp. He is studying in university, majoring in tourism.

All Ammar`s friends ‎have graduated, but he has not, because he has to work beside his education due to his parent's financial situation. He feels ‎responsible for his family. Therefore, he is doing his best to help them, and he wishes to graduate and find work with a better ‎salary to help them more and more.

Lately, he faced a financial problem, so he requested an education loan to help him ‎cover his tuition for this semester. ‎

loans.use: to cover his tuition for this semester.

loans.name: Ayabavi Sodjinamawu

texts.fr: Divorcée, Ayabavi est une femme âgée de 38 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Ayabavi vit avec ses deux enfants et est une revendeuse de chaussures et de pagnes qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et en circulant les quartiers environnant. Ayabavi demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat des paires de chaussures et des pièces de pagnes en vue de mieux revendre et de gagner des bénéfices afin de pouvoir aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire puis à certaines dépenses quotidiennes qu’elle éprouve.
texts.en:
Ayabavi is a divorced woman living in Adidogomé. Ayabavi lives with her two children and is a retailer of shoes and pagnes (traditional fabrics) which she buys twice a month in the market. She resells them door to door and locally on a mobile basis.
Ayabavi is requesting this loan in order to make a purchase of shoes and pagnes, so she can increase her sales and make more profit. With this, she can help her children with their school education and also cover some of her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase twenty pairs of shoes and five traditional dresses.

loans.name: Adjoavi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère d’un enfant, Adjoavi est une femme âgée de 28 ans habitant à Adidogomé. Adjoavi est une revendeuse de pagnes et divers qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois  au marché et le revend à domicile puis en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Pour ce fait, Adjoavi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des pièces de pagnes et des sacs de riz en vue de gagner une marge bénéficiaire qui servira à venir en aide à son mari pour soutenir les charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of one child, Adjoavi is a 28 year old woman living in Adidogomé. Adjoavi is a retailer of pagnes (traditional fabrics) and various others items. She buys her stock once a month at the market and makes her sales door to door and by walking around the local neighbourhood.
Therefore, Adjoavi is requesting this loan to order some pagnes and some sacks of rice, so she can earn a profit margin that will help her husband in meeting the family's daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy ten traditional fabrics and six sacks of rice.

loans.name: Tchilalo M.

texts.fr: Tchilalo est une femme mariée âgée de 46 ans résidante à Adidogomé. Mère d’un enfant, Tchilalo est une revendeuse des produits alimentaires qu’elle achète et revend quatre fois par mois au marché dans. Tchilalo sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de riz et des bidons d’huile. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Tchilalo compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider sa famille à avoir un bon épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire à son enfant.
texts.en:
Tchilalo is a 46 year old married woman living in Adidogomé. A mother of one child, Tchilalo is a retailer of foodstuffs that she buys and resells four times a month at the market. Tchilalo is requesting this loan to buy sacks of rice and cans of oil.
With the profit margin that will be generated, Tchilalo hopes to improve her sales offering and to help her family to flourish - with a good school education for her child.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of rice and five cans of oil.

loans.name: Ma. Naygie

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Ma. Naygie works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Ma. Naygie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of charcoal to resell.

Ma. Naygie has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmmoud and his family live a simple life in the town of Amman in Wihdat, Jordan. He is 45 years old and has five children. He supports his five children. He retired from his work and had no income. Therefore, he decided to open his own business and started making pickles and selling them.

For this, he needs capital to operate his pickle selling and raising business continuously and to be able to improve his livelihood in the future. Now he needs a bigger loan to buy vegetables such as cucumbers, tomatoes, sweet peppers, eggplant, and chili peppers to make the pickles and sell them. Mahmmoud needs your support to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as cucumbers, tomatoes, sweet peppers, eggplant, and chili peppers to make pickles to sell

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is 60 years old and married with eight children.

Marcela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Marcela has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marcela aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Manilyn

texts.en:
Manilyn is 24 years old and married. She has three children, one of whom is currently in school.

Manilyn is in the agricultural business, farming bananas in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming bananas for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Manilyn would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Reham

texts.en:
Reham is 27 years old, single and lives with her family in Baqaa, which is a refugees camp. She is studying in a private ‎university and majoring in accounting.

All Reham's friends graduated five years ago, but she has not because of her family's financial ‎situation. She is working hard to graduate and to find good work in order to be a productive lady.

Lately she has been faced ‎with financial problems so she has requested an education loan to help her cover her tuition for this semester.‎

loans.use: to cover her tuition for this semester.

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.ru: Рахматулло  47 лет, и он семейный человек. Рахматулло имеет большую и счастливую семью. Рахматулло всегда помогает своим детям в учебе. Рахматулло занимается таксистом, который перевозит пассажиров. Вот так он зарабатывает на жизнь. Сегодня Рахматулло нуждается в кредит. С помощью этого кредита, он хочет проводить свадьбы сына. Ему не хватает денежных средств на купли нужные средство. С такими планами Рахматулло обратился за кредитом.   Он благодарен Вам и за Вашу помощь.
texts.en:
Rakhmatullo is 47 years old, and he is a family-oriented person. Rakhmatullo has a large and happy family. Rakhmatullo always helps his children in their studies. Rakhmatullo works as a taxi driver, and he drives passengers around. This is how he makes a living. 

Today Rakhmatullo needs a loan. With the help of a loan, he wants to carry out his son's wedding. He does not have enough funds to buy the needed goods. With this plan, Rakhmatullo has applied for a loan. He is thankful to you and your help.

loans.use: to pay for his son's wedding.

loans.name: Pelita

texts.en:
Pelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Pelita requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

Pelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support two children. She is married and has a business raising livestock in the Philippines.

Erlinda requested a 7,300 PHP loan through NWTF to buy buy materials like sand, gravel, a toilet bowl, cement, etc. for the construction of her sanitary toilet.

Erlinda knows that by using the sanitary toilet, she has comfort, safety, and privacy, and she is also helping the environment and reducing health risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like sand, gravel, a toilet bowl, cement, etc. for the construction of her sanitary toilet.

loans.name: Majd

texts.en:
Majd is a 20-year-old single man from Ramtha city. He is one of four siblings and he is the eldest. His father died and left Majd alone with his little siblings, and so he became responsible for them. He opened his own business of a coffee kiosk making coffee, tea, nescafe and other hot drinks.

Majd did not let this work prevent him from getting an education, and he entered university majoring in Arabic languages. He hopes this good education will help him to find good work, and then to be able to help his siblings in their education.

Now Majd cannot cover all the needs of his siblings as well as his education. Therefore he has applied for an education loan to help him pay the university fees for this semester, and to buy some books which he needs.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for this semester, and to buy some books which he needs.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida, who is 50 years of age now, started a small level school 25 years ago. With the passage of time it gained popularity and she decided to upgrade her low cost private school. There are 245 students in her school, 62% of whom are female.

When asked what motivates her Shahida replied, “I have great passion to educate the community. We lacked resources and they could not afford a good quality school. Today when I teach students I feel that I am enabling the youth of a rural community to change and secure a better future in the long run.” Shahida has requested PKR 100,000 for the purpose of buying furniture such as chairs, desks and white boards.

loans.use: to buy furniture such as chairs, desks and white boards.

loans.name: Subasini's Group

texts.en:
Subasini, standing on the left-hand side in the photograph, is a hard-working, generous and dutiful lady. She is a widow and comes from a small village of Odagaon, Odisha, India. She lives with her 5-year-old daughter who is continuing her education in a primary school. Subasini has been engaged in an applique business for the past three years. She has been successful in her business so far. The appliques and other handicraft items made by Subasini are very popular in her locality, and she has a pretty large customer base. Along with her group member, Subasini has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR. Subasini will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase raw materials for her applique and handicraft business such as glass, coloured paper, glitter, glue, ribbons, and crayons in order to increase her output so as to generate a higher amount of revenue. She has a plan to reinvest her income in her business and buy a bigger shop so that she will be able to display a larger combination of products and attract more customers and expand her business.

Subasini is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her applique and handicraft business such as glass, coloured paper, glitter, paste, ribbons, and crayons.

loans.name: Tianasoa Jeanne D'arc Victoire

texts.fr:
Tianasoa est une femme âgée de 26 ans et est mariée.  Son mari aussi est commerçant comme elle. Il vend des articles de quincaillerie et accessoire. Le couple a 2 enfants dont l’un est déjà scolarisé. 
Elle est dans la vente de téléphone et accéssoires téléphoniques depuis 2011. Elle et son mari s’entraident dans leurs activités. Celles-ci se sont développés car les articles de vente, les marchandises ne cessent d’augmenter en nombre et en variétés. Cela est aussi justifié par l’utilisation d’une grande vitrine pour étaler la marchandise. Le couple a pour objectif d’améliorer la qualité des produits et encore d’augmenter ses marchandises en nombre. Ils font cela afin de pouvoir acheter un terrain grâce aux bénéfices et à l’épargne.
texts.en:
Tinasoa is a 26-year-old married woman. Her husband is also a merchant like her. He sells hardware items and accessories. The couple have two children, of whom one is already in school.

Tinasoa has been selling telephone accessories since 2011. She and her husband help each other in their businesses, which are developed, since the merchandise for sale is ever-growing in number and variety, thus the use of a large glass case for displaying their merchandise.

The couple’s goal is to improve the quality of the products and to increase again the number of items, so as to be able to purchase a plot of land with the profits and their savings.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Genette

texts.en:
Genette is 49 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Genette works very hard to provide for them.

Genette runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, coffee, cereals, soap, etc. to sell. Genette has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Genette would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, coffee, cereals, soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Desiree

texts.en:
Desiree is 38 years old and has four children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Desiree is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Desiree has been in pig fattening for 2 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Desiree would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is a married woman with eleven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nena is 53 years old and one of her children is still in school.

Nena has a buy and sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Nena has been in this business for 11 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

loans.name: Cadolina

texts.en:
Cadolina is a married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cadolina is 38 years old.

She has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. Cadolina has requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell.

Cadolina has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Lizel

texts.en:
Lizel is a married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lizel is 35 years old.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Lizel requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Lizel has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Lizel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 26 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits, canned goods, beers, bath soap and shampoo.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Kouser

texts.en: 33 year old Kouser always wanted to help children in her community reach their potential. She was passionate about her own education too. Kouser started her school 2 years ago. Her school requires more room today because there are almost 150 students in her school, of which 42% are female. She requires a loan of PKR 150,000 to build a classroom to accommodate an increasing number of enrolled students. Kouser believes in providing a good environment in her school so that the children can learn effectively.

loans.use: to build a classroom to accommodate more enrolled students.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en: 44-year-old married woman, Nargis, has been running a school since 2008. She is an educated women and utilises her knowledge to support her family and the children in her community. Her school holds 183 students and more than 47% are female students. Nargis's husband, who is in the picture, also help her to manage the school's administration part. Nargis has faced many challenges to run her school successfully. Currently she is facing insufficient building space to accommodate her school children. Nargis has requested a loan of 200,000 PKR to repair the school building and buy furniture. She plans to extend the school from middle school to high school level by increasing room in the building and from school enrolments.

loans.use: to repair the school building and buy furniture.

loans.name: Jeevitha And Group

texts.en:
Jeevitha is a 24-year-old daily wage labourer who toils in the agricultural fields to earn for her family of three. She lives in the Namakkal district of Tamil Nadu with her husband and child. As her child is growing up, the expenses of their family is rising. The income from her current work is insufficient and irregular. She wants to save a good amount for her child’s education. So she underwent training in doing stone work on sarees. She is now ready to start her own business and earn more for her family. But she needs a loan to kickstart her business.

Jeevitha leads a group of 5 women who have all undergone training in various skills and now need funds to start their respective businesses. The loan amount will help these women meet their family’s basic needs and cover their children’s educational costs. They are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: to start her saree stone work business.

loans.name: Freddie

texts.en: Freddie has been in the farming business for 29 years. He grows a variety of vegetables within his locality. He is happily married and blessed with two children who are still attending school. He and his wife have been working hard to increase their income and improve their living conditions. Part of his farming strategy is increasing the vegetables he grows and sustaining it with complete farm inputs to keep it productive and profitable. To make his goal possible, he is seeking for a loan of PHP 3,000 allowing him to buy insecticides and fertilizer for his vegetable farm land.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and fertilizer for his vegetable farm land.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda runs a sari-sari (grocery) store. She is 34 years old and married with four school-aged children. She sells basic household commodities such as coffee, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, shampoo, tooth paste, fabric conditioner and a variety of canned goods. In addition to that, she also raises hogs and goes farming, too. She grows and sold rice.

She is asking for a loan to purchase assorted stocks, feeds and fertilizer. These are very essential in order to gain a higher yield. Thus, she intends to continue to manage her resources well and invest half of her profits for an expansion.

Rosalinda is grateful to CEVI and Kiva for the funds.

loans.use: to purchase assorted stocks, feeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie works hard to support herself. She is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rosemarie requested a loan of 24,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Annalie

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Annalie works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Annalie is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy ingredients and kitchenware for her food production business.

Annalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money so that she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and kitchenware for her food production business.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
El señor Mercedes tiene 72 años de edad, estudió hasta un quinto grado, vive con su compañera de vida, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y todos han formado su propia familia.

Mercedes desde muy pequeño ha trabajado para valerse por sí mismo, su padre le enseñó la pesca artesanal, hace algunos años se dedicó a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y golosinas, y así ha logrado experiencia en el negocio y es por eso que aún se dedica a vender en tu tienda. 

Él solicita este crédito para comprar más productos de primera necesidad como azúcar, café. Pan, huevos, condimentos, golosinas, bebidas, etc. para surtir su tienda. 

Él espera seguir con fuerzas para valerse por si mismo y cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 72 years old and he studied until fifth grade. He lives with his partner; his children are already of age and they all have their own family.

Mercedes has been working to provide for himself since he was very young. His father taught him traditional fishery. He has been working selling essential goods and sweets for few years. In this way he has acquired experience in the business and this is the reason why he continues to sell in his shop.

He is requesting this loan to buy more essential products such as sugar, coffee, bread, eggs, spices, sweets, drinks, etc, to stock his shop.

He hopes to continue having the strength to take care of himself and to cover his household's needs.

loans.use: to buy more essential products such as sugar, coffee, bread, eggs, spices, sweets, drinks, etc, to stock his shop.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.en:
Rufino runs a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells basic household commodities such as coffee, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste, fabric conditioner and a variety of canned goods. Aside from that, he also sells assorted dry goods, kitchenware and assorted plastic toys whenever there is an occasion like the town fiesta and other gatherings.

He is 45-year-old married man and has five children. His oldest child is 18 while the youngest is 1. He would like to boost his income by purchasing a variety of goods intended for special occasions. He has requested a loan to buy kitchenware, plasticware and assorted toys. With these, more customers will shop in his store. In that way, he will able to manage his finances and set aside some of his profit for future use. 
 
Rufino is determined that he could make his business more productive to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy kitchenware, plasticware and assorted toys.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is a resident in the town of Talibon. She is a forty-six year old married woman and has four children. Three of her children are still attending school. She earns a living by raising and selling hogs. She sells them to town-settlers in her area. Her husband is a welder.

She would like to boost her earnings by raising more quality hogs and having sufficient supply of feed to become sustainable. Slowly, she wants to be able to set aside enough savings to invest in any business opportunities.

Trinidad has requested a loan to purchase feed and materials for pig pen renovations. 

In the future, Trinidad is looking forward to having a stable income source and she extends thanks for the support.

loans.use: to purchase feed and materials for pig pen renovations.

loans.name: Ma. Dalisay

texts.en:
Ma. Dalisay is a 34-year-old woman who does domestic work for a living. She engages in fishing. She sells fresh fish to the locals in her place. She is married and has four young dependents. Her husband is also a fisherman. 

At the moment she needs additional funds to be able to do some renovations, but she has very limited capital to make this happen. Therefore, she joined CEVI to access loans. She wants to purchase materials such as plywood, nails and paint for repairing her pump boat. This could help improve the ease of transporting her catch and she could gain higher yields.

In the future, she dreams of having her own fishing boat for sustainable living and for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as plywood, nails and paint for repairing her pump boat.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Forty-eight-year-old Erlinda is a married woman with four children; one of whom is still attending school. Her husband is a security guard while Erlinda cooks dishes to sell in her community of Talibon, Bohol. She cooks noodles, sautéed vegetables and fried fish during meal times. 

She is asking for a loan to purchase additional food storage and lumber for house repair. Erlinda has high hopes for the future and is optimistic about her expansion. Her income will be for food, savings and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to purchase additional food storage and lumber for house repair.

loans.name: Flora Mae

texts.en:
Flora Mae is married and has two children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig-fattening in the Philippines. Flora Mae requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Flora Mae has been in the pig-fattening business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Flora Mae would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Saja

texts.en:
Saja is a 20-year-old, single lady who lives in Mafraq. Mafraq received 120,000 Syrian refugees who fled there and now live there. Because of that, there has been a bad impact on Mafraq and no one cares. ‎

Saja is studying for her Bachelor's degree in her second year in accounting and the law of business. Saja`s future plan is ‎to take her Bachelor's degree and work in that field. Now she is applying for a loan to help her to cover her semester fees.‎

loans.use: to cover her semester fees

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix runs a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells goods like candies, chips, snack foods, lollipops and chocolates. He is a married man with no dependents. He has been running a variety store for more many years now. Together with his wife he lives in Talibon, Bohol. 


Felix has requested a loan to buy grocery items such as biscuits, noodles, shampoo and soap. These will fill his store with additional goods to offer to his respective customers. He could then start to improve his earnings and slowly gain profit. 

In the future, he is hoping that he could expand his current source of income to improve his livelihood and to have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as biscuits, noodles, shampoo and soap.

loans.name: Jose Ellery

texts.en:
Jose Ellery is a married man and the father of five children from Talibon, Bohol. His work is fishing. He catches fish and crabs and sells them to the community. He has been fishing for quite a while now.

Aside from fishing, when there is very limited catch, he resorts buying and selling fresh fish and squid as alternative source of income.

He is asking for a loan to acquire capital to buy fresh fish and squid. With this loan, he will be able to stock up on adequate supplies which he can then sell in the market.

Jose Ellery dreams of investing in other means of livelihood to become sustainable.

loans.use: to acquire capital to buy fresh fish and squid.

loans.name: Medalla

texts.en:
Medalla is 40 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Medalla is in the agricultural business of pig-fattening in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Medalla has been in the pig-fattening business for 5 years now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Medalla would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marivel

texts.en:
Marivel is 35 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marivel has a fish vending business in the Philippines. she requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

Marivel has been in this business for two years. In the future, Marivel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es:
Marta tiene tres hijas la cuales están acompañadas, ella vive con dos nietos, una joven de 18 años y el joven de 21 años, ella se dedica al comercio de tostadas, yuca y café en su comunidad, ella compra el café lo lleva al molino y lo saca para venderlo a un mejor precio, así es como ella ha logrado sacar a su familia adelante.

 Marta desde su juventud aprendió el negocio del café, su madre hacía el mismo oficio y fue ella quien le enseñó a trabajar a Marta, por lo tanto le ha ayudado para valerse por si misma y sacar adelante a su familia.

Ella solicita este crédito para comprar café y yuca para seguir con las ventas. 

Ella planea seguir trabajando para mejorar su condición de vida, hacer mejoras a su vivienda por que cuando llega el invierno su casa se moja adentro.
texts.en:
Marta has three daughters who live with their partners. Marta lives with two of her grandchildren, an 18-year-old girl and a 21-year-old young man. She earns a living selling tostadas (a type of snack), cassava and coffee in her town. She buys coffee and takes it to the mill, then sells it on at a better price which is how she has managed to support her family.

Since she was young, Marta has learned the business of coffee. Her mother did the same job and taught Marta how to work, this has helped her to fend for herself and helped her family to get ahead.

She is asking for a loan to buy coffee and cassava so she can continue selling them. She intends to keep working to improve her quality of life and make improvements to her home, as when winter comes her house becomes damp inside.

loans.use: to buy coffee and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Ediza

texts.en:
Ediza is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ediza is 34 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ediza has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Ediza has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Ediza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Josefina Andrea

texts.es: Josefina es una mujer trabajadora de 62 años que tiene cuatro hijos y vive en la localidad rural de Tancaya, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Ella trabaja como obrera agrícola y además se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar una vaca orgánica, espera poder vender su leche a un mejor precio por ser orgánica. En el futuro espera poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y seguir contando con buena salud para ver crecer a sus nietos, razón por la cual apuesta por lo orgánico.
texts.en:
Josefina is a hard-working, 62-year-old woman who has four children and lives in the rural town of Tancaya. This is located in Arequipa. She works as a farm labourer and also earns a living through agriculture, breeding organic cattle. She puts a lot of effort into their care and feed, which is made of organic alfalfa that she grows.

She is asking for a micro loan so she can buy an organic cow. She hopes to be able to sell its milk at a better price because it is organic. In the future she hopes to be able to give her family a better quality of life and to continue in good health so she can watch her grandchildren grow up, this is the reason why she is moving into organic products.

loans.use: to buy an organic cow so she can sell the milk to help support her children and grandchildren.

loans.name: Las Pollitas De Qh Group

texts.es:
El grupo las pollitas de QH, esta por primera vez solicitado créditos a los miembros de Kiva para el mejoramiento y desarrollo de sus actividades económicas, que les pueda permitir crecer para brindarle las mejores condiciones a sus seres amados.
María es quien dirige al grupo ella tiene 46 años, se dedica a la venta de pollo, (pollos de engorde) quien los comercializa una vez tenga un buen desarrollo para el consumo de la población, esta soltera y es madre de dos hijos, desde a 17 años se dedica a la este negocio gracias al dinero que recogió de su trabajo como docente. Ahora con el dinero invertirá en la compra de pollos, comida de engorde, granza, vitaminas y vacunas, procurando que esto le permita que su producción sea de calidad. 
Los demás socios son Ventura de 52 años, quien vende achote y embaces de miel de manera ambulante. Gloria de 20 años, dedicada a la venta de perecederos y don Jorge de 41 años de edad dedicado  a la venta de plátanos.
texts.en:
The loan group "Las Pollitas de QH" is asking for loans from the Kiva members for the first time, to improve and develop their jobs. This would allow them to grow to give the best conditions to their loved ones.

María leads the group. She is 46-years old and works selling chickens (boiler chickens) which she sells once she has a good development for public consumption. She is single and the mother of two children. From the age of 17, she has worked in this business thanks to the money that she picked up as a teacher. Now, with the money, she will invest into buying chickens, fattening food, pellets, vitamins and vaccines, ensuring that this makes her production of quality.

The other members are Ventura who is 52-years old and sells achiote and packaged honey on the street, Gloria who is 20-years old and sells perishables, and Jorge who is 41-years old and sells bananas.

loans.use: to buy chickens, fattening food, pellets, vitamins and vaccines, ensuring that this makes her production of quality.

loans.name: El Pochotillo Group

texts.es:
Los integrantes que conforman el grupo El Pochotillo, son personas laboriosas y emprendedoras quienes cada día se esfuerzan para sacar adelante a su seres queridos, conformado por Martha de 38 años, dedicada a la compra y venta de cosechas, ella tiene dos hijos, y requiere del crédito para la compra de cosechas de Tamarindo al por mayor y luego venderlo al detalle para sacarle mayores ganancias. 
Las demás socias son Jenny de 20 años, dedicada a la venta de ropa y pantalones, camisas short, faldas y blusas. Y doña Ofelia de 55 años dedicada a la venta de plátano. Desde hace ya varios años.
texts.en:
The members of El Pochotillo group are hard-working and entrepreneurial people, who work every day to improve the lives of their loved ones.

The group is made up of 38-year-old Martha, who buys and sells crops. She has two children and needs the loan to buy tamarind crops wholesale and then sell them retail for greater profit.

The other members are 20-year-old Jenny, who sells clothes; trousers, shirts, shorts, skirts and blouses. Also, 55-year-old Ofelia, who has sold plantain for many years.

loans.use: to buy tamarind crops.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Doña Dolores, tiene 61 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene 3 hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio del Progreso Yoro. Doña Dolores anteriormente tenía un negocio de pulpería pero no le fue bien y decidió dedicarse a la venta de ropa nueva y usada para damas, caballeros y niños, además vende sandalias. Ya cuenta con buena clientela desde hace 5 años y piensa mantenerlo siempre activo. Está solicitando un préstamo por 10,000 lempiras para invertir en la compra de más producto nuevo de la temporada, como vestidos, camisetas, faldas, blusas, calzado y ropa de niños, para surtir y aprovechar las ventas y las ganancias. Su plan es seguir creciendo con el negocio para darle bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Dolores is 61-years old. She lives in a common-law marriage with her partner, with whom she has 3 children and lives in a village in the town of Progreso Yoro. Dolores previously had a grocery store business but it did not go well for her and she decided to start working selling new and used clothing for women, men and children, as well as sandals. She has had a good clientele for 5 years and she thinks of always keeping it active.

She is asking for a loan for 10,000 Lempiras to invest in buying more new seasonal products such as dresses, shirts, skirts, blouses, shoes and children's clothing to supply and take advantage of the sales and earnings. Her plan is to continue growing with the business to give her family wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy more new seasonal products such as dresses, shirts, skirts, blouses, shoes and children's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Luis de 60 años es un mecánico de maquinaria pesada, habitante de Nemocón un municipio de Cundinamarca, él vive con su cónyuge y es padre de cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad. Él adquirió una retroexcavadora para ofrecer servicios de remoción de tierras u otros trabajos que se puedan realizar con esta máquina y ha obtenido muy buenos resultados.  En la actualidad está requiriendo unos repuestos para reparar su retroexcavadora y aplicó a una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para realizar la compra de empaques, cilindros, válvulas y émbolos. Con esta financiación su retroexcavadora estará lista para trabajar en obras de agricultores y finqueros del sector. La meta a futuro de Luis es seguir consiguiendo contratos que lo mantengan siempre con trabajo.
texts.en: Luis is 60-years old. He is a heavy equipment mechanic and lives in Nemocón, a town in Cundinamarca. He lives with his partner and is the father of four children who are all adults. He acquired a backhoe to offer soil remover services or other jobs that can be done with this machine and he has received very good results. Now he is needing some parts to repair his backhoe and he applied for a loan, a Credikiva, and the opportunity to join the financial life through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. He will buy packaging, cylinders, valves and pistons. With this financing, his backhoe will be ready to work in farming and ranching jobs in the area. Luis's future goal is to keep getting contracts that keep him working.

loans.use: to buy packaging, cylinders, valves and pistons.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is a 49-year-old married man and the father of three children. He is from Talibon, Bohol. One of his children is still attending school. He operates a passenger boat which travels from one island to another, for a certain fee. This is the source of his income. 

Rolando is asking for a loan to purchase materials for repairing his pump boat. With this loan, he will be able to maintain a good working condition of his boat and thus improve his business. 

In the future, Rolando hopes to make his business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase materials for pump boat repair.

loans.name: Rodulfo

texts.en:
62-year-old Rodulfo owns a rice paddy. He has been growing rice for many years now. He is married and has nine grown children. He lives in the town of Talibon. Aside from growing rice, he also grows coconuts.

He would like to avail a loan to buy fertilizer and additional rice seedlings. This loan will boost the yield of his farm. In that way, he will be able to sell more volumes of rice thereby augmenting his income.

Rodulfo is determined that, in the near future, he will handle both his sources of income successfully.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and additional rice seedlings.

loans.name: Aichurock

texts.ru: Айчурок, 54 года, замужем, есть сын. У нее среднее образование, на протяжении 14 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством, также заготовкой, производством и реализацией сухофруктов, картофеля, яблок. Возле дома есть ларек, где Айчурок занимается торговлей продуктов питания. На сегодняшний день у Айчурок есть 2 коровы, 15 овец, также в обороте товар на сумму 10,000 сом (KGS).  Айчурок решила развить свой бизнес и обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для откорма и содержания, с целью увеличения поголовья скота. Айчурок намерена и дальше развивать ее многогранный бизнес и построить сараи для скота.
texts.en:
Aichurock is 54 years old, married, and has a son. She has secondary education, and for 14 years she has been working in agriculture and animal husbandry, as well as storing, producing, and selling dried fruits, potatoes, and apples. Near her home there is a stall, where Aichurock sells food products. Today Aichurock has two cows, 15 sheep, and 10,000 som (KGS) worth of goods in circulation. 

Aichurock has decided to expand her business and has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) in order to buy a cow for fattening up and to increase her cattle headcount. Aichurock intends to further expand her versatile business and build barns for the livestock.

loans.use: to buy one cow in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Ayishah

texts.en: Ayishah is a woman married 10 years ago and she has five children. Her husband is ill and they have a house with a small garden. Ayishah grows some plants in the garden and she sells them to the people of the village to cover the costs of the family but she doesn't have a well so she wants to take the loan to be able to dig a well.

loans.use: to dig a well.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a married woman with five children. She faces a lot of financial problems because her family is poor. She has a baby, and they can't buy what he needs, so she started raising some chickens to eat and sell eggs to improve her family's conditions.she will use loan to help her in developing this project for buying more chickens and food for the chickens, and that will help her family a lot.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise.

loans.name: Aseel

texts.en: Aseel is a woman in a family of five. Her family's income is not very good so she wants to work on a small project that will help her husband and help the family. Aseel wants to buy mobile phone cards and sell them and needs the loan to start. It's OK if the profits are small at the beginning because anything will help and after a period of time profits will increase.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone cards and sell them.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en: Manal is married woman with 6 children, the oldest is 15. Her husband works on a farm with a very small income and it is not enough.  Soon they will build a small house and she wants to take a loan to dig a well so she will not spend money on buying water .

loans.use: the borrower will use the loan to dig a well to collect rain water

loans.name: Saba

texts.en: Saba is a student. She finished her secondary study and succeeded with 75.7%. Saba got accepted to university but her family's financial situation is not good enough to pay the fees so her father will not be able to send her. She needs the loan to make her dreams come true and pay for university.

loans.use: to pay for university costs.

loans.name: Lyrma

texts.en:
For the last 5 years, Lyrma has been running a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household commodities such as coffee, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste, fabric conditioner and a variety of canned goods. Aside from that, she raises hogs and engages in seaweed farming as well.

She is a 35-year-old woman with one young dependent. She is asking for a loan to purchase assorted groceries, pigs and seaweed seedlings. These purchases will boost her income and slowly improve her earnings. In this way, she will be able to manage her finances and continue to seek ways to become productive.

loans.use: to purchase assorted groceries, pigs and seaweed seedlings.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita lives in the rural town of Talibon. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells commodities like milk, sugar, soap, seasonings, noodles shampoo and assorted canned goods. She is a married woman with three growm children. Her sari-sari store is situated near her home and her customers are mostly neighbors and nearby residents. 

Lucita would like to improve her main source of living to become more productive and improve her family’s living conditions. She would like to buy supplies such as rice, beverages, condiments and soft drinks for her store. These would fill up her store to attract more customers.

In the future, she is determined that she will be able to continue to improve her source of income to become more productive.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, beverages, condiments and soft drinks.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
For more than 10 years now Edna has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store. She has been selling various commodities including noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, eggs, soap and beverages. She is a 53-year-old married woman with eight children, one of whom is still attending school. 

She is asking for a loan to buy supplies such as canned goods and rice. These will fully stock up her store and could attract more buyers. In this way, her earnings will start to improve and enable her to provide her family with nutritious diets and allow her to continue to send them to school. 

She could also start to save and do some expansions. Edna is hoping that, someday, she will become a successful entrepreneur and be able to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as canned goods and rice.

loans.name: Yuly Astrid

texts.es:
Yuli, de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, su pareja emigro hacía Estados Unidos y la abandonó con su hija que vive en casa.
 
Yuli, tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace varios años, decidió colocar este negocio porque desde que se fue su pareja, ella tomo toda la responsabilidad de la casa y necesita generar ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su hija.

Yuli, necesita el préstamo para comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pan, detergentes, entre otros productos para surtir su tienda.

Yuly, siempre ha soñado con tener un negocio más grande para darles una mejor calidad de vida a su hija.
texts.en:
