Yuly, who is 32 years old, studied up to the ninth grade. Her partner has emigrated to the United States and she and her daughter live in their house.

Yuly has had a small shop for several years, which she started when her partner left, because she took full responsibility for the household and needed to generate income to meet the needs of her daughter.
 
 Yuly needs the loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, bread, and detergents, among other products to stock her store.
 
 Yuly has always dreamed of having a larger business to give a better quality of life for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, bread, detergents, and other products to stock her store.

loans.name: Janilyn

texts.en:
Janilyn manages a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells goods like candies, chips, snack foods, lollipops, canned goods, cooking oil, toiletries and chocolates. She is a 32-year-old  married woman and has three young dependents.  Together with her family she lives in Talibon, Bohol. Her husband is a government employee. 

Janilyn has requested a loan to invest in several sacks of rice. These will fill her store with additional goods to offer to her respective customers. She could then start to improve her earnings and slowly gain profit. 

In the future, she is hoping that she could expand her current source of income to support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to invest in several sacks of rice

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a married woman and a mother of six children from Talibon, Bohol. Her oldest child is 14 while her youngest is 2. She engages in fishing. She catches fish and crabs and sells them to the community. Her husband is also a fisherman. They support each other to provide for the needs of their family.

She is asking for a loan to purchase fishing nets and materials for house renovation. With this loan, she will be able to improve her ongoing catch, which she can then sell on the market. Thus, she can provide her children with a comfortable home to live in.

Maricel is striving hard to continue to improve her livelihood to have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and materials for house renovation.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn runs a sari-sari (variety) store, which serves as the family's main source of income. She sells basic household commodities including coffee, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste, fabric conditioner, and a variety of canned goods. She is a 31-year-old married woman and has three young children. Her husband is a security guard.

She is a hardworking woman who is trying desperately to develop her business, but she is also a sacrificing mother who deprives herself for the sake of her children. She has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, CEVI, to purchase canned goods and bottled drinks.

Marlyn hopes to expand her business more in the future through investing in other business ventures to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods and bottled drinks

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel de 34 años es un hombre el cual se graduó de bachillerato, no siguió estudiando por problemas económicos, actualmente está acompañado y vive junto a su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos de ellos están estudiando en la primaria y su esposa se dedica a vender comida en un puesto en el mercado.

Manuel desde hace 14 años se dedica a trabajar como motorista en una unidad de transporte público, esta actividad  la realiza gracias a su padre quien también era motorista, también junto con su esposa tienen un pequeño negocio de venta de comida lo cual genera un ingreso extra a la familia.


El dinero de este crédito lo necesita para comprar más alimentos, prepararlos y venderlos en su comedor.

El sueño que él tiene es mejorar y poder ampliar su negocio y sabe que con la ayuda del crédito lo podrá lograr.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 34-year-old man who finished his last year of school but could not keep studying because of financial difficulties. He is married and lives with his partner. They have three children, two of them are studying in primary school, and his wife earns a living selling food on a market stall.

Since he was 14 years old, Manuel has worked as a driver in a public transport company. He does this job thanks to his father who was also a driver. As well as this, he has a small business selling food with his wife, which generates extra income for the family.

He needs the money from this loan to buy more food items, so he can prepare and sell them in his eatery.

His dream is to improve and be able to expand his business, and he knows that with the help of the loan he will be able to achieve this.

loans.use: to buy more food items so he can prepare and sell them in his eatery.

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
DY, 43, is a loving father of three children and is married. DY is a doctor of his commune. He can earn about 5 USD a day. DY would like to improve his living standard by having clean energy for household use. Because of the lack of capital, he is asking for a loan to build a biogas digester, under the project of NBP (National Biogas Program) in partnership with HKL. After an initial investment in this system, he hopes that he won’t spend much money on fuel and lessen the smoke from wood or charcoal. 

He is very happy and thankful to all the lenders for their generous behavior. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a biogas digester

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
For the past six years, Domingo has engaged in a retail business. He buys and sells bananas, mangoes, and lato (a kind of seaweed). He resides in the rural town of Talibon. He is a 35-year-old married man with four school-aged children. His income goes for food and school expenses.

He has requested a loan to acquire additional capital to purchase supplies like bananas, mangoes and seaweed. These could help enhance his source of income and allow him to sell a variety of stock.Thus, he could start to save and continue to expand his sources of income.

Domingo is thankful for the loan and is determined to manage it successfully to support the education of his children.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like bananas, mangoes, and seaweed.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a hardworking woman who does domestic work for a living. She goes fishing. She has a two-year-old child. Her partner in life was a fisherman. She lives in the town of Talibon.

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials and materials like amakan (bamboo matting) and lumber for house renovation. These will uplift the condition of her family. She can now improve her livelihood and be able to continue to support the needs of her child.

In the future, she is hoping to put up a small business to have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials and materials like amakan (bamboo matting) and lumber for house renovation.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
55-year-old Mercedes owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities like sugar, cooking oil, eggs, assorted canned goods, firewood and toiletries. She is married and has seven children, two are still attending school. Her husband also has an income that could help defray the household expenses.

She also sold fresh fish to the locals in her place. She has encountered a shortage of funds to continue to fill her store and needs additional capital for fish vending.

Mercedes is asking for a loan to purchase additional groceries and more stocks of fresh fish. This will enable her to provide a variety of stock and to attract buyers. Thus, her income will slowly improve and she will be able to provide her children with good food. 

In the future, she dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable to support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries and more stocks of fresh fish

loans.name: Babelito

texts.en:
Babelito earns a living through selling mineral water to locals in his area. He is a 37-year-old man with a young dependent. Six years ago he started a retailing business to cover the expenses of the entire household.

He would like to boost his earnings, but he does not have enough funds to make it happen. Babelito has joined CEVI to access a loan. He wants to purchase 20 bottles of mineral water. In that way, he will be able to continue to improve his livelihood and save for the future.

He hopes to expand his business more in the future through investing in other business ventures to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bottles of  mineral water

loans.name: Greta

texts.en:
Greta engages is food vending. She sells snack foods like banana chips, and banana cue (deep fried banana with caramelized sugar).
She is a 57-year-old married woman and has four grown children. Her husband works in a construction.

She would like to boost her earnings by preparing a greater variety of snack foods.

Greta is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients like flour, sugar, bananas, and bamboo skewers.  With these, she would be able to increase her production to cope with demands.
 
She is determined that she can make it, to be more productive and to improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like flour, sugar, bananas, and bamboo skewers

loans.name: Timiditha

texts.en:
Timiditha is a 44-year-old married woman who has eight children, five of whom are still attending school. She is from Lila, Bohol. Her husband is a fisherman and a barangay councilor, as well.  For the past 15 years, Timiditha has been buying and selling fish, serving locals and nearby residents. This is her sole source of income. 

Timiditha is requesting a loan to purchase banyera (fish storage) and a bundle of fishing net. She will use the profits from her loan to buy the things she needs. In the future, Timiditha hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase banyera (fish storage) and a bundle of fishing net

loans.name: Navy

texts.en: Navy is 47 years old and a married mother of four children, three of whom are depending on her to support their studying. Navy is a rice farmer and has worked as a construction worker for more than five years to earn a living. She is able to save only 3 USD per day for the emergency needs of her beloved family. Navy is residing in the Kampot province. Due to not having enough capital to keep sending her children to school, she is now applying for a Kiva loan via VisionFund to pay for tuition fees for her daughter, who pursues her Bachelor's degree in Banking. She hopes this loan will enable her daughter to get higher education and have a good job in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for her daughter, who pursues her Bachelor's degree in Banking

loans.name: Kim Vouch

texts.en:
Kim Vouch is 44 years old and a married mother of four children, three of whom are in school. She is a rice farmer and has tailored clothes for more than five years to earn a living. She is able to save only 4 USD per day for emergency needs of her beloved family. Kim Vouch is residing in Kampong Speu province. 

Due to not having enough capital to keep sending her children to school, she is now applying for a Kiva loan via VisionFund to pay for her son’s tuition fees; he is pursuing his Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering. She hopes this loan will enable her son to get higher education and have a good job in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s tuition fees, to pursue his Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Ou Dong District

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is 42 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and her five children in Baqaa.

Iman sells kitchen and ‎household supplies by buying from retail stores on credit and then paying them back. Now ‎she buys from wholesale stores.

Her husband is retired and his pension is not enough to cover the needs of his ‎family. Therefore Iman has decided to help him more by expanding her business and buying more products to sell such as platters, cups ‎and other items in order to increase her income. ‎

loans.use: to buy more products to sell such as platters, cups ‎and other items, in order to increase her income and help her husband. ‎

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, su esposa se dedica a la venta de mariscos, solo tiene una hija que ya está acompañada. 

Luis, se dedica a la agricultura y albañileria desde hace aproximadamente 15 años, no tiene otras actividades y la parcela donde trabaja se encuentra a 5 minutos de la casa.


Luis, necesita el préstamo para comprar herramientas para la albañilería.

Luis, sueña con tener un pick-up para transportar materiales y equipo de construcción.
texts.en:
Luis is 38 years old and has a first-grade education. His wife makes a living selling seafood. He has one daughter, who has a partner.

Luis has been working in farming and building for around 15 years. He has no other trades. His farming land is five minutes from his house.

Luis needs this loan to buy building tools.

Luis dreams of owning a pick up in order to transport materials and building equipment.

loans.use: to buy building tools.

loans.name: Shenaz Bibi

texts.en:
Shenaz is 33 years old and she lives with her big family in Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Shenaz is engaged in farming. She is a mother of five children. She has a large family. She lives with her spouse. On the farm, all of the work is equally divided among the family members. Shenaz takes care of the cows and calves.

With the help of her husband, Shenaz sells her farm milk in the city. She mentions that she is happy to help and support her family with her work on the farm, which brings in some more income, albeit small, for their needs. 

Now Shenaz asks for this loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase a cow for her cattle farm. Shenaz and her family are thankful to the Kiva lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy a cow for herself

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
At the age of 32 years, Srey is working very hard on a small rice field which is far away from her house in Phnum Sruoch District of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. With her husband, they make USD 10 a day. She has been a farmer for nearly 10 years.

Currently, Srey needs some money to buy a motorbike to ride to her work places, but she can’t afford this. Therefore, she has decided to apply for a Kiva loan to help them. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to ride to her work places

loans.name: Corsino

texts.en:
Corsino is a married man and a father of three school-aged children. He is a resident in the town of Antequera, Bohol. Corsino earns a living through his motorcycle transport business and scrap buying business.

Corsino is asking for a loan to have additional capital for his scrap buying business. This will help with bulk purchases and improve his earnings.

In the future, Corsino hopes to expand his business and make it a success. Furthermore, he wants to save money to pay for the school fees of his children.

loans.use: to have additional capital for a scrap buying business

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok, who is 31 years old, is from Phnum Sruoch District, Kampong Speu. She is an experienced and industrious farmer. She can earn around USD 4 a day to support her family's daily needs. She is a lovely mother of four children.

To keep her rice growing well and provide more benefit, Sok wants to use some natural fertilizers. Due to the shortage of money, she would like to get a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers. She hopes that this loan will help her rice growing well as well as bring her more profits. She sends thanks to all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Being a farmer, Huong, who is a 53-year-old man, can only make USD 5 per day to support his family. Huong is residing in a rural area of Rokhak Kiri district, BATTAMBANG province, Cambodia. He has four children, two of whom are married. He has been a farmer for more than 10 years.

Because it hard to find place to toilet, Huong wanted to borrow a Kiva loan through HKL to build a hygienic latrine for his house.

He is very happy with this loan since it will promote his health, environment and living standards. He would like to thank for all lenders for their generosity in providing such a great loan for poor people like him.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita, 55, is a married woman with two grown children. She lives with her family in the town of Antequera. She sells snack foods puto (steamed rice cake), suman (glutinous rice) and banana cue. She has been engaged in this kind of business for 3 years now.

She has requested a loan to buy additional ingredients like flour and sugar. With these, Pedrita will be able to prepare a variety of snack foods to sell to the locals in her place.

She expects that her earnings will improve and she will be able to handle her finances wisely and able to save for future use.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like flour and sugar

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresite has faithfully paid back her previous loan of PHP 50,000 which she used to buy stocks to fill in some vacant shelves of her variety store. She has been operating her store for many years and she continues to develop it into a grocery store. Her husband, Virgilio, is working abroad is also thankful that she complements his hard work through her business.

To take another step towards reaching her dream of an internet cafe adjacent to her grocery store, Teresita would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods and beverages to sell. With PHP 50,000, she could further improve her inventory. She sincerely wants to express her gratefulness and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Teresita aims to help others through her business. She gives utmost importance to good and healthy relationships among her family and other people. She constantly meets with her co-fellowship* members to share testimonies and to study the Word of God. She draws strength and inspiration from this.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods and beverages to sell

loans.name: Vidala

texts.en:
Vidala is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell for her fruit vending business.

Vidala has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from pig fattening and food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Vidala has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Dionilin

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Dionilin works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending.

Dionilin is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

Dionilin has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle

loans.name: Len's Group

texts.en:
47-year-old Len is a farmer living in Kampong Cham province. She is married and blessed with three dependent children, one of whom is in school. She and husband support the family’s living by growing rice and working for others for a fee. The obstacle to rice growing business are pests.

In a group of three members, Len is the leader and she is going to use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to improve crop productivity. She hopes to get more yields from her farming business to make a better living and keep her child in school until graduation.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve crop productivity to increase yield.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sokhem

texts.en:
Sokhem lives in Kandal province and he is single. He works as rice farmer and also works for his neighbors for a fee in order to make a living. He has been involved in his farming business for two years. The lack of water to irrigate in farmland is the main challenge to him.

He is now requesting a new loan from VisionFund to buy a decent motorcycle to commute from home to his workplace. He hopes that this purchase will enable him to get to work on time and reduce the cost of commuting.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorcycle to commute from home to workplace so to reduce cost of commuting.

loans.name: Eng's Group

texts.en:
A 30-year-old married woman named Eng is a resident in Kampong Cham province. She has a daughter in school to take care of. To make a living, she and her husband are growing rice, working in factory and working for others for a fee. Pests seriously damage her rice crop and this is the main challenge to her.

As she is in need of working capital to save her business, so she decided to lead a group of three members to apply for loans from VisionFund.

She is going to use her loan to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer for the farmland. She hopes that she will get abundant yields to improve living standards, to keep her daughter in school, and to buy school supplies.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to grow her crop well and increase the crop yield.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ebenezer De La Ceibita Group

texts.es: El grupo Ebenezer de la Ceibita es un grupo formado por 4 personas laboriosas dedicadas a diferentes actividades pero como un solo fin, salir adelante con el financiamiento solicitado para el desarrollo de sus vidas y el de su familia. Coordinado por María de 49 años quien se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, ella es soltera, y desde hace 8 años comenzó su negocio ofreciendo al crédito su mercadería. Ahora invertirá en la compra de trajes de niños, mercadería, pantalones, licras, blusas y faldas. Así ofrecerá variedad a su apreciada clientela. Las demás socias son Gloria de 34 años, dedicada a la venta de ropa, Lester de 36 años se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, Noel de 22 años dedicada a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante.
texts.en:
The "Ebenezer de la Ceibita" group has four hard-working members. They all have different businesses but the same objective: to move forward with this loan in order to help them and their families progress in life.

The group's coordinator is 49-year-old Maria, who makes a living selling new clothing. Maria is single. Eight years ago she started a business selling merchandise on credit.

She will now use this loan in order to buy children's clothing, trousers, Lycra clothes, blouses, skirts and other merchandise. Maria can thus offer a variety of products to her valued customers.

The other members of this group are: 34-year-old Gloria, who makes a living selling clothing; Lester is 36 years old and makes a living selling new clothing; Noel, 22 years old, who makes a living selling clothes as a street vendor.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing, trousers, Lycra clothes, blouses, skirts and other merchandise.

loans.name: Emma

texts.es: Emma de 61 años es una dinámica mujer que decidió realizar alguna actividad que le permitiera ocupar su tiempo libre, pues ella no considera que la vida sea para dejarla pasar, por el contrario hay que distraerse y que mejor forma que generando recursos.  Ella es viuda y es madre de dos hijas de 43 y 42 años, y en su cafetería lleva nueve años de funcionamiento con excelentes resultados. Todos los días a partir de las 7 a.m. doña Emma tiene listos los tamales, las empanadas, el chocolate caliente y aromáticas que sus clientes acostumbran consumir a primera hora de la mañana.  Ella aplicó a una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para surtir su negocio con aromáticas, café, azúcar, víveres, bebidas y realizar adecuaciones locativas. Con esta financiación Emma logrará aprovisionarse hasta el mes de marzo y con la renovación a la imagen de su negocio considera que las ventas se incrementaran.  Su meta es continuar trabajando y personalmente desea viajar a la tierra santa.
texts.en:
Emma, 61, is a dynamic woman who decided to start a business that would permit her to occupy her free time, since she thinks that life is something that shouldn't be allowed to pass by. On the contrary, it's necessary to stay busy, and it's best to do it in a way that generates income. She is a widow and the mother of two daughters, who are 42 and 43 years old. She has been running her café for nine years with excellent results. Every day, starting at 7 a.m., Emma makes the tamales, empanadas, hot chocolate, and fruit teas that her customers like to have first thing in the morning.

Emma applied for a Kiva loan, which gives her the opportunity to gain access to financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to stock her business with fruit teas, coffee, sugar, drinks, and other supplies and to make improvements to her location. With this financing, Emma will have enough supplies to last until the month of March, and with the improvements to the appearance of her business, she believes that her sales will increase. Her goal is to continue working, and she has the personal desire to travel to the Holy Land.

loans.use: to stock her business with fruit teas, coffee, sugar, drinks, and other supplies and to make improvements to her location.

loans.name: Raj Rajeswari Group

texts.en:
This group was formed in the year 2015 at Rayagada, district Rayagada, Odisha, India. There are five active self-dependent women with an objective of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihoods. All the members of the group have their own professions and businesses.

Diparani is one of them. She has taken a great role for her development and their group members' source of revenue improvement. She is standing third from the left with raised hand in the photo.

She is about 38 years old and living with her small family consisting of her husband and three children.

Her family has been engaged in a grocery shop for the last 10 years. Through this business they earn a monthly income of 8,500 INR. Diparani plans to improve her business in the course of a loan. She will purchase rice, wheat, sugar, oil, tea, soap, detergent, shampoo, biscuits, snacks, potato, onion, salt, etc. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for the purchase of a house.

The other four members of her group are also smart at their professions and also actively engaged with different businesses like vegetable vending, Tailoring, laundry and chicken/meat shop.

This will be the first loan for the group and they all hope to heighten their livelihoods with proper use of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase rice, wheat, sugar, oil, tea, soap, detergent, shampoo, biscuits, snacks, potato, onion, salt, etc.

loans.name: Budhei's Group

texts.en:
Budhei, standing to the left in the photograph, is a differently abled lady. She hails from a small village of Odagaon, Odisha, India. She is a married woman and the mother of four children. Her husband works as a hawker.

The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all of their household expenses, so she started her milk sales business. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality.

She, along with her group member, has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR. Budhei will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase another cow to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

Budhei aspires to add value to her dairy business and start selling paneer, cheese and curd, which will increase her margin of profit by increasing her customer base.

She is eagerly awaiting for your kind help.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to increase her sales.

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda is very hardworking woman. She is a 52-year-old, married woman and has five children, two of whom are still attending school. She runs an internet cafe. In addition to that, she also raises hogs. She resides in the town of Cortes.

She has requested a loan to buy piglets,feeds, and vitamins. These are very essential for her to improve her livelihood. She would like to improve the number of livestock to become productive.

In the future, Wilfreda  is hoping that she will continue to strive hard for the welfare of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feeds, and vitamins

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is the age of 28 and living with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her brother just set up a mobile phone shop near his home. He offers various types of phones and accessories and provides a recharge facility. He has attained a list of customers in just a few days. 

Now he is facing a problem due to the lack of availability of funds because he wants to increase mobile phone accessories, which are very popular and costly nowadays. He just began this business. 

This is the reason Nazia contacted Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan and requested a loan. With the help of the loan, her brother can easily purchase mobile phone accessories and extra recharge units for various networks. In this way, he can easily attract more customers, can generate more, and does not have to have further cash in hand to purchase the desired inventories in order to generate income to cherish his family.

Nazia would be very thankful to such lenders who take an active part in funding this loan.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories and extra recharge units for various networks for her brohter's new mobile phone shop.

loans.name: Evelie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Evelie works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Evelie is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Evelie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 53 years old and married with three children.

Aida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like bread, eggs, candies, canned goods, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

Aida has borrowed and paid back two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Aida aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like bread, eggs, candies, canned goods, soft-drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Pushpalata's Group

texts.en:
Pushpalata is a differently abled lady standing to the left in the photograph. She hails from a small village of Odagaon, Odisha, India. She lives with her husband and eight children, among whom three are married.

Pushpalata's husband is a farmer by profession. He has been working on his own land for many years. He learned his profession from his parents. He mainly grows paddy rice along with other seasonal vegetables. Pushpalata looks after her household work, and after that, she helps her husband in his activities.

As a farmer, he has a great passion for his profession, as all day long, without regard for climate, he goes to look after his crops. The couple works tirelessly to provide financial sustenance to their family. They gained many good customers by their polite and simple behaviour and good quality crops at a cheaper rate. Like the other farmers, they also dream of extending and improving their production.

Pushpalata, along with her group member, has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan to purchase a vehicle for transporting the produce from the place of production to the market. This will help her avoid the middleman charge leading to higher cash flow.

She aspires to use her profit for her children's education and helping her daughters marry in a well settled house.

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle for transporting the produce from the place of production to the market.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 28-year-old married woman who lives with her three children in Lahore, Pakistan. She has run a beauty salon for about four years. She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. 

Due to her great service, she has become very well-known on her street. In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a larger variety of cosmetics products. However, she only has a small amount of cash, so she contacted BRAC Pakistan and applied for a loan. She wants to buy hair care products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. 

Rubina is hopeful that in time she can cater to more customers. She expects a boost in her earnings due to her loan, and she plans to spend a part of her profits on her family. Rubina thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams for her beauty salon

loans.name: Manjulata's Group

texts.en:
Manjulata, standing to the right in the photograph, is a differently abled lady who hails from a small village of Odagaon, Odisha, India. She lives with her husband, who owns a grocery shop, and four children who are in primary school in different grades.

She has been involved in mushroom farming for the past two years, and side by side, she supports her husband in the grocery business.

Currently, the family's earnings are barely enough to manage their family expenses and savings for the future. So, for future development, she has decided to diversify her business with cultivation of mushroom, which is a profitable crop, on a large scale.

Manjulata, along with her group member, has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR. Manjulata will use her portion of the loan to purchase inputs like fertilizers, manures and straw to facilitate the cultivation of mushrooms so that she will be able to earn higher revenue, which will bring her financial stability and security.

With the generated profit, she has a long-cherished desire to purchase another piece of farmland for more cultivation in the future and to provide better educational facilities for her children.

loans.use: to purchase inputs like fertilizers, manures and straw to facilitate the cultivation of mushrooms.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA ES UNA SEÑORA JUBILADA QUIEN SUFRE DE PROBLEMAS DENTALES DEBIDO A QUE PADECE DE UNA ENFERMEDAD CRÓNICA DEGENERATIVA, ESTO LE HA CAUSADO LA  PERDIDA DE ALGUNAS  PIEZAS DENTALES Y DESGASTE EN ALGUNAS OTRAS POR LO CUAL REQUIERE UN TRATAMIENTO REGENERATIVO DE ENCÍA Y DE HUESO. DESGRACIADAMENTE SU PENSIÓN NO LE ALCANZA PARA SOLVENTAR EL TRATAMIENTO QUE REQUIERE CON URGENCIA.
texts.en:
She is retired, and she suffers from dental problems due to a chronic, degenerative disease that she has. This has caused her to lose some teeth and for some others to wear down.

Therefore, she needs regenerative gum and bone treatment. Unfortunately, her pension is not enough to cover the treatment that she urgently needs.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie operates a sari-sari (general) store and requested her prior loan to improve her inventory. With the loan, she was able to provide a better income for her household. She believes that poverty is never a hindrance to reach her dreams. 

Elsie requested another loan for 40,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more grocery items, dry goods, and beverages. This can be a great stepping stone for her goal of becoming a wholesaler of goods. She hopes that with the aid of her business, she can provide for the completion of her children's education. 

Elsie meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business. She draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items, dry goods, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA ES UNA MADRE DE FAMILIA QUE LABORA EN UNA EMPRESA ROTANDO TURNO PARA AYUDAR A LA ECONOMIA FAMILIAR. ESTA PRESENTANDO PROBLEMAS EN UNA MUELA DE JUICIO LA CUAL POR NO TRATARSE A TIEMPO LE PROVOCO UNA FUERTE INFECCIÓN EN ENCÍAS Y FUERTE DOLOR DE MUELAS, REQUIERE UN TRATAMIENTO URGENTE DE EXTRACCIÓN Y ATENCIÓN PARA LA INFECCIÓN. SUS INGRESOS NO SON SUFICIENTES PARA SOLVENTAR EL GASTO DE SU TRATAMIENTO.
texts.en:
She is a mother who works a rotating shift for a company in order to help with the family finances. She has problems with a wisdom tooth. Because it was not treated on time, it caused a severe gum infection and severe pain in her molars.

She urgently needs extraction and treatment for the infection. Her income is not enough to pay for the expense of her treatment.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Goutami

texts.en:
Goutami, 19, was brought up in Koraput district of Orissa. Her parents, of modest means, have done their best for Goutami to compete her schooling and have the opportunity to enter a good college.

Goutami has great hopes for a good, stable job in the city, and a life of independence and dignity. But there is one last bit that remains to be done.

To be able to get into a reputable IT organization, she needs to make some specific additions to her skill set and has decided to pursue her btech course in civil engineering from Nalanda Institute of Technology. She believes that it is the ideal platform for those looking to launch their careers in infrastructure management, application services and software testing. This course will also expose Goutami to aspects of communication, core specialization, on-the-job training and professional skills.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan amount of 1,00,000 INR from Kiva's partner, People's Forum, to pay her engineering course fees and reduce the financial burden of her father. She believes that the loan amount will help her complete her degree smoothly with flying colours.

Goutami is eagerly awaiting for your kind help and support.

loans.use: to pay her engineering course fees.

loans.name: Y.niranjan

texts.en:
Y.Niranjan is a 22-year-old, studious and hardworking boy from Khurda district of Odisha, India. His parents' most cherished dream has been for Y.Niranjan to get a good education and build a successful career.

Y.Niranjan is a very simple and a humble boy. He prioritizes his studies the most above all other activities. This ambitious boy wants to pursue his technical course, but due to his financial constraints, he is facing a lot of difficulties in order to undertake the course. He wants a loan of 50,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum to pay the course fees for getting a degree to be a certified professional accountant (CPA). He is interested to pursue this course, as this is a growing field with a huge range of job opportunities. A competent professional accountant is an invaluable asset to the company.

Your loan amount can help Y.Niranjan complete his course successfully with flying colors and get a job with a handsome package, which will make his family proud to have a son like him. Y.Niranjan is eagerly awaiting your kind hearts to help him achieve his dream.

loans.use: to pay the course fees for getting a degree to be a certified professional accountant (CPA).

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El es un joven de 33 años de edad, casado su familia la conforman 3 hijos y su esposa. Trabaja como encargado de un restaurante por las noches.
Fue diagnosticado con un pequeño tumor en el ojo derecho que esta creciendo hacia la cornea sin tener síntomas. Por las jornadas tan largas de trabaja pospuso en varias ocasiones sus citas con el especialista. Actualmente fue medicado con lagrimas artificiales para evitar la inflamación.  El necesita urgentemente tratamiento quirúrgico y un injerto. Desafortunadamente sus recursos son limitados pues es el único sustento de su familia y sus recursos no  le alcanzan para solventar el tratamiento.
texts.en:
He is 33 years old and married. His family is comprised of three children and his wife. He works as a supervisor at a restaurant in the evenings. He was diagnosed with a small tumor in his right eye. The tumor is growing towards the cornea, but there are no symptoms. Because of his long work days, he postponed his appointments with the specialist on several occasions.

He is currently receiving medication with artificial tears to avoid inflammation. He urgently needs surgical treatment and a graft. Unfortunately, his resources are limited. He is the sole support of his family, and he does not have enough resources to pay for the treatment.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es una señora de 41 años de edad, casada y tiene una hija de seis años. Sufre de desprendimiento de retina en el ojo derecho debido a un golpe que le dieron de niña y nunca la atendieron, en el ojo izquierdo tiene cataratas por lo que ha perdido su visa. Se encuentra incapacitada, trabaja desde hace nueve años como vendedora. Su esposo recientemente fue desocupado de su trabajo, por lo que atraviesa por una situación muy difícil, le preocupa mucho no poder recuperar su vista debido a la falta de recursos.
texts.en:
She is 41 years old and married. She has a six year old daughter. She suffers from a detached retina in the right eye due to a blow that she received as a girl, which was never treated. She has cataracts in her left eye, which have caused her to lose her vision.

She is incapacitated. For nine years she has worked as a sales person. Her husband recently lost his job. Therefore, they are experiencing a very difficult situation. It worries her a lot to not be able to recover her vision due to the lack of resources.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Rasmita

texts.en:
Rasmita is a 23-year-old girl from Khurda district, Odisha, India. She is a charming and industrious lady with a lot of aspirations. Her family consists of her mother, her father, a brother and a sister. Her family condition is not financially sound enough, so she had to face a lot of hardships in her life. But her immense patience and perseverance never allowed her to break down.

She had always dreamed of pursuing higher studies. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum to pay the course fees for getting a degree to be a certified professional accountant (CPA). She is interested to pursue this course, as this is a growing field with a huge range of job opportunities. A competent professional accountant is an invaluable asset to the company. Your loan amount can help Rasmita complete her course successfully with flying colors and get a job with a higher package, and gain name and fame for her family.

Rasmita is eagerly awaiting your kind hearts to help her achieve her dream.

loans.use: to pay the course fees for getting a degree to be a certified professional accountant (CPA).

loans.name: Narmada's Group

texts.en:
Narmada is an enterprising lady standing in the middle in the photograph. She hails from an interior village of Kandhamal district, Odisha, India. She has a family of three consisting of her husband and her daughter.

Narmada is a fisherwoman by profession and works very hard in order to sustain her livelihood and fulfill all the basic necessities. The major problem that concerns her is that she does not have an appropriate toilet in her house and has to depend upon the open field to attend nature's call. This makes her more vulnerable to crime and molestation. She is a very concerned lady and does not find it safe to walk long distances and depend upon isolated places for defecation.

So in order to restore her privacy and increase her safety and hygiene, she, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet in her home and safeguard her family's health so as to reduce the medical expenses and lead a healthy life.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet in her home.

loans.name: Ma. Salome

texts.en:
Ma. Salome owns a bakery. She sells cakes, bread, and pastries. She is a 43-year old married woman and has two children. Together with her family, she resides in the town of Antequera, Bohol. Her husband is a driver.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional supplies like sugar and flour. With these, she will be able to continue to produce more products, and thus be able to cope with demand. Slowly, her income will improve.

Ma. Salome is looking forward to having a stable source of income and becoming more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies like sugar and flour

loans.name: Bishnupriya's Group

texts.en:
Bishnupriya, standing to the left-hand side in the photograph, is a middle-aged woman from Kandhamal district of Odisha, India. She has been involved in the activity of buffalo rearing for four years now. Her motivation behind the activity was to gain financial freedom. As she has experienced that financial freedom that has truly empowered her, she wants to move forward in her endeavor by expanding her business.

She has planned to purchase another buffalo to add to her lot. With her savings, she has managed to accumulate more than 60 percent of the total investment required. For the remaining amount, she, along with her fellow group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum.

Bishnupriya is a married lady, and her husband is employed in a private firm. They are parents to two young daughters, both enrolled in school.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to add to her lot

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is a 32-year-old married woman living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband provides sheltering services for houses under construction. Most of his work depends upon the contract and most of the time he is unable to get any contracts for sheltering services.

Recently her husband has gotten a huge contract but he does not have enough sheltering material to provide proper services.

Perveen requested a loan so that her husband would be able to buy more sheltering material to provide his best services.

Perveen is very thankful to the lenders of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. She is hopeful that Kiva lenders will take pity on her and support her in the form of funding her loan.

loans.use: to buy sheltering material for her husband's sheltering services.

loans.name: Kuni's Group

texts.en:
Kuni, standing to the left-hand side in the photograph, has been a weaver for seven years now. She weaves dhotis and headgear that are used by all the local people for the religious ceremonies. Her products are importantly used for the local gods, goddesses and deities during the ceremonial season. Kuni therefore sees a great potential for her products to earn cash.

Kuni, along with her fellow group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy the necessary raw materials in bulk from wholesalers. Raw materials include cotton threads, starch to treat the threads and chemical colors to dye the threads. Once the products are woven and ready, she will sell them to the locals and the dealers to earn profits.

Kuni is eagerly awaiting your kind help and support.

loans.use: to buy the necessary raw materials like cotton threads, starch to treat the threads and chemical colors to dye the threads in bulk.

loans.name: El Tamarindo De Diriomo Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Tamarindo de Diriomo, está solicitando por primera vez crédito para el financiamiento de sus negocios, quien coordina el grupo es María de 45 años, quien se dedica a la compra de venta de cosechas desde hace 10 años, esta actividad le ha generado ganancias productivas que le permiten a la supervivencia de su familia. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de cosechas de tamarindo. 
Las demás integrantes son Santiago, de 28 años, dedicada a la compra y venta de cosechas, Leyla de 21 años dedicada a la compra de frutas y verduras, y doña Yahaira de 23 años a la compra de venta de cosechas ambulante en diferentes sectores.
texts.en:
The Tamarindo de Diriomo group is requesting its first loan to fund their businesses. María is the group's coordinator. She is 45 years old and has been working buying and selling produce for ten years. This activity has resulted in good profits that have helped her to sustain her family.

With this loan, she will buy harvested tamarind.

The remaining members are Santiago, 28, who buys and sells agricultural produce; Leyla, 21, who buys and sells fruits and vegetables; and Yahaira, 23, who sells agricultural produce as a street vendor in different areas.

loans.use: to buy harvested tamarind.

loans.name: Tuwezeshe Group

texts.en:
Aziza is in her early 40s, single, and has two children who attend school. She has been a food vendor since 2006.  She works from 5 AM to 6 PM daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

Aziza requested her fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to restock the out-of-stock items.  She used the previous loans to increase her food stock and was able to pay back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, repay loans, pay her employees who serve people, reinvest in her business, and cover household expenses.  She dreams of opening another food business in a different area. 

Aziza will share this loan with her loan group Tuwezeshe, which consists of seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in the food store.

loans.name: Hilana

texts.en:
Hilana is a 44-year-old married mother of three. Almost a year ago, she opened a grocery shop to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is becoming well-known in her area.

Today, Hilana is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase and diversify her merchandise with new items and offers for the upcoming Christmas season. She hopes to expand her shop more in the future through adding more sections to increase her income and stay capable of providing her family with descent living conditions.

loans.use: to increase and diversify her merchandise with new items and offers for the upcoming Christmas season

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 65 years old and married with seven children.

Estrella works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, personal product care, and other groceries.

Estrella has borrowed and paid 1 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from buy and sell gasoline.

Estrella aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, personal product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Aneela

texts.en:
Aneela is 28 years old and lives with her three children and husband in the main city of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession and provides transportation services in the main city.

He has been driving over local and unpaved roads, damaging the rickshaw body and engine. His ugly-looking vehicle rattles during driving, hurting business. He wants to maintain his rickshaw but does not have enough cash in hand.

This is the reason Aneela has requested a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. Her husband could buy a new rickshaw body, which is made of polyester, and maintain its engine. She hopes after fixing the vehicle, her husband can drive his rickshaw smoothly.

Aneela praises Kiva's system and its supporting lenders.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw body and maintain its engine to support her husband's transportation services

loans.name: Imtiaz

texts.en:
Imtiaz is a 38-year-old, hardworking woman. She is living with her husband, two children in the area of Lahore Pakistan, where her two sons are studying in fourth and fifth class. She is working as a cook in a restaurant.

Her husband has been running his own tile and stone shop and is interested in continuing to grow his business. As both of them are working so hard to provide for the household expenses, they have not been able to give enough time to their children for the past few days.

Imtiaz has requested a loan from Kiva Field Partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's tile and stone shop. He will be using this amount to purchase more materials like tiles, stones and a tile cutting machine from different cities like Peshawar and Lahore. As a result, her husband will be able to provide a greater variety of services to his clients and increase his net income and savings. Imtiaz wants to live a good and simple life with her family. She wishes to renovate her house, to provide quality education to all of her children, and to fulfill all of the other basic needs of her family. She prays a lot for her children's better future and her husband's good health. Imtiaz is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like tiles, stones and a tile cutting machine for her husband's tile shop.

loans.name: Zhyldyz

texts.en:
Zhyldyz is 19-years-old freshman in the Business Administration Program at AUCA. She is from a village in Osh region of Kyrgyzstan. 99% of the territory of Kyrgyz Republic is mountains and Zhyldyz’s village is located in the mountainous region. Due to this fruits and vegetables are not grown in that area and people just keep cattle. Those places have a very cold windy winter and cool summer. Even her village has few inhabitants and with its hard weather conditions, its people survive and try to keep the national traditions alive to pass it to the next generation.

Zhyldyz has a father and a mother, who are pensioners. They also get small compensation from the state due to their health problems. Zhyldyz finished the ordinary local school there and was blessed to be a finalist for the 1-year-study Preparatory program of AUCA. This Program allowed her to move to the capital of the state, live in the dormitory, get stipend and study at one of the best university’s Preparatory Program. During that year Zhyldyz developed her knowledge in English, Math and computers, so could pass AUCA’s entrance exams and now she became a freshman.

Zhyldyz is used to the city’s life now and feels herself comfortable. But her life in Bishkek caused additional expenses for his parents like for transportation, renting flat, mobile phone expenses, etc. Having discussed with parents their financial situation, Zhyldyz decided to apply for a Kiva loan as it is provided by AUCA.

Kiva lenders support AUCA students during the last 3 years and give students a chance to get loan now and pay it back after graduation without interest fee. The last point is the necessary part for the students as they are sure that they will repay the same sum what they have taken, and will do it with pleasure after finding a good job.

loans.use: to pay for her higher education at AUCA, where she studies Business Administration

loans.name: Napho Group

texts.en: Wan is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Wan and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Wan and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Wan and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Wan and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Wakorintho Group

texts.en:
Mwamini who is in her mid 40's, is married with two children, one is still in school and the other one is grown up. She has been a food vendor since 2000. She works from 5 am to 5 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to increase on the food stock and serve many customers. She dreams of owning a restaurant.

She will share this loan with her loan group Wakorintho which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan

loans.use: to increase on the food stock and serve many customers.

loans.name: Banalata's Group

texts.en:
Banalata is an industrious and enterprising lady from a small village of Kandhamal district, Odisha, India. She has three children. She has been sewing women's clothing in the traditional and unique style for seven years. In a good month, she can sew 25 dresses. She does a wonderful job on her work, and her number of customers is constantly growing.

She needs to upgrade her sewing machine — her old one isn't working anymore after long years of service. She also wants to buy an overlocker. She wants to do embroidery on dresses in order to attract more customers. A new sewing machine and overlocker will be expensive, and she needs a decent amount of money to buy them.

Therefore, Banalata, along with her fellow group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy a new sewing machine and overlocker.

Banalata is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and overlocker

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is the age of 40 and is living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son just set up a mobile shop nearby his home. He offers various types of mobile phones and accessories, and provides a recharge facility. He has attained a list of customers in only a few days. 

Nowadays, he is facing problems due to the lack of available funds. He wants to increase his inventory of mobile accessories, which are very famous and costly nowadays. He just started this business and does not have more cash on hand to purchase the desired inventory. This is the reason Shazia contacted Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, and requested a loan for her son. 

With the help of the loan, he can easily purchase mobiles accessories and extra recharge from various networks. In this way, he can easily attract more customers and can generate more income to cherish his family. 

Shazia is very thankful to lenders who take an active part in loan-raising.

loans.use: to buy mobile accessories and extra recharge for her son's newly set up mobile shop.

loans.name: Golapi's Group

texts.en:
Golapi is a humble lady standing to the extreme right-hand side in the photograph. She is a 43-year-old lady who works as a daily wage laborer in the agricultural sector. She has five members in her family, including three children.

She has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. These unsanitary practices make them vulnerable to infections, and the lack of privacy exposes them to molestation or worse.

In order to restore her privacy and safeguard her, as well as her family's, health, Golapi, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a new and well-equipped toilet to promote sanitation and cleanliness in the community, as well as reduce her unnecessary medical expenses.

Golapi is in dire need of your kind help and support.

loans.use: to build a new and well-equipped toilet.

loans.name: Group Butasya

texts.en:
Hemed, who is in his early 50's, is married with four schooling children. He has been selling building materials for three years now. He works from 7.30 am to 6.30 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to increase on building materials and meet his customers' demand. He dreams of expanding his shop.

Hemed will share this loan with his loan group Butasya which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on building materials and meet his customers' demand.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is a 51-year-old divorced mother of four. Six years ago, she started selling clothes to cover the needs and expenses of her family. She is the only breadwinner of her children and she is sacrificing a lot for their sake. She is a hard worker who has a good reputation in her area.

Today, Wafaa is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with new lingerie items and cotton wear to better satisfy her customers' demands. She hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of satisfying her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new lingerie items and cotton wear to better satisfy her customers' demands

loans.name: Thới

texts.en:
Mrs Thới is 58 years old and she is married. She has had a service business providing housing rentals for 6 years. Thới lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.
Her family has a latrine but it is not hygienic.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is the latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

This is Thới first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Thới hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Enovejes

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of seven children, Enovejes works hard to support her family.

She has a dressed chicken vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Enovejes is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy more stock of dressed chicken to sell for her dressed chicken vending business.

Enovejes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dressed chicken to sell

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria de 52 años de edad, es una mujer que no posee ningún tipo de nivel académico, actualmente está casada y solo una hija vive con ella, los demás son independientes, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura.

Ella trabaja como agricultura, realiza cultivos de maíz y frijol también se dedica a la crianza de ganado bovino y la actividad la aprendió junto a su esposo.

El dinero lo necesita para comprar ganado de repasto ya que tiene bastante zacate para mantener su ganado en buenas condiciones.

Su propósito es tener ganado para pastarlo y luego venderlo y de esta manera obtener ingreso que de alguna manera ayude a pagar los estudios de su hija que aun vive con el
texts.en:
52-year-old Gloria is a woman who does not have any level of academic education. She is currently married and only one daughter lives with her, the others are independent. Her husband works in agriculture.

She works as a farmer, growing corn and bean crops as well as breeding beef cattle. She learned this job with her husband.

She needs the money to buy grazing cattle as she already has enough fodder to keep the cattle in good conditions.

Her intention is to have cattle to graze and then sell so that she can have an income to help pay for the studies of the daughter that still lives with her.

loans.use: to buy grazing cattle.

loans.name: Saudamini's Group

texts.en:
Saudamini, standing to the right-hand side in the photograph, lives in a village of Kandhamal district, Odisha, India, with her husband and 21-year-old son. None of the members of the family has an education that surpassed class 10, and consequentially, their economic conditions are dire.

To augment her family income, Saudamini has been engaged in dairy farming, milking cows for the last seven years and selling the milk at the village collection center. She acknowledges that it is imperative for her to do all that is possible in order to aid the family in leading a good life. Her husband works as a farmer, and her son as a daily wage laborer.

In order to enhance the family income, and thus the monetary savings of the family, Saudamini, along with her fellow group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase another cow and supplement her family's income.

Saudamini is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to purchase another cow and supplement her family's income.

loans.name: Laibani's Group

texts.en:
Laibani, standing to the right-hand side in the photograph, lives with her husband and three children, and they work together to have a harmonious family atmosphere. She is a resident of a small village in Kandhamal district, Odisha, India.

She owns a business making and selling pottery. Her mother taught her to work with clay as a form of income to survive. She has had the business for 10 years. Her work schedule is 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Her advantage is the quality of her products and her customers' preference.

She, along with her fellow group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR. Laibani will invest her portion of the loan amount in raw materials to make pottery. She'll buy raw clay, paint, and other materials so she can work and fill her customers' orders. She hopes to increase her business productivity and have better sales and earnings, which will help her cover family's necessities and pay back her debt.

Her dream is to expand her business so she can give her family a future with better growth opportunities.

loans.use: to buy raw clay, paint, and other materials so she can work and fill her customers' orders.

loans.name: Zaal

texts.en:
Zaal is 49 years old married man. He lives with his wife and child in Kutaisi district. He is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he owns 2 calves, 2 cows and 0.8 hectare agricultural land, where he grows vegetables. Zaal is very hardworking man and does his best to insure a good harvest. 
He decided to start additional business in order to increase family income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 5000 GEL. With the received credit he will purchase a truck and will work on transportation. This will give him a stable income and Zaal will be able to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a truck and work on transportation in order to increase family income

loans.name: Twitezimbere Ruhondo Group

texts.en:
Laurent is 48 years old and is married with six children who are between 10 and 24 years old. He is well-known in the business of selling local drink which he has been doing for about 15 years. Laurent is the president of this group TWITEZIMBERE RUHONDO. He is the first person, on the left side. Laurent's hours of selling local drink are from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day.

He wants to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase a large quantity of bananas to make a local drink for sale. With the profit from this loan, Laurent will be able to purchase enough food for the family, to buy new clothes for the children, to pay school fees for his children and to buy medical insurance for his family, to renovate his house and to buy a cow.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of bananas to make a local drink for sale.

loans.name: Jhunu's Group

texts.en:
Jhunu's tale of perseverance to better her situation is inspiring. She lives in a village of Kandhamal district, Odisha, India. Having experienced and moved ahead of the atrocities in life, one thing she has learned and continuously strives for is financial independence. She wants to grab the most accessible opportunity to set off her goal.

Jhunu has an obsession for cleanliness. It's a good habit made interesting by the fact that this woman is the proud owner of a broom business. The wife of a daily wage laborer and mother of two sons, Jhunu has been in business for the last four years. However, the scarcity of resources has made the business challenging from time to time.

Jhunu's bigger challenge is her lack of personal finances to expand her business and increase her profits. She, along with her fellow group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR. Jhunu will use her portion of the loan amount in order to by raw materials in bulk quantities, as well as tools like a foot-held apparatus, knives, scissors, scales, and needles.

These tools will help Jhunu boost her production, and she will be able to raise bigger profits and establish her business in the local markets firmly.

Jhunu is standing to the left-hand side in the photograph.

loans.use: to by raw materials in bulk quantities, as well as tools like a foot-held apparatus, knives, scissors, scales, and needles.

loans.name: God Is Wonderful Group

texts.en:
Millicent is 34 years of age and sells beverages for the last 10 years. She comes from Assin Fosu in the Assin South District of the Central Region of Ghana. Millicent is divorced. She has 1 child who is 17 years of age but currently not schooling due to financial challenge. She is the leader and group representative of God Is Wonderful group.

Millicent has been desirous to increase her household income to be able to have the capacity to look after her child in the higher educational level. As a business minded woman who always wanted to explore other business avenues, she decided to add Elsa stove distribution to her line of business, after she witnessed the community education on climate change and the introduction of Elsa stove to her community by Field Officers. Millicent has done the necessary market survey with a very promising results. Millicent and her group members are the only local distributors of Elsa stoves in their community.

Elsa Biochar clean cook stove is the only first Biomass stove developed in Ghana with the local people and by the local people. Due to the availability of the Elsa stove fuel, a waste material within their community and its environs, the demand for the stove is very high within their community and its surrounding villages. The stove uses palm kernel shells (virgin pellets) and pellets as fuel. The Elsa stove improves indoor air quality. Its helps in waste management and it is time saving as compared to the local stoves.

Millicent and her group members need micro loan to buy more stoves to meet the demand of their clients. Funding their loan will reduce deforestation, contribute towards addressing global warming and household indoor air pollution. Millicent and her group members thank all their Kiva micro lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy Elsa Biochar clean cookstoves for resale

loans.name: Ojos De Cielo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “OJOS DE CIELO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Alto Lima, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Verónica es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de carne de pollo, venta de polleras (falda para mujer), venta de ropa deportiva, venta de papa frita, venta de muebles, venta de pan, venta de electrodomésticos, venta de productos de higiene. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Verónica es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer por la invitación de un amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio pastelería; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio por iniciativa  con los ahorros que tenía. En la actualidad quien le ayuda en su negocio es su hijo.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de harina y mantequilla por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución
texts.en:
The communal bank, Ojos de Cielo, is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Alto Lima central hub. The group is made up of nine members and is led by a board of directors with Verónica as Secretary. The members of the communal bank take part in a varied range of businesses, including: selling chicken meat, selling polleras (traditional skirts), selling sports clothes, selling fried potatoes, furniture sales, bread sales, electrical goods sales and hygiene products sales.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit these small micro-businesses where Verónica is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer following an invitation from a friend who is also a client of the institution. Currently, she has a small bakery business; she explains that she started this business with savings that she had. At the moment her son helps her in the business.

The loan will be to increase the capital (buying flour and butter in large quantities) that she can get from the wholesalers in the town of El Alto, that she can then bake and sell in her shop. This way of working allows her to generate financial support for her family, as she is a single woman.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Verónica replies that she likes the training and health support that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale flour and butter.

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en:
Nelli is 43 years old and she lives in Tsaghkunk region of Gegharkunik region. She is married and she has two school-aged children. Her husband is a driver and simultaneously he runs a farm in order to manage to sustain their family needs. Nelli used to works at the kindergarden, but now she is also farming with her husband. They have a lot of cattle and they sell milk, macun (national dairy-product), meat and cheese from their farm.

Nelli has now some health problems which greatly limits her activeness in her farming works. This loan of 1.400.000 Armenian drams is very important for her, as with its help she will solve her health problems finally.

loans.use: solve her health problems finally.

loans.name: Donosio

texts.en:
Donosio is a farmer based in Nyabushenyi kajara ntungamo. He practices cattle rearing and banana planting. He is married with six children, having relied on the above as the source of income, he has applied for a loan of UGX3000000= from Ugafode to buy mulches and other farm inputs to improve his plantation.

He requests Kiva funders for support. He is a hard working man.

loans.use: to buy mulch and other farm inputs

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
This is Tigran, living with his wife and ten-year-old son in Aygeshat village, of the Armavir region. He works for a village municipality as an agro-specialist.

In addition to his work, Tigran is engaged in farming. For ten years, he has mostly been involved in land cultivation. Tigran grows and sells cherries, onions, peppers, and eggplants. He says that income from the farm is vital for covering his family's basic needs.

The requested loan will help Tigran to purchase 200 turkeys to develop aviculture, and fodder for feeding the cattle during the winter season, to sustain the farm and gather income for the family.

Tigran hopes that aviculture will give him an opportunity to increase the profit from the farm and provide a better living for his wife and son.

loans.use: to pay for 200 turkeys to develop aviculture and fodder for feeding the cattle during the winter season.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 40-year-old married woman living with her husband and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband runs an electrical shop in a market near to their house in Lahore.

Since technology is changing day by day, there are many varieties of electrical goods coming to the market each day. LEDs have taken over conventional bulb as LEDs are more energy saving. Also, the electricity crisis in Pakistan has led to an increase in demand for chargers and UPS, chargeable batteries to use whenever there is no light. At the same time, people are buying electrical heaters for winters. Therefore, Azra's husband wants to buy more products to sell at his store.

As they lack funds, Azra has requested a loan to help her husband buy these goods and increase his income. She is happy to be able to help her husband and will repay the loan from the ongoing income of the shop.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods for her husband's electrical shop.

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en:
This is Fadia, a married mother of three with eight years of experience in baking specialized Saj bread. She started her own Saj Bread and Manakish baking business in 2007 to support her husband, who is employed as a Bobcat driver to cover their family's increasing living needs.

Fadia is a 37-year-old hardworking woman who is putting so much effort to providing her children with the best education.
