Her three children are enrolled in a private school, so that's why she works hard to expand and develop her business so that she can cover her children's education tuition fees and makes sure they will attend and graduate from a reputable university.

Since Fadia's income combined with her husband's is distributed among their family's daily needs, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to make necessary maintenance to her bakery, especially pasting floor tiles to make cleaning her shop easier.

She is working hard to open a wider Manakish and Saj bakery, and will recruit someone else to support her in this development.

loans.use: to make necessary maintenance to her bakery, especially pasting floor tiles to make cleaning her shop easier.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Phorn is 24 years old, single and lives with his family at Ponhealeou district, Kandal province, Cambodia.

Phorn is a student at National University of Management, Cambodia, in the field of Finance & Banking, year III, semester 1. He wants to be a good staff member in a bank in the future and thus be able to repay Maxima.

He needs money to pay for his school fees, so he applied to Maxima.

loans.use: to pay for his school fees for his third year, where he is studying Finance and Banking.

loans.name: Pao

texts.en:
Pao is 42 years old and a lovely mother of four children. Pao and her husband are farmers, and can earn only USD 4 a day. She is facing a financial issue in her family.

She needs some more money to buy and raise pigs, but she cannot afford. Therefore, now she has decided to apply for a Kiva loan to help the.

She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy and raise pigs.

loans.name: Gad

texts.en:
Gad is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is physically powerful, active and works long hours throughout the week to look after his dear spouse and six children who all attend school. He has been in farming business for the past 13 years to earn returns for his family. He also carries out retail shop business to make sure his family doesn’t lack anything. His dream is to have diversified sources of income, expand his business but his main challenge is inadequate capital.

Gad is requesting for a loan to buy manure for his farm.

loans.use: to buy manure for his farm.

loans.name: Chim's Group

texts.en: Chim’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Chim makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer and village coordinator to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of this man and woman to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Yency Omar

texts.es:
Yency de 26 años de edad, vive unido con su familia y trabaja constantemente para obtener la alimentación de cada día para su familia, mantiene a su esposa e hijo pues dependen de él.

Yency tiene 10 años de trabajar en la agricultura, él siempre ha soñado con administrar una tienda pero por condiciones económicas no ha podido pero se esforzará por lograr esa meta.   
                            
Él  necesita el crédito para comprar productos de primera necesidad como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, café, pan, etc y poner una pequeña tienda.

Él sueña con que su negocio funciones y le genere buenos ingresos para sacar adelante a su esposa y darle estudios a su hijo.
texts.en:
Yency, 26, lives with his family and works constantly to get daily food for his family; he supports his wife and son as they are dependent on him.

Yency has worked in agriculture for 10 years. He has always dreamed of running a store, but due to economic conditions has not been able to, but he will strive to achieve that goal.

He needs the loan to buy staples such as rice, beans, sugar, coffee, bread, etc. and set up a small store. He dreams of his business working and generating good income for him in order to take care of his wife and give his son an education.

loans.use: buy staples such as rice, beans, sugar, coffee, bread, etc. and set up a small store.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Forty-seven-year old Alexander engages in habal-habal (a motorcycle) transportation services, where he transports passengers from one area to remote places for a fee. He is a married man and has five school-aged children.

He also sells native baskets made of buli (palm leaves) to have supplemental income. He has requested a loan to purchase materials like wicker (pliable twigs), nito (a fern) and buli (a kind of palm). These could help produce more finished products and his earnings will be augmented.

Alexander is hoping that he would properly manage his livelihood for the welfare of his family.

loans.use: to purchase materials like wicker (pliable twigs), nito (a fern) and buli (a kind of palm).

loans.name: Carolin

texts.en:
Carolin is a married woman. She has four children.

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She says her biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to own a boutique within five years.

She hopes that, in the future, she will live a better life. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 37-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy produce, such as maize and beans, to sell. He still carries out produce where he primarily sells maize, coffee and beans as the main basis of earning a living. With the profits, he has been able to develop himself and look after his family.

Apart from that, he also earns more money to support his family from coffee and banana farming. He has been dealing in the business since 2008 and has a vision of expanding it into a big one. However, he faces a challenge, like other business people, of bad weather, like heavy rains.

With the requested loan, Richard intends to buy more coffee, maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more coffee, maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en:
Nickson is a 26-year-old hardworking married man with two children, a devoted father who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He also takes care of one dependent.

He used his previous loan to buy more soap, sugar, salt, sodas and other items to sell. He carries out produce, where he mainly sells coffee to earn a living. He supplements this with motorcycle transport and a butcher shop to earn extra income and have improved standards of living for his family.

His dream is to expand his businesses to earn more income in order to educate his children and equip them with skills. His main challenges are inadequate capital and customers.

He desires to use the loan facility to buy more cows for slaughtering during the festive season.

loans.use: to buy more cows for slaughtering during the festive season.

loans.name: Iqbal

texts.en:
Iqbal is a 56-year-old married woman, living with her husband and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband drives a van in Lahore city; he provides the transportation to the passengers from one stop to another. Due to continuous work, most of the parts of the van have gotten depreciated and there is urgent need for replacing them with new ones.

Therefore, Iqbal requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which is the field partner of Kiva. Iqbal hopes that through this amount her husband will be able to buy the spare parts so he can drive it again.

Iqbal belongs to a poor family, and her husband is the single earning source and does not have any other source of income. Iqbal is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair the van for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is married and has four children to support. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda where he practices cattle fattening as his main source of income. He has been in the business for the last 15 years and also tries to do some farming on a small scale.

He has applied for his Kiva loan of UGX 2,000,000 from Hofokam Limited to purchase more cows for his farm for better harvests and the surplus to add a dairy cow for milk production.

He hopes to expand his land as he starts carrying out farming on a large scale.

loans.use: to purchase more cows for his farm

loans.name: Qristine

texts.en:
Qristine is an accountant by profession, working in a local kindergarten. In addition to her work, she also is involved in farming.

Qristine and her family have been running their farm for more than 10 years. They currently keep two pigs and grow cherries, which during the summer season they export to Russia.

The requested loan will help Qristine and her family to purchase three oxen, two sows and fodder for the cattle to sustain them during the winter.

Qristine lives with her husband, two children and elderly retired mother-in-law; they all hope for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for three oxen, two sows and fodder for the cattle to sustain them during the winter.

loans.name: Gardenias Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GARDENIAS” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de queso, venta de muebles, venta de material de escritorio, venta de polleras (faldas para mujer), venta de juguetes, venta de chamarras, venta de pantalón. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maria es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de material de escritorio; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió  de su mamá y lo inicio vendiendo como ambulante con poca mercadería hace cinco años, en la actualidad ella tiene un puesto de venta donde ofrece sus productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de lápices y estuches por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo venderá en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, las capacitaciones y los ahorros que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Gardenias" communal bank is in its second cycle of Promujer, in the regional office of Alto Lima. It is comprised of eight members, and its board is led by Maria.

The members have different businesses, such as selling cheese, selling furniture, selling office supplies, selling polleras (skirts for women), selling toys, selling jackets, and selling pants.

The loan they are requesting will help small microentrepreneurs such as Maria. She says that she has been part of Promujer for six months, and was invited by a friend who is a client of the institution. She works selling office supplies, an activity she learned from her mother. She started selling as a street vendor with a few products. She has now a stall where she sells her products.

She will use this loan to increase her working capital: she will buy pencils and pencil cases in large quantities from the wholesalers of the city of El Alto, and then resell them in her stall. This activity helps her to earn an income and support her family economically; she is married and has a son.

When asked what she likes the most about Pro Mujer, she says that the healthcare, training, and savings services they offer.

loans.use: to buy pencils and pencil cases.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto, se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de pastelitos de platanos desde hace 3 años su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, la joven vive en casa propia con su madre, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas platanos por mayor y azucar para poder contnuar con su tabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face has been pixelated due to her being 23 years of age and living in a high-risk zone, has worked making and selling plantain pastries for 3 years. Her business is located near her place of residence and she has many customers.

The young woman lives in her own home with her mother. She is requesting a loan to buy more plantains wholesale and to buy sugar, in order to be able to continue with her work and thus have a better income.

loans.use: buy more plantains wholesale and buy sugar.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Being that he is a teacher, Chea, who is a 43-year-old man, can only make USD 10 per day to support his family. Chea is residing in a rural area of Ou Ya Dav District, Ratanak Kiri Province, Cambodia. He has four children. He has been working as a teacher for more than 10 years now.

Because it's been hard to find a place to relieve himself and take a shower, Chea made the decision to borrow a Kiva loan through HKL to build a hygienic latrine and one bathroom for his house. He is very happy with this loan since it will promote his health, environment, and living standards.

He would like to thank all lenders for their generosity in providing such a great loan for poor people like him.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and one bathroom.

loans.name: Orn

texts.en: Orn, 57, is a widow who lives in Kampong Cham province with her four children. She earns a living by growing rice and earns $3 a day on average. Recently, some parts of her house have deteriorated and need to be fixed to provide suitable living conditions for her family. Due to a lack of funds, she has applied for a Kiva loan via HKL to pay for the renovation. She is grateful to Kiva lenders for their help in making this possible.

loans.use: to pay for her home renovation.

loans.name: Torre Group

texts.es:
El grupo torre, es un grupo consolidado y formado por 3 miembros que están dedicados a salir adelante para el desarrollo de sus actividades y poder seguir sacando adelante a sus familiares. Martha de 50 años es la coordinadora del grupo se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 8 años, con dinero que le dio su esposo. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de arroz, leña, aceite, jabón, carbón, y demás ingredientes para su preparación. 
Los otros socios son María, de 57 años quien se dedica a la elaboración de dulces, como cajetas, lecheburras, crocantes elaborados de manera manual y artesanal, y don Candido de 58 años quien se dedica a la venta de golosinas.
texts.en:
The "Torre" group is comprised of three members who work hard to get ahead with their families through their activities.

Martha, 50, is the group's coordinator. She started selling food eight years ago with some money her husband gave her.

She is requesting a loan to buy rice, firewood, cooking oil, soap, charcoal, and other ingredients she needs to prepare food.

The remaining members are María, 57, who makes sweets such as cajeta [milk caramel], lecheburras [milk and cocoa], and crunchy snacks, manually and in the traditional ways, and Candido, 58, who sells candies.

loans.use: to buy rice, firewood, cooking oil, soap, charcoal, and other ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en: Purity is married and the mother of two children. She earns a living by running a beauty salon where she offers various services. She has been in this business for three years and operates in a good area where most of her customers are locals. Purity describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital and is requesting a loan for Kes 30,000 loan to buy more beauty products. This is her first loan from SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Las Mercedes está integrado por tres socias exitosas en su vida laboral, coordinado por la señora Marcelina de 62  años de edad, soltera,  tiene un hijo que depende de ella, su negocio es destace de cerdo, por lo que el crédito lo solicita para la compra de  1 un cerdo pequeño y 1 cerdo grande. Las otras socias son las señoras Salís de 54 años dedicada a comercializar ropa nueva y usada en su comunidad de manera ambulante, y María Lourdes  de 49 años de edad, quien tiene una pulpería en su domicilio. Estas socias representan diversas maneras de trabajar y así obtener el pan de cada día para su familia.
texts.en:
Las Mercedes solidarity group has three members with successful working lives and is coordinated by Marcelina, who is 62 years old, single, has one dependent son and works raising pigs. She is requesting this loan to buy one small and one large pig.

The other members are Salís, aged 54, who sells new and used clothes as a street trader in her community, and María Lourdes, aged 49, who runs a grocery store from her home. These members represent different ways of working and of putting food on the table for their families.

loans.use: to buy one small and one large pig.

loans.name: Cathbert

texts.en:
Cathbert is a hardworking married man with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda.

He used his previous loan to buy more crates of beer, soda, and spirits to sell. He is physically powerful and active and he works long hours throughout the week to look after his dear spouse and his children, who all attend school.

He has been in the coffee growing business for the past 15 years to earn income for his family. He also owns a bar and carries out motorcycle transport to make sure he earns more income to look after his family. His dream is to have diversified sources of income and expand his business, but his main challenge is seasonal changes that affect his business.

Cathbert is requesting a loan to buy manure, seedlings for his farm, and more crates of soda and beer for his bar shop.

loans.use: to buy manure, seedlings for his farm, and more crates of soda and beer for his bar shop.

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik, his parents and his sister live in Dalarik village in the Armavir region.

Garik works as an army officer and his father is an electrician. They work hard to sustain a living for the family. Simultaneously with his work, Garik also helps his family with farming work. His family's farm includes two cows, two oxen and hens. Near their house, Garik's family also owns arable land where apricots, watermelons, tomatoes, eggplants and peppers are grown.

Garik has requested this loan to invest in the farm and prepare it for the winter season. He plans to purchase two oxen and fodder for feeding the livestock during the winter.

This will be a big support for Garik and his family, and they all hope for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen and fodder for feeding his livestock during the winter.

loans.name: Luz Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana es una mujer de 30 años de edad, vive en unión con su pareja, tiene una pequeña princesa de 4 años de edad, se dedica a vender calzado en un almacén ubicado en el municipio de Medellín.
SU negocio lo inicio a mediados del año 2013, por gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente, gracias al trabajo conjunto con su pareja logran tener calidad de vida, brindarle educación a su hija y gozar de un buen alimento cada día.
El principal sueño de Adriana es juntar el dinero suficiente para comprar una casa, un proyecto a largo plazo que espera cumplir, también consolidar un buen negocio para heredarlo a su hija.
La temporada de diciembre está a la vuelta de la esquina y ella quiere tener bien dotado su negocio para atender la demanda que se presenta, por ello solicita un préstamo para comprar un completo surtido de calzado, con esta inversión aspira a mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus ganancias, poder generar empleo.
texts.en:
Adriana, 30, lives with her partner and 4-year-old daughter, who she refers to as her little princess. She runs a shoe store in the municipality of Medellin.

She started the business in mid 2013 because of her love and vocation for working independently. Thanks to her work, together with her partner, she is able to enjoy a quality lifestyle, give her daughter an education and enjoy a good meal every day.

Adriana's main goal is to save enough money to buy a house, which is a long-term project. She also wants to consolidate her business and pass it on to her daughter.

The December holidays are just around the corner and Adriana wants to have a wide variety of products to meet market demand. Therefore she is requesting a loan to buy a complete stock of shoes. With this investment she hopes to increase sales and earnings, and generate employment.

loans.use: to buy a complete stock of shoes in order to increase sales.

loans.name: Jose Adan

texts.es:
José, 39 años de edad, es electricista empírico, pero también trabaja como instalador de internet para una empresa, está acompañado, tiene un hijo y su esposa es quien le ayudan en las actividades del hogar.

José, se levanta temprano para alistar los materiales que necesitara para su trabajo, en donde trabaja todo el día, mientras su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo.
 
José, necesita el préstamo para comprar herramientas para desempeñar su trabajo y así poder incrementar sus ingresos.

José, sueña con tener un taller eléctrico más amplio y poder comprar un terreno donde tener ganado para poder darle pasto.
texts.en:
José, aged 39, is a self-employed electrician and also works for a company installing internet services. He has a partner and a son, and his wife helps him with household tasks.

José gets up early to prepare the materials he will need for work, which he does every day, while his wife runs their household and sells beauty products by mail-order.

José needs this loan to buy tools for work so that he can increase his income.

José dreams of having a larger electrician's workshop and of being able to buy land where he can graze cattle.

loans.use: to buy tools for work so that he can increase his income.

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid specializes in organizing themed weddings and special occasions. His business is based on "Zaffeh," a tradition of Lebanese folkloric dancing and wedding processions.

He started this business three years ago, and he is working hard to develop it as much as he can from his acquired income.

Sometimes, it is hard to achieve all your goals from a newly established business, so that's why an acquired YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua will help this ambitious 25-year-old man buy new special traditional costumes to provide his customers with diversified wedding-themed cultures.

Walid is very optimistic about this loan, and he is sure that in the future he will invest future loans into business development and expansion in a well-managed way.

loans.use: to buy new special traditional costumes to provide his customers with diversified wedding-themed cultures.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is 57 years old and lives in the town of Solana with her husband and three children. She earns a living by raising hogs and selling them when they are grown. She also sells vegetables and is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more produce to sell and feed for her livestock. In the future, Lydia would like to improve her profits to save money for her family's emergency expenses.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell and feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en: Aileen is a hardworking woman who earns a living by weaving baskets and growing and selling rice. She is twenty-nine years old, married and the mother of four young children. Her husband is a carpenter and lives with her and her family in the rural town of Antequera. Aileen would like to increase her production of baskets but needs to buy more supplies to make this possible. That is why she has requested a loan from CEVI to buy materials like nito, buli (the palm variety) and wicker (a pliable twig). She dreams of providing reliable support to her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: Ricardo Alfredo

texts.es:
Ricardo de 49 años de edad,  estudió 6º grado, está acompañado y su  esposa   se dedica a los quehaseres del hogar.


Ricardo es comerciante de ropa, actividad que realiza desde hace 8 años y lo aprendió de un primo, esto lo realiza en el cantón donde vive y en los cantones aledaños por lo que se trasporta en su bicicleta y cuando lo hace a otro lugar mas largo se transporta en bus, trabaja durante la mañana y sus hijos le ayudan en sus tiempos libres.


El crédito será utilizado para comprar mas pantalones, camisas, calzonetas, blusas, faldas, ropa interior para damas y caballeros y surtir si negocio.


Él sueña con comprar una moto para poder trasladarse a vender ropa,
texts.en:
Ricardo, 49, studied up to the sixth grade. He is married, and his wife works as a housewife.

Ricardo has been selling clothes for eight years, something he learned from a cousin. He works in the canton where he lives, and in the surrounding ones, so he uses his bicycle. When he has to go somewhere else, he uses the bus. He works in the morning, and his children help him when they have free time.

He will use the loan to buy more pants, shirts, shorts, blouses, skirts, and underwear from men and women to stock his business.

He dreams of buying a motorcycle to transport and sell his clothes.

loans.use: to buy more pants, shirts, shorts, blouses, skirts, and underwear for men and women to stock his business.

loans.name: Luz Nevis

texts.es:
Luz es una joven de 23 años de edad, panadera, una mujer emprendedora, luchadora, la cual tiene un deseo, transformar su vivienda. Como ven en la foto está hecha en madera, su sueño es construir todo su hogar en material, algo que espera lograr en el menor tiempo posible y solo le queda trabajar para así mantener su vivienda e ir logrando este objetivo paso a paso, pared a pared.
Él cliente actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con urgencia para realizar algunos arreglos a la maquinaria que usa cotidianamente, el dinero será destinado espáticamente a: 
•	Arreglo de máquina amasadora
•	Compra de mesa de aluminio 
•	Compra de materia prima al por mayor para producir pan
•	Reparaciones locativas.
Este dinero le permitirá contar con materia prima para trabajar y reparar una de sus máquinas más importantes, con la cual está amasando su futuro, permítele seguir trabajando para alcanzar sus logros, anímate presta ya.
texts.en:
Luz is a young woman aged 23 years. She is a baker and is a hard-working, determined woman who wants to remodel her home. As you can see in the photo, it is made of wood, but she dreams of her entire house being built from quality building materials. She hopes to achieve this as quickly as possible; her only option is to work to maintain her home like this and to reach her goal step by step, wall by wall.

She is currently urgently requesting a loan to make some repairs to the machines she uses every day. Specifically, the money will be used to:

- repair a kneading machine,
- buy an aluminium table,
- buy raw materials for bread-making in bulk, and
- make on-site repairs.

This money will let her obtain raw materials for work and to repair one of her most important machines, which she is using to build her future. This will allow her to keep working to achieve her goals, so please lend now.

loans.use: to repair a kneading machine, buy an aluminium table, buy raw materials for bread-making in bulk and make on-site repairs.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 38 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is very poor and needy woman. Her husband provides sheltering services to earn money to feed her family. He has been operating this business for many years, using wooden planks and bamboos which have been depreciated from time to time.

Salma's husband is unable to continue his business without wooden boards and bamboos. Therefore, she requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy new smooth wooden boards and bamboos to continue his business. She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in her life and her husband will earn maximum profit with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase sheltering material such as wooden planks and bamboos for her husband's business.

loans.name: Sokhy

texts.en:
Sokhy, who is 30 years old, is a farmer in a rice field and she lives in the Prey Chhor district, of Kampong Cham Province. She is a hardworking mother of three children and is married. Her husband is a palm producer. This couple can make a net profit of approximately USD 10 a day.

Currently Sokhy is facing financial issues in her family. She needs to buy some materials to produce palm but cannot afford to, and therefore she would like to get a Kiva loan through HKL to help her.

She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy some materials to produce palm

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman with 3 children, and she describes herself as trustworthy.

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes, and she has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock.

She will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes, and she will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees. Her business goal is to open a boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her children to university level.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Oscar Humberto

texts.es:
Oscar, de 47 años de edad, es empleado, creció con sus padres, tiene dos hijos y su esposa es quien le ayudan en las actividades del hogar. 

Oscar, se levanta temprano para alistarse para salir a su trabajo y trabaja durante todo el día mientras su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y al cuidado de los hijos. 
 
Oscar, necesita el préstamo para comprar un equipo de perifoneo móvil para poder desarrollar su trabajo y así poder incrementar sus ingresos.

Oscar, sueña con tener su propia empresa de perifoneo y enseñarle a sus hijos el trabajo para convertirla en una empresa familiar exitosa en la zona oriental.
texts.en:
Oscar, 47, is an employee. He grew up with his parents and has two children. His wife helps him with the household chores.

Oscar wakes up early and gets ready to go to work. He works all day, while his wife takes care of the household chores and of his children.

Oscar needs a loan to buy a mobile speaker to be able work and in that way increase his income.

Oscar dreams of having his own advertising company and teaching his children this activity, so that it becomes a successful family business in the Eastern region.

loans.use: to buy a mobile speaker to be able to work and increase his income.

loans.name: Giovanni Alejandro

texts.es:
Giovanni, es un hombre soltero de 27 años de edad, soltero el cual vive solo y trabaja como comerciante de perfumes, los cuales realiza artesanalmente, tiene un local constituido, donde tiene los implementos para elaborar el perfume que el cliente desea, siempre y cuando cuente con la esencia.
Su negocio nació de la necesidad económica, aprendió empíricamente de la profesión, con ello busca alcanzar un sueño que es comprar una vivienda pues paga arriendo y está cansado de ello.
Giovanni se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para comprar un surtido de esencias al por mayor de diferentes tipos, ya que comprar en cantidad le sale mucho más económico, con esta inversión espera mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes, incrementar su utilidad, lograr sostenibilidad del negocio, que este proyecto crezca, tenga otros locales, genere empleo.
texts.en:
Giovanni, 27, is single and lives alone. He works selling perfumes which he makes as an artisan. He has a shop set up where he has the tools he needs to make any perfume a customer may desire as long as he has the essence required.

He started the business out of economic necessity and learned the profession on his own. Through his work he hopes to buy a house, since now he rents and is tired of the situation.

Giovanni is requesting a loan to buy a variety of different essences wholesale which makes it much less expensive to produce the perfumes. With this investment he hopes to increase sales and attract more customers, which will earn him more profit, make the business sustainable and allow it to grow so he can establish other shops and generate employment.

loans.use: to buy essences to make perfumes.

loans.name: Yuly Andrea

texts.es:
Yuli es una joven de 18 años de edad, madre de un pequeño de 3 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja la cual se dedica al negocio de transporte de personas. 
Ella se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para completar el dinero suficiente para comprar un motocarro para transportar 4 personas, su pareja le enseño la profesión y quiere ejercerla de manera independiente, buscando la libertad financiera y ayudar al sostenimiento de su hogar.
Este préstamo le permitirá a una madre joven trabajar para construir un futuro prometedor a su hija.
texts.en:
Yuli, 18, is a young mother of a three-year-old daughter. She lives with her partner who works in passenger transportation.

She is requesting a loan to have enough money to buy a motor rickshaw to transport up to four people. Her partner has taught her the profession and she wants to work independently, seek financial independence and help support the household.

This loan will allow this young mother to work ad build a promising future for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy a motor rickshaw and start a business.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en: Greetings from Palestine! This is 25-year-old Samer from the Deir Sharaf neighborhood in Nablus city. He is single with no kids. Samer used to work in construction for other employers. With his brothers, two years ago he started working for his own benefit. Samer says that the main challenge to his business is his limited ability to buy a car for his employees so they can easily reach the workshops. He has required this loan from ACAD in order to buy new construction equipment and materials. He hopes that the income from this loan will allow him to expand his business. In the future, Samer plans to improve his business and have several workshops to construct. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy new construction equipment and materials.

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
José de 68 años de edad, es agricultor, no tiene ningún grado académico debido a la pobreza extrema en que vivía junto a sus padres, está acompañado y tiene 6 hijos junto a su compañera de vida, todos mayores de edad y están casados.

José se ha dedicado desde muy pequeño a la agricultura y la ganadería, sus padres al ver la gran necesidad y crisis económica que vivían, le enseñaron a trabajar para que se ganara el sustento diario, él siembra maíz en su localidad, también le gusta comercializar ganado, los cuida  un tiempo y cuando están grandes y gordos los vende, actualmente tiene 2 vacas lecheras a las cuales les saca provecho vendiendo leche y queso.

José necesita el crédito para comprar 2 novillos de repasto, y los venderá cuando estén grandes para obtener ganancias y  así poder ayudar a su familia con los gastos del hogar.

El sueño  de José es comprar un terreno para un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
José, 68, is a farmer and has no academic degree due to the extreme poverty in which he lived with his parents. He is in a relationship and has 6 children with his life partner, all adults and married.

José has worked from a very young age in agriculture and livestock. His parents, in view of the great neediness and economic crisis in which they were living, taught him to work in order that he might earn his daily sustenance. He grows corn in his area; he also likes to market cattle. He takes care of them for a time and when they are big and fat he sells them. Currently he has 2 dairy cows, which bring him profit throught the sales of milk and cheese.

José needs the loan to buy 2 grazing steers, and he will sell them when they are big to obtain profits and thus be able to help his family with household expenses. José’s dream is to buy a piece of land for improved welfare.

loans.use: buy 2 grazing steers.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en: Gerardo is a resident of Carles, Iloilo where fishing is one of the main sources of income for most people. He is 65 years old, married, and the father of ten children, all of whom are grown. Gerardo has supported his family for 45 years and hopes to continue operating his business to have food to eat, pay bills and meet some personal expenses. He is requesting this loan to make this possible by buying a new fishing net.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing net.

loans.name: Romir

texts.en:
Romir has had a habal-habal (motorcycle) transport service for seven years now serving locals in the community where he resides.
He is a 32-year-old married man and has two children, both who are attending school.  Together with his family, he lives in the rural town of Alburquerque.
 
He would like to augment his income to cater to his financial needs. Therefore he joined CEVI to avail himself of a loan to finance his source of income.
Romir wants to purchase two tires, motorcycle accessories and rice for consumption. These are very vital and could enable him to continue supporting his family. With these resources, he could start to invest other sources of income to become sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase two tires, motorcycle accessories and rice for consumption.

loans.name: Nicolas De Jesús

texts.es:
Nicolás de 33 años de edad, es agricultor, estudió hasta noveno grado,  debido a la pobreza extrema en que vivía junto a sus padres , no pudo continuar estudiando,  está acompañado, tiene 2 hijos junto a su compañera de vida, el primero tiene 4 años  y un pequeño de un año, su  pareja es ama de casa.

Nicolás se ha dedicado desde la edad de 19 años  a la agricultura y la ganadería, gracias a a su padre que fue el que le enseñó este trabajo para que se defendiera en la vida y se ganara el sustento diario, Nicolás siembra maíz, el cultivo lo tiene a medio kilómetro de su hogar, también le gusta comercializar ganado de repasto, los tiene un tiempo y cuando están grandes y gordos los vendes es una persona muy emprendedora.

Nicolás necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas entre ellos, semilla, abono, veneno para la plaga y preparará la tierra, además pagara mano de obra.

El sueño  de  Nicolás es mejorar su casa para darle una vida digna a sus pequeños hijos, ademas educación para  un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Nicolas, 33, is a farmer with a ninth grade education. Because of his parents' extreme poverty he was unable to continue his studies. He and his partner have two children, a four-year-old and a one-year-old. His partner is a homemaker.

Nicolas has been working in agriculture and livestock farming since the age of 19, thanks to his father who taught him enough to defend himself in life and earn a living. Nicolas plants corn which he grows a half kilometer from home. He also sells grazing cattle which keeps for a while for fattening before selling them. He is a very enterprising person.

Nicolas needs a loan to buy farm supplies including seeds, fertilizer, pest control agents, and also to prepare the land and hire workers.

His goal is to improve his house and give his young children a decent lifestyle. He also wants to give them an education for their well-being.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies including seeds, fertilizer, pest control agents, and to prepare the land, as well as paying workers.

loans.name: Kwin Village Group 1

texts.en:
The previous loan from Kiva community helped Kwin Group 1 to purchase ducks and high quality feed.

These loans from Proximity Designs freed the borrowers from taking extra loans with high interest rates. Instead of paying this high interest, the members were able make savings and invest more in their businesses.

The featured borrower, Ye could cover family’s monthly expenses and invest in his primary business with his first loan from Proximity. The upcoming loan will be helped to 30 members. Like his fellow members, Ye plans to purchase more ducks and repair duck farm.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and to repair their duck farm.

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Venancia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Venancia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Nelson Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Nelson es un hombre muy emprendedor y creativo, desde hace mucho tiempo ha querido ser independiente y tener su propio negocio de restaurante.

Actualmente puede materializar su sueño gracias su gran capacidad de trabajo, al apoyo que recibe de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que deseen que él salga adelante con su negocio.

De este negocio dependerán su esposa y sus hijos a los cuales desea enseñarles del negocio y dejarles un legado.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar sillas, mesas, utensilios, ollas, e insumos para preparar almuerzos típicos y desayunos.

Con un préstamo podrás a poyar a un hombre lleno de vida y empuje para su familia!
texts.en:
Nelson is a very enterprising, creative man who has wanted to be independent for a long time and have his own restaurant.

He is currently able to realize his dream thanks to his great work capacity, the support he receives from Corporacion Interactuar and from the people who want him to get ahead in his business.

His wife and children depend on the business so wants to teach them about it and pass it on to them.

Nelson is requesting a loan to buy chairs, table, utensils, pots and supplies to make typical breakfast and lunch foods.

Though this loan you can support a man who is full of life and drive for his family.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, utensils, pots and supplies to make the typical foods he sells.

loans.name: Kwin Village Group 2

texts.en:
Kwin Group 2’s previous loan from Proximity Designs helped 24 group members expand their livestock businesses. Like his fellow members, featured borrower Khine used funds to expand his duck business and is now able to cover all monthly expenses without taking on high-interest-rate loans from local moneylenders.

Pictured above are committee members who are leading the group in all processes of the loan. This new loan will support Kwin Group 2 members to purchase more ducks and buy high-quality feed. The group is so grateful for all the help from Kiva lenders, and they are excited to continue to grow their business with Kiva’s help.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and high-quality feed.

loans.name: Las Chupaquinas Group

texts.es: Noemi de 29 años es conviviente y tiene dos hijos menores. Al ver que el dinero no alcanzaba para hacer frente a los gastos de su hogar decidió dedicarse a la agricultura para sembrar hortalizas y después venderlas en el mercado. Su deseo mas grande es tener su propio terreno para sus sembrios.El crédito lo invirtió en la compra de semillas y fertilizantes. Pertenecer al banquito "Las Chupaquinas" le ha ayudado a tener una mejor calidad de vida. Se siente muy agradecida con las personas de Kiva por ayudar a cumplir sus metas. Noemi es la que esta con una chompa rosada y esta cargando a su bebe.
texts.en:
Noemi is 29 years old, is in a relationship and has two children. Seeing that their money couldn't keep up with the household expenses she decided to work in agriculture growing vegetables and then selling them in the market. Her biggest wish is to have her own land for her crops.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of seeds and fertilizer. Belonging to the "Las Chupaquinas" communal bank has helped her have a better quality of living. She is very grateful to the people of Kiva for helping her meet her goals. Noemi is wearing a pink sweater carrying her baby.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Zinat

texts.en:
Zinat is a 56-year-old widowed fashion designer. She has been working as a fashion designer since 2009. She has acquired intensive vocational training in this domain, and developed her skills while she was working abroad.
She is well known in her region, and recommended by most of her customers. Her business is her only source for living, that's why she works hard to develop it in a well managed  way.
Zinat is working hard to invest a lot in developing her business, but she is dreaming of visiting sacred and holistic regions for a long time, and she can't save the requested amount from her business income, because she believes that she has to continue developing it.
So, she decided to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for visiting sacred and holistic regions travel expenses.
She is looking forward for these visit for a long time, and is sure that when she comes back she will be in a better mood and will work on new designs to attract customers attention.

loans.use: to pay for visiting sacred and holistic regions travel expenses.

loans.name: Suo

texts.en:
Suo, who is 42 years old, is a farmer who lives in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham Province. She is a hardworking mother of six children, five of whom are married.  Suo and her husband can make a net profit of approximately $10 (USD) a day.
Now is the farming season, Suo is faced with a financial issue in her family. She needs some money to buy seeds and others related farming materials to use in her rice field. After getting to know that HKL provides Kiva loans, Suo has decided to apply for a Kiva loan. She would like to thank to all lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds and others related farming materials

loans.name: Semion

texts.en:
Semion engages in hog raising as his livelihood.  He raises and sells pigs to cover the expenses and needs of the entire family. Aside from hog raising, he also does farming. He grows and sells rice.
He is 50-year-old married man and has five children. He lives in the town of Sierra Bullones.

Semion is planning to improve the quality of hogs and yield a bountiful harvest.  He has requested a loan to buy pig feed and fertilizer. These are very essential tools that could help augment both sources of income.

He determined to continue to manage his livelihood efficiently to become more productive in the future.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and  fertilizer

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is from the town of Baclayon. She is 47-years-old, married and has 2 school-aged children. She is a fish vendor. Her husband is a driver.  She joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.

Gina  has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Gina  is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to buy weighing scale, fish and foam (fish storage).  

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to buy a weighing scale, fish and foam (fish storage).

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Hog-raising combined with duck and chicken-raising are practical endeavors that surely alleviate food shortages in the community. Lerma has been in this business for many years, and she’s convinced that it is such a profitable enterprise that offers affordable food. Her income from this business helps sustain their daily needs. Despite some problems like lack of capital for feed and animal medicines, she continues with her business because of its contribution to food production. She lives in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental together with her foreman husband, Dominic, and their children.

Now that Lerma aims to distribute a bigger volume of affordable pork, eggs, and duck and chicken meat, she wants to buy additional piglets, ducklings and chicks to raise. She would like to ask for a PHP 30,000 loan for this purpose. She will also buy vitamins and medicines for these animals.

In the future, she wishes to have a big piggery and poultry business. She really doesn’t stop dreaming.

She shares her experiences and aspirations with her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative. They regularly meet every week to share stories about their lives and businesses and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, ducklings and chicks to raise; plus vitamins and medicines for these animals.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with 5 children. She operates a retail business where she sells onions, tomatoes, cabbages. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions, cabbages. She hopes that in the future, he will have improved living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions, cabbages.

loans.name: Guderia

texts.en: Guderia is a hardworking lady and an enterprising farmer in her village growing rice, beans, maize and banana on a large scale. She started these businesses with the hope of earning an income for her family, she works there 8 hours a day and 6days per week. Her main challenge is limited capital, which hinder expansion of her business. however, she is hoping of building a permanent home for her family. She has asked for another loan to help her weed her maize and rice gardens.

loans.use: to help her weed her maize and rice gardens..

loans.name: Luz Edilma

texts.es:
Ella es Luz Edilma una mujer humilde, honesta y honrada la cual se dedicaba a ejercer la labor de ama de casa, atendiendo a su pareja con quien vive en unión libre y a su hijo y a su hijo de 19 años de edad, tanto su pareja como su hijo se dedican a vender frutas y verduras y le enseñaron está profesión a Luz Edilma.
Buscando obtener mejores recursos, trabajar codo a codo con su familia para mejorar las condiciones de vida, construir su hogar en material (adobe y concreto), comer mejor, motivar a su hijo para que estudie y aspire a algo mejor.
Ella solicita un préstamo el cual quiere utilizar en la construcción de una tienda en madera, estanterías, balanzas y surtido de frutas y verduras para iniciar su negocio como independiente.
texts.en:
This is Luz Edilma, a humble, honest and honorable woman, who was a housewife, attending to her partner with whom she lives in a common-law marriage and to her 19 year-old son. Both her partner and her son sell fruits and vegetables and they taught Luz Edilma this profession.

She is looking to obtain better resources, to work side-by-side with her family to improve their living conditions, to build their home of material (adobe and concrete), to eat better, and to motivate her son to study and aspire to something better.

She is requesting a loan which she wants to use to build a store with wood, shelves, scales, and an assortment of fruits and vegetables to start her business as an independent.

loans.use: build a store with wood, shelves, scales, and an assortment of fruits and vegetables to start her business.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is a 46-year-old father who has three children. He lives with them in Baqaa. He has a coffee shop that produces special coffees, and he sells direct to his buyers. Ismael is a father and his main aim is to give his children a decent life and teach them good education.

Ismael is known for the quality of his products, as his coffee shop holds Fair Trade. He uses good machines for roasting coffee. Ismael applied for a loan to help him to buy materials such as nylon, sieves, and a new machine for roasting the coffee, etc. The loan will enable Ismael to continue producing his coffee in the best possible conditions which will allow him to choose the best markets for his coffee. Ismael wants to use this income from his coffee to improve his living conditions, make investments to help him produce better coffee, and make his shop more attractive for customers.

loans.use: to buy materials such as nylon, sieves, and a new machine for roasting the coffee.

loans.name: Denis Beatriz

texts.es:
Denis, de 21 años de edad, estudiar hasta noveno grado, está soltera y vive con sus padres y un hermano. 

Denis, desde hace 4 años comenzó con una granja de pollos de engorde, como ya no pudo seguir estudiando y por eso decidió iniciar a trabajar, este negocio lo inicio con 25 pollos y luego fue aumentado gracias a un crédito que le fue otorgado, ahora tiene una granja con 500 pollos y su familia es quien se involucra en el negocio; su horario de trabajo es desde las 5:00 a.m. y termina a las 5:00 p.m.

Denis, necesita el préstamo para comprar concentrado y para comprar más pollo para ampliar la granja. 

Su sueño es, que su negocio sea más grande y también desea construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Denis is 21, single and attended school until the ninth grade. She and her brother live with her parents.

Four years ago when she could no longer attend school, she decided to work. She started a farm rearing broiler chickens. She started the business with 25 chickens and when she had a loan approved it expanded. Now she has 500 chickens on her farm and her family in involved in the business. She works from 0500 am until 1700 .

Denis needs the loan to buy chicken feed and more chickens to expand the farm. Her dream is to grow her business, she also would like to build her own home.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and more chickens to expand her farm.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela, age 50, makes and sells ladies' clothing items from her home to earn an income. She buys the cloth at the market at a low cost, then sews the clothing and sells it at a profit. She has gained a strong clientele among the ladies of her community, who appreciate her clothing selection and quality.

At present, there is a great demand for her clothing items, as the winter weather has begun and people need warmer clothes. She has therefore requested a loan, so that she can provide a greater variety of garments to meet demand.

Shakeela's husband is a welder, offering welding services in the local community, and he supports his wife and five children with his wage. The family lives in Lahore. They are able to build savings thanks to Shakeela's earnings. 

Shakeela dreams of a bright future for her children and is determined to provide them with a better education. Shakeela is very thankful to her Kiva lenders and to Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of garments to offer for sale, in order to fulfill customer demand.

loans.name: Naomi Wairimu

texts.en: Naomi liked Takamoto biogas because of its flexible loan repayment terms and its reliability.  Naomi is a poultry and dairy cattle farmer and she will find more uses for her manure.

loans.use: to buy a bio-digester for clean reliable cooking.

loans.name: Maristas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Maristas, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirtha, ella es peluquera, y por medio de su pequeño negocio tiene los medios para poder dar a su familia una mejora calidad de vida.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que pone todo de si para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos, con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo.
Mirtha pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues y otros, de manera a poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes, y esforzándose por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The Maristas Group is in the poverty elimination program, where one of the members is Mirtha. She is a hairdresser, and with her small business, she has the means to give her family a better quality of life.

She is a hard-working and enterprising person, who gives her all, with a great deal of effort and sacrifice, to be able to improve her living conditions and that of her loved ones.

Mirtha is requesting this loan to invest it in the purchase of dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses and other items, so she can continue to give her customers good service, and strive to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses and other supplies for hairdressing.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Con 56 años de edad, María vive al lado de su hija de 23 años y su nieta de 7 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora quien en busca de obtener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos del hogar, se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos planchando en diferentes viviendas, y también cuenta con un pequeño negocio de confección de ropa. Estas actividades las ha realizado desde hace 25 años y gracias a ello es bien reconocida en las cercanías. María en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arena, cemento, hierro y pago de mano de obra para la construcción de un muro perimetral, logrando de esta manera tener una mayor seguridad en su hogar. Así también María se encuentra muy agradecida con el crédito anterior ya que gracias a ello pudo cambiar el techo de su vivienda y construir un cuarto habitación para su nieta.
texts.en:
At 56 years old, María lives alongside her 23-year-old daughter and her 7-year-old granddaughter.  She is an enterprising woman who works as a domestic, doing ironing in various homes.  In addition, looking to get the money necessary to cover her household expenses, she has a small business sewing clothing.  She has been doing these jobs for 25 years now, and thanks to them she is well known in the neighborhood.

Looking for a better quality of life, María is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in sand, cement, and rebar, and to pay for the labor costs to build a perimeter wall.  Doing this will give her home better security. 

María was very happy with her previous loan because thanks to it, she managed to put a new roof on her home and build a bedroom for her granddaughter.

loans.use: to invest in sand, cement, and rebar, as well as the labor costs to build a perimeter wall

loans.name: Lorena Lizeth

texts.es:
La  Joven Lorena Lizeth de 25  años de edad vive su esposo en su casa de habitación ubicada en una aldea  de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace cinco años al negocio de elaboración y venta de utensilios de barro, como adornos de forma tortugas, floreros, gallos, cubetas, platos, etc. La mayoría de sus clientes son los que transitan hacia el Salvador y de regreso los que viajan hacia Tegucigalpa, vende variedad de piezas de artesanía es un ejemplo de trabajo y dedicación, actualmente ya está asociada a una cooperativa de artesanos donde también expone sus piezas de arte en otras ciudades.
Lorena Lizeth solicita el préstamo para la compra de tierra, leña y pintura que son la materia prima para elaborar sus productos,  con el apoyo de este crédito  pretende mejorar sus ingresos y suplir la necesidad de financiamiento. Su sueño es graduarse de la universidad y tener un mejor taller con varias operarias.

 San Lorenzo, Honduras – Noviembre del 2015.
texts.en:
The young woman, Lorena Lizeth is 25 years old. She lives with her husband in her home located in the village of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras.

For five years she has made a living making and selling clay goods like decorations in the form of turtles, vases, chickens, buckets, plates, etc. The majority of her customers are people that are travelling to El Salvador and those returning to Tegucigalpa. She sells a variety of artisan pieces, an example of her work and dedication. Currently she is associated with an artisan cooperative where she also displays her art pieces in other cities.

Lorena Lizeth is requesting a loan to buy clay, firewood, and paint which are the basic materials for the create of her products. With the support of this loan she will attempt to improve her income and make up her financial needs. Her dream is to graduate from university and have a better workshop with many employees.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – November, 2015.

loans.use: to buy clay, firewood, and paint for her business.

loans.name: Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: Grupo emprendedoras está conformado por dos mujeres con muchos deseos de superación y un hombre trabajador, es coordinado por doña Yelba una señora laboriosa de 56 años de edad, casada,  quien se dedica a la venta de ropa y ha sacado adelante su negocio por si sola desde hace siete años. Es el crédito número 4 que solicita en la institución porque desea invertir en la compra de  camisas, pantalones, zapatos y chinelas debido a que una de sus metas es comprar un frízer con las ganancias para dedicarse a la venta de gaseosa. La segunda socia es María de 56 años propietaria de una librería y don Manuel de 52 años quien se dedica a la venta de lotería.
texts.en:
The Emprendedoras Group is comprised of two women with great desire to succeed, and one hardworking man. It is led by Yelba, an industrious, 56 year old, married woman. She sells clothes and has moved her business forward by herself for the last seven years.

This is the 4th loan that she seeks from the institution because she wants to invest in the purchase of shirts, pants, shoes and sandals. One of her goals is to buy a freezer with her earnings, so that she can sell sodas. The second member is María, who is 56 years old, and the owner of a bookstore; and Manuel, who is 52 years old and works selling lottery tickets.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, shoes and sandals.

loans.name: José Hernan

texts.es:
El cantón el Carmen se destaca por la agricultura, se cultiva el plátano barraganete, malanga y gran variedad de frutas. En la ganadería se destaca la cría de ganado vacuno, equino, porcino y aves de corral. Tiene un clima cálido húmedo excelente para las siembras en todo el año.
En este lugar vive el señor José, tiene 27  años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad. Su esposa es manicurista y ama de casa. Viven en un departamento que es arrendado.
José se dedica a la cría de cerdos y  aves de corral en una pequeña granja de sus padres,  en temporadas compra  cerdos los cría y cuando ya es tiempo los faenan y luego vende la carne por libras,  lleva  años dedicada a esta labor y les ha ido bastante bien, también trabaja en una farmacia veterinaria los días viernes, sábados y domingos de 7h00 a 7 pm. Su esposa es manicurista el trabajo lo realiza de puerta a puerta ya que no tiene un local para esta actividad, ella vende ropa por catálogo, trabaja tres días a la semana o cuando solicitan su servicios, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene  algún tiempo a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende es ropa para niños y damas. 
Va a utilizar el crédito en comprar cerdos, alimentos y medicinas. Es su segundo ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito  y está muy contento porque  le han ayudado mucho los créditos. Su sueñoes tener una veterinaria propia y culminar su carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
El Carmen Canton is known for agriculture. The crops are barraganete plantains, malanga, and a wide variety of fruit. In ranching dairy cows, horses, pigs, and poultry stand out. The warm and humid climate is excellent for growing crops all year.

This is where José lives. He's 27 years old and married, and has a son, 5. His wife is a manicurist and homemaker. They live in a rented apartment. José earns a living raising pigs and poultry on his parents' small farm. He buys pigs seasonally and raises them; he butchers them when the times comes and sells the meat by the pound. He has been in this line of work for years and it has gone pretty well for him. He also works in a veterinary pharmacy every Friday, Saturday, and Sunday from 7 a.m. until 7 p.m. His wife is a manicurist and works door-to-door because she doesn't have a store for her work. She sells clothing via catalogue, working three days a week or whenever her services are requested. She leaves her products on credit and collects every week. She has been in this job for some time and it's going very well for her. She says what she sells most is clothing for women and children. He is going to use the loan to buy pigs, feed, and medicine. It's his second loan cycle with the credit group and he's very happy because the loans have been very helpful to him. His dream is to have his own veterinary business and to finish college.

loans.use: to buy pigs, feed, and medicine

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en:
Onesmus is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a retail business where he sells onions, tomatoes. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of onions, tomatoes. His business goal is to own a large grocery store within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved living standards. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of onions, tomatoes.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a thirty year old hardworking man living in Masindi, Uganda. He has a motorcycle that does transport business. He has been in the motorcycle transport business for four years. He wanted to take care of the family and so he started this business. Poor roads affect his business in a way that he has to keep repairing his motorcycle, which is an expenditure.

William dreams of buying land to construct for his family. He requests a loan to buy cement to build his house.

loans.use: To buy cement to build his house.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a thirty-four-year old married man with four children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He lays bricks to earn a living and this has allowed him to meet the basic needs, such as food and school fees, for his family. He also rides a motorcycle, locally known as boda boda, to get extra income. Prolonged rains have been his major challenge, while his dreams are to expand his brick business and buy a lorry to help him in transportation.

John is in need of a loan to construct a cover for his bricks.

loans.use: to construct a shade for bricks

loans.name: Joselyn

texts.en:
Joselyn is a thirty three year old hardworking married mother of three living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She runs a restaurant alongside agriculture which businesses she started six years ago with the intention of growing her earnings and taking good care of her family. In the future, Joselyn wants to expand her business so as to realize more profits and educate her children but she faces challenges of inadequate capital to meet the growing demand and high rate of defaulters. This limits her stock turnover and the productivity of her business.

She is requesting for a Kiva Loan to buy more sacks of rice, maize flour, beans for her restaurant business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice, maize flour, beans for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Mike

texts.en:
Mike is a hard working lady who is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the good financial support towards her charcoal sales business. She is now able to maintain a constant flow of supply to her customers and, therefore, increase her income.

Mike will use the loan to buy another stock of charcoal to sell, boosting her profit.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for sale

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es:
Carmen cuenta con una gran experiencia en la actividad de la confección, tiene su taller de confección a terceros en su casa desde hace 25 años. 
Trabaja durante todo el día y con su taller desea generar empleo para personas con muchas necesidades. 
Esta actividad la aprendió de su madre quien le enseñó desde muy pequeña. La ventaja es que ya tiene reconocimiento en el sector y la calidad de sus productos es muy buena, lo que le ha permitido cada vez conseguir más clientes para su negocio y también se ha transformado en buenos pedidos. 

Debido a que en la actualidad su capacidad de producción no alcanza para satisfacer a todos sus clientes, Carmen requiere de un préstamo para comprar tela, hilos, botones, entre otros para aumentar la capacidad de producción de su negocio.

Su mayor anhelo es salir adelante con su taller de confección y poder tener en su hogar unas mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos.
texts.en:
Carmen is very experienced in the tailoring business, she has a sewing shop in her home and has been doing outsourced work for 25 years. She works all day long, and she would like to offer work in her shop to people who need it.

She learned this work from her mother, who taught her from a very young age. The advantage is that she is already recognized in the sector and the quality of her products is very good, which has allowed her to attract ever more clients as well as to receive good orders.

Currently, her production level does not meet the demand from all her clients. She is therefore requesting a loan to buy fabric, threads, buttons, and more to increase the production capacity. 

Carmen's greatest wish is to get ahead with her sewing shop, and to have at home better economic opportunities to progress together with her husband and four children.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, buttons and more in order to increase the production capacity of her business.

loans.name: Jorge Gregorio

texts.es: Jorge está muy satisfecho con su crédito pues gracias a ello pudo comprar sus semillas de papa y cebolla y Dios gracias una buena cosecha obtuvo y en el mercado regional los pudo vender a un buen precio, Jorge también cuenta que su cultivo ha incrementado. Jorge nuevamente tiene la necesidad de un préstamo para poder comprar sus semillas de papa y abono químico,   para el cultivo de esta temporada. Su mayor anhelo es fortalecer su cultivo y seguir incrementándolo.
texts.en:
Jorge is feels happy with the loan he received. Thanks to this loan, he could buy potato and onion seeds, and thanks to God he had a good harvest and could sell it at a good price at the regional market. Jorge says that his plantations are more productive too.

Jorge needs a loan again to buy potato seeds and chemical fertilizers for this year's planting season. His biggest wish is to strengthen his plantations and continue expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
A 23-year-old married father of one child, Ali has been working in his auto repair shop for five years to cover his family's living needs and expenses.
He is an ambitious and hard working man, with a very good reputation in his area and among his customers.

Ali's family's needs are increasing especially with the new born baby, that's why he is working hard to expand his working sector through investing in increasing his working capital.

Today, Ali is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop his business through to develop his business through increasing his car wheels capital with newly released designs.

Ali hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to develop his business through increasing his car wheels capital with newly released designs.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a single man. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock.

He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, cereals and other items. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, cereals and other items

loans.name: Njoki

texts.en:
Njoki is a married woman. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells plastic containers, clothes and other items. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her family challenge to be lack of enough clean water for home use. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will have enough water for family use. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna  hails  from  the town of  Batuan.  She operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sold commodities like noodles, milk, sugar, seasonings, soap, shampoo and assorted canned goods. She is 51-year old married woman and has  three grown  children. 

For a long period of time , she has been engaged in operating a sari-sari (variety) store, serving customers mostly neighbors and nearby residents. 

Paterna  would like to improve her main source of living to become more productive and improve the family’s living condition.

She would like to purchase soft drinks, canned goods and assorted groceries.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, canned goods and assorted groceries

loans.name: Milagros Joana

texts.es:
Milagros Joana con 34 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos, en el distrito de Oyotún,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona rural.

Ella se dedica a la venta de jugos, contando con herramientas propias, con más de 2 años de experiencia en el negocio, su negocio está ubicado en un lugar céntrico de Oyotún. Solicita préstamo para el mantenimiento y renovación de herramientas de trabajo, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, con gran influencia en el negocio. De esta manera piensa mejorar su productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona.

Milagros Joana es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha tenido un crédito de S/.500,00 el cual a sido cancelado de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Milagros Joana, age 34, is in a common-law marriage. She lives with her husband and their two children in a rural area in the Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque department, Peru.

She sells juices. She has her own tools and more than two years of experience in the business. Her business is located in a central area in Oyotún.

She is requesting the loan for maintenance and renovation of her working tools. This investment will help her to have her equipment and working tools in better condition, which will have a great impact on her business. This way she plans to improve the productivity of her services. She will be able to tend to the diverse needs of the customers in the area.

Milagros Joana is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa. She had a loan for S/.500,00, which was paid off on time.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance and renovation of work tools.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar con 46 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia,junto a su cónyuge, en el distrito de Oyotún,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona rural. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de limpieza en grifo,hace más de 1 año,su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Oyotun. Solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra de una mochila fumigadora y otros gastos personales, esto le servirá para tener mayores ingresos y poder dar una mejor calidad para el y su familia.

Oscar es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Oscar, 46, lives with his partner in Oyotún, a rural district in Lambayeque.  Farming and small businesses are common sources of income for local people.  Oscar operates a cleaning business and has good references, both work-related and personal, from his neighbors.  

Oscar started his cleaning business in Oyotún a year ago.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy a backpack sprayer and pay other personal expenses.  The investment will allow him to improve his income and better provide for his family.

Oscar is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a backpack sprayer and other personal expenses

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Borrowing loans has been a typical practice for small business entrepreneurs like Rosalia. It's difficult to improve any business without getting into credit, unless the entrepreneur has enough capital or investments. Rosalia paid all her loans availed through CCT and she is very much confident to apply for new ones.

She would like to request a PHP 30,000 loan. Just as she did with her previous loans, she will buy assorted grocery items, more toiletry products, cases of beverages, sacks of rice, fruits and processed meats to increase her income from her sari-sari store. She believes that you will never fail her request. Once she gets the assistance, she assures that she will repay you in due time.

Rosalia dreams of business expansion and continuously flourishing profits. She is an active community partner of CCT. She meets with her fellowship* group every Friday.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.
