loans.use: to buy assorted grocery items, more toiletry products, cases of beverages, sacks of rice, fruits and processed meats

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is aged 26 years. He is married and lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has a retail shop that earns him a living and has been in the business for the last 6 years. He started the retail shop from the savings of his farming business purposely to take extra care of his family needs since farming was seasonal and he would take long to harvest.

He has applied for a kiva loan of UGX 800,000 through Hofokam Limited to purchase more general merchandise like sugar, sodas, salt and others for selling this Christmas season and the surplus to add in his farm.

loans.use: to purchase more general merchandise like sugar, sodas, salt and others for selling this Christmas season and the surplus to add in his farm.

loans.name: Nelcy Amparo

texts.es:
Nelcy es una mujer de 37 años de edad, se dedica a la cría  y venta de cerdos, ella es muy organizada y ha logrado darle algo de prestigio a su negocio, pues sus cerdos los vende por catálogo ya que son de excelente calidad.
Inicio su negocio por necesidad económica, ella buscó ser diferente y cambiar el prototipo del negocio de venta de cerdos, hoy en día utiliza esta manera de venta de catálogo, dando un ingrediente diferenciador de la competencia.
Nelcy se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para comprar materiales para mejorar sus cocheras, mejorar los canales de alimentación, de manejo de eses, contar con mayor espacio y mejoramiento de cercado, también comprará insumos al por mayor como alimento de engorde, vitaminas y vacunas.
texts.en:
Nelcy, aged 37, raises and sells pigs. She is very organized and has raised the profile of her business, as her pigs are sold by catalog and are of excellent quality.

She started her business out of economic necessity. She looked for a way to be different and change the prototype of the pig selling business. Nowadays, she sells her pigs by catalog, which allows her to stand out from the competition.

Nelcy is requesting a loan in order to improve her pig pens, making them more spacious, more secure, and improving waste management and feed troughs. She will also make wholesale purchases of pig feed, vitamins and vaccinations.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve her pig pens, making them more spacious, more secure, and improving waste management and feed troughs.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Jane; she is thirty five years old and has four children. Two of her children are in primary school while one is in secondary school. Jane is married and lives with her four children.

She farms maize, beans and tomatoes, dairy farming and she also sells vegetables in her food stall in Nakuru. She is taking a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her farming business, which she has been operating for ten years. With this loan, she hopes that her business will generate profit that will help increase her level of income. This will enable her to be in position to provide food and education with ease.

Jane is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support, and promises to pay promptly

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her farming business.

loans.name: Eliso

texts.en: Eliso is 42 years old divorced woman. She lives with her daughter in Kutaisi district. Eliso is unemployed at the moment and the family lives in poverty. She decided to open a market and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 2000 USD. With the received credit she will purchase a stock of products and will open a food market. Eliso is very motivated a hopes that the business will be profitable and she will be able to make better living conditions for her daughter. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a food market

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Малике 45 лет. Она простоя женщина района Рудаки. Малика  мать троих детей. У нее два сына и одна дочка. Старший сын женат и он живет вместе с Маликой. Ее муж занимается таксистом. Он перевозит людей. Сама Малика швея. Она занимается шитьем национальной женской одежды. Малика в течение 10 лет научилась все навыки своей работы. Ей в этой работе нравится ежедневный доход. Малика за счет доход от шитье обеспечить семью. Она хочет расширить деятельность и увеличить ежедневный доход. Малика просит кредит для купли материалы и швейные принадлежности. Она будет очень рада на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Malika is 45 and a simple woman from the Rudaki region. She has three children, two sons and one daughter. Her oldest son is married and lives with her. Her husband works as a taxi driver, transporting people. Malika herself is a seamstress. She sews traditional women's clothing, a profession she has learned well over the past 10 years. She likes this profession for its daily income, with which she can provide for her family.

Malika wants to expand her business and increase her income. She is requesting a loan to buy fabric and sewing accessories. She will be very happy to receive your support.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing accessories

loans.name: Peacock Group

texts.en:
Matilda who is in her mid 50's, is single with no child. She has been selling cold drinks and charcoal for six years now. She works from 7 am to 6.30 pm daily and is able to make a goof monthly profit.

This will be her 30th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on charcoal stock started selling cold drinks and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is doing great with her loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group which is doing fine. She used the profit to took care of herself, to repay loan, bought a land, built her own house, bought a TV set, sofa set, radio, cupboards and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal and to increase on cold drinks stock. She dreams of expanding her house.

MATILDA will share this loan with her loan group Peacock which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and to increase on cold drinks stock.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a posho mill where he sells maize flour. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the break down of the machine. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more maize. His business goal is to have more posho mills within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more maize.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
45-year-old Ester owns a rice paddy. She has been growing rice for almost 10 years now.
She is married and has six children, of whom four are still attending school. She is striving hard to improve her income. She lives in the town of Bilar.

She would like to avail a loan to purchase fertilizer, rice seedlings and pay for a tractor for plowing the field. These are vital in her livelihood. That would produce bountiful harvest and gain higher income.

In that way, Ester would be able to save some of the profit for future use. She is determined that she will be able to use the revenue to continue expand to become more sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, rice seedlings and pay for a tractor to plow the field.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is a 42-year-old married woman and has four children. Her oldest child is 16 and her youngest is 2.
She lives in the town of Bilar. She raises and sold hogs to support the needs of her family.

She needs the loan to buy piglets and feed in order to raise and sell to make some profits. The business faces two main challenges. The first one is the lack of liquidity which limits his ability to expand his project, and the other challenge is the high cost of livestock maintenance.

For the future, Marisa hopes to expand her project by increasing the number of livestock, and to continue support the education of her children.

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is a 31-year old, hardworking man living in Masindi- Uganda. He has been riding a motorcycle for a transport business for five years, working for another person and remitting 80% of the money earned to the owner of the motorcycle.

He was inspired to start the business from his fellow friends saying it is an easy business. He dreams of buying a plot of land, but inadequate capital is still a challenge. Johnson has said that "enough is enough" to work for others. To add to the little savings he has, he is requesting a loan to top up and buy his own motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy his own motorcycle.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмира, 48 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. Гульмира в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1996 году. Благодаря упорному труду, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы, 20 овец и 1 лошадь. Также есть земельный надел мерою 3,60 ГА, где она выращивает картофель и люцерну для реализации. Гульмира в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма, разведения и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита она вложит в расширение бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Gulmira is 48 and married with three children. She works in animal husbandry and agriculture as the primary source of income for her family, a business she started in 1996. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has four cows, 20 sheep and one horse on her farm, as well as 3.6 hectares of land where she grows potatoes and alfalfa for sale.

With the goal of further developing her business, Gulmira has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 80,000 KGS to purchase sheep for fattening and resale. She will put profits from the loan into expanding her business and renovating her house.

loans.use: to buy some sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: María Albertina

texts.es:
María, de 69 años de edad, estudio hasta segunda grado, está casada, su esposo tuvo que emigrar hacía otro país en busca de mejores oportunidades laborales, junto a su esposo tuvo 3 hijos.  

María, se dedica a trabajar en los oficios del hogar desde que era una niña, pero también tiene una granja de pollos de engorde la cual administra junto a sus hijos; tienen más de 10 años de estar trabajando de esa manera; en el invierno sus hijos trabajan en la agricultura, mientras ella realiza todos los quehaceres del hogar y a cuidar las aves. 

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaca parida para poder obtener ganancia con la venta de los productos derivados de la leche tales como cuajada, crema, o leche.

María, sueña con tener una mejor infraestructura en la granja donde pueda tener más pollo y crecerlo más rápido.
texts.en:
María is 69 years old and studied up to Grade 2. She is married. Her husband had to emigrate to another country in search of better employment opportunities. She has three children together with her husband.

María has worked doing house work since she was a girl and she also has a farm with broiler chickens which she administers with her children. She has been doing this for more than 10 years. In the winter her children work in agriculture while she takes care of the house and the chickens.

María needs the loan to buy a pregnant cow to be able to obtain earnings from products derived from milk like curds, cream and milk.

María dreams of having better infrastructure for her farm to be able to have more chickens and raise them more quickly.

loans.use: to buy a pregnant cow to be able to obtain earnings from products derived from milk like curds, cream and milk.

loans.name: Kate Traders Group

texts.en:
Kate is 50 years of age. She is from Assin Fosu in the Assin North District of the Central Region of Ghana. Kate is the leader and group representative of Kate Traders. She is married and has 3 daughters and a son. The children are all currently in school. She is a seamstress and has been doing it for 30 years. She sews school uniforms, clothes, linen and dresses. Kate also sells yam, beans, gari, groundnut, cooking oil and maize as a supplement to her income.

She has been working with the Field Partner for 4 years and this is their 7th loan cycle with a good track record. She started her business with some funds her husband provided. She was later assisted by the Field Partner when she needed additional capital to expand her business.

Kate will use the current loan to buy a modern electrical sewing machine, handheld sewing machine, knitting and over lock machines, threads, zips, linen and materials to be able to complete the contracts she has with all the schools in her locality. Kate and her group members thank all their Kiva micro lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials for the sewing of uniforms and dresses for resale.

loans.name: Sandra Marcela

texts.es:
Sandra, a sus 22 años de edad,  es soltera. Tomó la iniciativa de buscar una actividad para realizar y percibir sus propios ingresos y desea vender mercancía como ropa, calzado, cremas corporales, perfumería, entre otros. 

Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de activar el negocio y comprar mercancía al por mayor (blusas, jeans, camisas, tennis, calzado en general, perfumería, juguetería, entre otros) y cancelar el saldo de un crédito que tiene vigente; esto le permitirá tener gran variedad de surtido para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada decembrina, en la que sus ventas se duplican pues cuenta con la ventaja de vender productos de marcas reconocidas que a sus clientes les gusta, mejorando así el nivel de ingresos que recibe. 

Sandra, con su perseverancia, carisma y buena energía desea seguir trabajando en su negocio y continuar percibiendo ingresos para darse sus propios gustos.
texts.en:
Sandra, at 22 years old, is single. She took the initiative to find an occupation in which to engage and earn her own income, and she wishes to sell merchandise such as clothing, footwear, body creams, and perfumes, among other items.

Currently she is requesting the loan in order to activate the business and buy merchandise wholesale (blouses, jeans, shirts, tennis shoes, shoes in general, perfumes, and toys; among other items), and to pay the balance of a loan that she has pending. This will permit her to have a great variety of stock to meet the demand that increases in the holiday season, in which her sales double since she has the advantage of selling name brand products that her customers like, thus improving the level of income she receives.

Sandra, with her perseverance, charisma, and good energy, wishes to continue working in her business and to continue earning income to spend as she likes.

loans.use: buy merchandise wholesale (blouses, jeans, shirts, tennis shoes, shoes in general, perfumes, and toys; among other items).

loans.name: Mundia

texts.en:
Mundia, 51, is grounded and humble. He is married and has six children and two grandchildren. Mundia has been running his mobile money transfer business for six years. He has accessed four Kiva loans and has fully repaid them. Today, Mundia would like to thank his lenders for helping him to grow his business. Mundia employs 26 young people in the rural parts of the western province of Zambia. His business enables people to send and receive money when they need to most.

Mundia has 16 Zoona mobile money transfer outlets. His outlets are located in rural areas such as Shangombo, Itehzhi-Tezhi, Kasempa, Kalabo and Senanga to mention but a few. He is very passionate about serving rural communities that have little or no access to financial services.

Mundia's challenge is that because most of his outlets are located in remote areas, he struggles to convert electronic float to cash and vice versa. This means that sometimes his customers have to wait a bit longer to access his services. This saddens Mundia because he prides himself in providing the best customer service.

Mundia has requested a loan in order to increase the capital float in his Shangombo and Kalabo outlets. This will help him serve customers faster as he will have more funds.

Mundia sends his greetings and gratitude.

loans.use: to increase the capital float in his remote money transfer outlets in Shangombo and Kalabo so that people can have easier access to financial services.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer es un joven muy aplicado, emprendedor, estudioso, inteligente y responsable, el cual tiene 24 años de edad y constituyo hace 5 años un negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ubicado en el municipio de Dabeiba, un lugar apartado de la cabecera municipal y que le dificultad para abastecer su negocio.
Trabaja diariamente 12 horas, su principal objetivo es estudiar, apoyar a su madre, crecer económicamente, demostrar lo que vale y que con sueños y decisión puede lograr alcanzar las metas que se traza en la vida.

El joven actualmente se encuentra solicitando un aliento económico para abastecer su negocio con granos, abarrotes, productos de aseo personal y domésticos, productos lácteos y refrescos, comprara en cantidad ya que el transporte de la mercancía es costoso debido a al lejanía de esta con la cabecera municipal que es donde se abastece.
texts.en:
Wilmer is a hardworking, entrepreneurial, studious, intelligent and responsible young man. He is 24 years old and started a convenience store 5 years ago in the town of Dabeiba. His store is located far from the town center, which makes it difficult to stock it. 

Wilmer works 12 hours per day. His main goals are to study, support his mother, grow financially, demonstrate what he is worth and reach his objectives through decision and dreaming big. 

This young man is currently requesting an economic relief to stock his business with grains, groceries, cleaning products, dairy products and soft drinks. He will purchase the products in bulk, as the transportation of the products is expensive due to the distance between his store and the town center, where he buys his products.

loans.use: to supply his business with grains, groceries, cleaning products, dairy products and soft drinks.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman with a male child who is currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 35 years old.

Rebecca has a native trading business where she sells pepper in Teshie market. She has requested a Kiva loan of GHS 1,500 through ID Ghana to purchase additional stocks of pepper for sale on retail and wholesale bases.

Rebecca has been in this business for three years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of pepper for sale on retail and wholesale bases.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is a young man who resides in a town called Nkhata Bay in Malawi. Nkhata Bay is the busiest resort on Lake Malawi and is thus a popular tourist destination. Bonface is requesting a loan to start running his own business in Nkhata Bay.

Boniface is 21 years old. He comes from a family of three and was recently orphaned. He is being supported by his older brother and would like to be self-sufficient by running his own business as a Zoona Agent. This means that Boniface will provide mobile money transfer services to people in his community and earn a profit from the transactions.

Boniface has always wanted to be an entrepreneur and the prospect of managing his own time, his own budgets and resources has always excited him. His biggest dream is to run his own business, but the lack of capital is a huge obstacle in making this dream a reality. He is, therefore, requesting his first Kiva loan to make this dream a reality.

Boniface believes that starting his own business will enable him to give back to his community by creating employment opportunities, thus helping others achieve peace of mind. He wants to be a viable, trustworthy mobile money provider in a country where banking is simply too expensive for most of the people.

Zoona has done market research and found that the location in which Boniface is looking to open his outlet would be ideal not only for employment opportunities for that community, but also to generate the traction he envisions for his business. This loan will be used to procure a branded trolley, an internet-enabled phone and provide the funds needed for Boniface to serve his customers.

Boniface thanks the Kiva lenders for believing in him.

loans.use: to procure a branded trolley and an internet-enabled phone as well as the funds needed to make the actual transactions so that he can start running his own business in Malawi.

loans.name: Prabhasini's Group

texts.en:
Prabhasini hails from a low-income household from an interior, remote, tribal village of Phulbani, Odisha, India. She is a married lady living with her two sons.The lady standing in the middle in the photograph is Prabhasini.

Prabhasini has struggled a lot in her life in order to sustain herself and her family. She is a lady with shear determination and strong willpower. Lack of financial resources had never allowed her to build a hygienic toilet at her home to get access to basic sanitary facilities. This has compelled her and her family to walk long distances at odd hours in order to defecate and urinate.

This practice is not safe or feasible in the long run. Therefore, Prabhasini, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan to build a well-equipped hygienic toilet and attach all the requisite sanitary fittings to it.The loan amount will help her in getting access to basic sanitation facilities and thereby improving the health of her family.

Prabhasini is in dire need of your kind help and is eagerly awaiting your support.

loans.use: to build a well-equipped hygienic toilet and attach all the requisite sanitary fittings to it.

loans.name: Rabiu

texts.en:
Rabiu is a maize farmer from Badamasi village. As a Babban Gona member, Rabiu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Rabiu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, in order to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Rabiu can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season.  This way,  he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Rabiu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Rabiu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Fanneiry Ramonita

texts.es:
Fanneiry Ramonita es estudiante de Odontología, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativos. Esta es su historia: 

Hola, soy Fanneiry tengo 22 años de edad, nací el 27 de agosto del 1993 en Santo Domingo, Rep. Dom. Tengo 10 hermanos 2 varones y 8 hembras, todos se encuentran estudiando en la actualidad.

Vivo con mi esposo (unión libre) él se llama Emelfi , tengo un hermoso bebé de 1 año llamado Emerson . Mi padre se llama Dionisio Y mi Madre Fátima, mi padre es el único que trabaja, es propietario de un colmado, R.D. Mi madre es ama de casa y es quien me cuida a mi niño y a mis hermanos.

Estoy estudiando Odontologia en la Universidad Odontológica Dominicana me encuentro en el 7mo. Cuatrimestre, faltándome cinco cuatrimestres para culminar mis estudios. Me complace mucho poder satisfacer las necesidades de los pacientes lo mejor que pueda.

Debido a que mi familia es muy grande y sigue en aumento he tenido que suspender mis estudios, porque no contamos con los recursos suficientes para sustentar mi familia. Mi carrera ha avanzado tanto por la misericordia infinita de Dios que nunca desampara a sus hijos. Necesito el préstamo para poder finalizar mis estudios, si no recibo la ayuda necesaria de ustedes me veré en la obligación de suspender mis estudios de forma permanente. Si obtengo su ayuda mi vida cambiaria de manera significativa y daría un giro da 360 grados, ya que podría cumplir mis metas y  sueños y lo primordial para mí que es echar para adelante por mí y mi familia.
Gracias de antemano por la atención y que Dios ilumine su camino y los llene de bendiciones.
texts.en:
Fanneiry Ramonita is a dentistry student. She seeks a loan to be able to cover her education expenses. 

This is her story:  

Hello. I am Fanneiry and I am 22 years old. I was born on August 27, 1993 in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic. I have 10 siblings - 2 brothers and 8 sisters, all of whom are in school today. I live with my husband named Emelfi and have a beautiful 1 year old baby named Emerson. My parents are named Dionisio and Fátima. My father is the only one who works and is the proprietor of a grocery store. My mother is a housewife and cared for myself and my siblings.

I am studying orthodontics at the local university and have been there for seven months.  I only have five more semesters before I'll have culminated my studies. I am very pleased to satisfy the needs of the patients to the best of my abilities.

Since my family is so large and continuously growing, I've had to stop my studies because we can't count on sufficient resources to sustain the family. My career has advanced a lot for the infinite mercy of God who never disempowers his children. I ned the loan to be able to finalize my studies. If I don't receive the necessary help I will have the obligation of permanently suspending my studies.

If I do obtain help, my life will change in a significant way and I will do a 360 spin as I could now complete my goals and dreams. The primary thing for me is to go forward for my family. Thanks in advance for the attention and I hope that God illuminates your path and fills you with blessings.

loans.use: to pay for higher education expenses.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.fr: Mère de trois enfants, Annabelle est une femme mariée âgée de 35 ans résidant à Baguida. Annabelle est une marchande de produits alimentaires qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend en circulant dans les quartiers environnant pour gagner ses revenus. Annabelle désire ce prêt pour commander des paniers de tomates fraîches, de petits poissons frits  et des tas de légumes. Avec le résultat positif gagné, Annabelle va pouvoir aider son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Annabelle is 35 years old and lives in Baguida. She's married and the mother of three children. To earn a living, Chantal sells food products in the surrounding neighborhoods as a traveling saleswoman. She gets her supplies twice monthly at the market.

Annabelle is asking for this loan in order to buy baskets of fresh tomatoes, small fried fish, and several piles of vegetable. With her net profit, she will be able to help her husband support the family and make it possible for her children to get a decent education.

loans.use: to buy 3 baskets of tomatoes, 3 baskets of fried fish, and 4 piles of vegetable

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a maize farmer from Gambo village. As a Babban Gona member, Hassan is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Hassan would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Hassan can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Hassan no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Hassan hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Takeshi

texts.es:
El socio sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “YANAHUARA SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”.
El socio Takeshi  continua dedicándose a brindar servicio de transporte de mototaxi, con esta actividad sale adelante y aporta gastos en su hogar, el socio es un joven emprendedor y sobre todo trabajador, por eso desea tener en buenas condiciones su herramienta de trabajo que es su mototaxi.
El socio solicito el préstamo para comprar llantas y repuestos de mototaxi.
El socio está contento y agrádese a los inversionistas de KIVA por el crédito que le da la oportunidad de seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Takeshi still belongs to the “YANAHUARA SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC” communal bank.
He's still in the business of providing taxi services with a motorcycle. With this line of work he gets ahead and contributes to the household finances. He's a young and, above all, hardworking entrepreneur. That's why he wishes to keep the tool of his trade, his motorcyle, in good conditions.
Takeshi requested a loan in order to purchase tires and spare parts for his motorcyle taxi.
He's very happy and thankful to Kiva lenders for the loan, which gives him the opportunity to move forward.

loans.use: to purchase tires and spare parts for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Waridi Group

texts.en:
Deuc is in his mid-30s, single with one child. He has been a musician for eleven years now. He works from 8am to midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Deuc's 13th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy music products and has been able to pay back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to take care of himself, to repay the loan, to buy a plot of land, to build his house and cover household expenses.

Deuc will share this loan with his loan group, Waridi, which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. He will use this loan to buy musical instruments like speakers and bustas for his music business. He dreams of expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy musical instruments like speakers and bustas for his music business.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en: Annah is a married woman. She has 5 children. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the Kes 21,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en:
Hayk has been running his wedding salon in Armavir town for already 8 years. He has one worker helping him in the salon, where there are provided a lot of wedding services for local people.

In the salon, Hayk sells bridal dresses, flowers, accessories and other service for wedding ceremonies.

The requested loan will give Hayk an opportunity to purchase new stock of bridal dresses, tools and materials for providing wedding organizing service.

Hayk lives with his wife, two school aged children and father. He mentioned that would be very grateful if lenders support his business and help him to develop it further.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of bride dresses, tools and materials for providing wedding organizing service

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Originally from Kampong Thom province, Hai, 31, is a married mother of six children who are still in school. She makes a living through growing rice and working for others for a fee. Earning around 11 USD per day, Hai can manage to save around 5 USD each day for future needs. Getting lower yields and a drop in price  are challenges in the rice growing business. 

In her first cycle, Hai is now applying for a loan from VisionFund to pay tuition fees for her son to pursue a bachelor's degree in marketing. She hopes that this loan will enable her son to study in university and she hopes that her son will have a bright future after he graduates.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for her son to pursue a bachelor's degree in marketing

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Kampong Svay District

loans.name: Sumi's Group

texts.en:
Sumi is a 48-year-old lady. She is standing to the extreme right in the photograph. She hails from a village of Balugaon, Odisha, India. This humble lady has a family of six.

Sumi is a farmer by profession and cultivates paddy on her small piece of land. Her husband, being an elderly person, often remains ill and is not able to work anymore. So, Sumi is the only breadwinner in her family. She has two daughters. Her elder daughter got married last year, and her younger daughter is continuing her studies. After meeting the daily household expenses and the medical expenses of her husband, Sumi is hardly able to save any money.

She, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. Sumi will utilize her portion of the loan amount to pay the course fees for her daughter's banking course. The loan amount will help her daughter complete her education smoothly, and will help her in getting a good job with a pretty good package and gain name and fame for the family.

Sumi is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to pay the course fees for her daughter's banking course.

loans.name: Prabhasini's Group

texts.en:
Prabhasini is an enterprising lady. She is standing in the middle in the photograph. She hails from an interior village of Kandhamal district, Odisha, India. She has a family of three, consisting of her husband and her daughter. Prabhasini is a grocer by profession and works very hard in order to sustain her livelihood and fulfill all the basic necessities.

The major problem that concerns her is that she does not have an appropriate toilet in her house and has to depend upon the open field to attend nature's call. This makes her more vulnerable to crime and molestation. She is a very concerned lady and does not find it safe to walk long distances and depend upon isolated places for defecation.

So, in order to restore her privacy and increase her safety and hygiene, she, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet in her home and safeguard her family's health so as to reduce the medical expenses.

The loan amount will ultimately help Prabhasini to enjoy a disease-free, healthy life with her family. She is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet in her home.

loans.name: Nuha

texts.en:
Meet 39-year-old Nuha from Jenin. She is married with four kids ranging in age from 5 to 11 years old, and all of them are currently attending school and nursery. Five years ago Nuha started her business by having one sewing machine and sewed some clothing for her family and neighbors.

Nuha began her sewing business to enhance her family's standards of living and help her husband in the family income. Now she has two full-time employees and three part-time employee working with her.

Nuha says that the main challenge to her business is the high competition in the marketplace. She required this loan in order to buy one new sewing machine and some sewing materials like buttons. In the future, Nuha plans to see her business grow even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy one sewing machine and some sewing materials like buttons

loans.name: Tapoi's Group

texts.en:
Like all women, Tapoi, a divorcee who is standing on the right-hand side in the photograph, dreams of an empowered and independent life. Tapoi was only able to study till 5th Standard. She was married very young and struggled financially throughout her life. But despite these issues, she still takes care of her family with much joy and hopes to provide a complete education to her three sons, who are now studying in high school. In fact, one of her sons works as a part time labourer to help with the family income.

Tapoi has been carrying out her dairy farming business from her home for the last five years. Some of the main challenges she faces include lack of green fodder and veterinary services for the cows. But she hasn’t lost hope.

Along with her group member, Tapoi is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy another cow and scale up her business. She plans to sell the milk at the village collection centre and scale up her business as well as her income.

All that women like Tapoi need is a little support as they venture out to improve their financial conditions and weave happiness into their families' lives.

loans.use: to buy another cow and scale up her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 34 years old and married. She lives in remote village of Prey Veng Province. She and her spouse help each other in farming activities in order to improve the family's living conditions. She has been engaged in this field nearly five years. Both of them can earn an average income of $10 per day. 

Mary would like to order a solar home system to install at her home. This will allow family members to gain access to clean energy, helping them with light at night. They also can use radio or TV for their entertainment. Due to a shortage of funds, Mary requested a loan from HKL, which she will use to buy a solar home system.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system

loans.name: Tiki's Group

texts.en:
Tiki, standing to the right hand side in the photograph in a yellow saree, is from Odagaon, Odisha, India. She is a widow and lives with her father and two sons in a small home, and owns a bicycle and a TV, too. Tiki has only been able to study until fifth standard, being forced to marry young as well as struggling financially. And so, she is determined to ensure at least her own children will receive complete education for a more secure future. Her father runs a grocery store, and Tiki is also a proud entrepreneur.

She has been baking delicious items for the past four years. In order to keep up with the rising costs of living and educating her children, she aspires to expand her business so that more profits can come in. She, along with her group member, is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy more ingredients and cooking gas and to pay for other required overhead costs.

With a strong customer base for her mouth-watering goods, there is no doubt of good sales, enabling her to repay the loan in due time.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients and cooking gas and pay for other required overhead costs.

loans.name: Soklin's Group

texts.en:
Soklin is 32 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom attends school. She resides in the rural village of the Chhueng Prey district of Kampong Cham province. To support the family, she and her husband have been rice farming and fishing for 10 years. Low crop yield destroyed by insect pests is the main challenge for her business. 

Soklin is the leader of her group and requested a loan from VisionFund, which she will use to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn a larger income to improve her family’s living condition and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Bulu's Group

texts.en:
Bulu, standing to the left hand side in the photograph, is a divorcee, but a strong-minded woman who has taken off on a goat-rearing activity to earn a living. Bulu is a resident of a small village of Odagaon, Odisha, India. She is the sole earning member of her family, which includes her old father and a son, and tries her best to work hard and earn for her family.

Over these last seven years, Bulu has been steadily scaling up the business. Bulu, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy more numbers of goats for her business.

She mainly sells the goats to the meat shops when they grow up to a required size. So, the more numbers she acquires, the more she will be able to earn from their sale in the market, as she feels.

loans.use: to buy more numbers of goats for her business.

loans.name: Jhunirani's Group

texts.en:
Jhunirani, a single mother, standing to the right hand side in the photograph, belongs to the town of Odagaon in Odisha, India. She is a tailor by profession; she stitches from her home and supports her family. She has two small children. The elder one is in third standard, and the younger one is in first standard.

Jhunirani is an intelligent woman; she wants to plan for her family's future and keep it secure. She is young, and she would work until the extra mile to keep her family comfortable through their income and expenses.

She, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy another sewing machine to increase her business.

These are the days where people want to keep everything for themselves, whether it be knowledge or education or money; they do not want to spread their wings to help the next person in need. But Jhunirani, in her small home and through her big heart, wants to hire a girl and train her in sewing.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine and to hire a girl for help.

loans.name: Sliman

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Sliman from the Al-Khader neighborhood in Bethlehem. He is single with no kids.

Sliman started his agricultural business five years ago. He used to buy a tank of water on a monthly basis to irrigate his agricultural land, but this year he decided to take a loan from ACAD to buy construction materials and build a well, which he will use in collecting rainwater and then use the water to irrigate his crops. By doing this, Sliman will minimize his costs, hence increasing his profits. He is still in the construction process, as shown in the picture.

The main two challenges that his business faces are the changeable weather conditions. The other challenge is the well location, as it is beside the Separation Barrier.

In the future, Sliman plans to sell the water to his neighbor lands and make additional profits from this well. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy needed construction material to build a well to irrigate his crops.

loans.name: Jayanti's Group

texts.en:
Jayanti regrets the fact that she wasn't allowed to study because she belongs to an under-privileged community. The petty attitude of society might have held her back so long, but not anymore. Jayanti is poised to break the shackles that society has imposed on her.The lady standing on the lefthand side in the photograph is Jayanti. She is a divorcee and is a resident of a small village of Odagaon, Odisha, India.

Jayanti is engaged in making candles at her home. She thought of making candles, while keeping in view the erratic power supply conditions in her locality. The local people face a lot of difficulties undertaking their work due to frequent power cuts. So this intelligent lady thought that candles can solve their purpose to a maximum extent. She supplies candles to all the houses in her locality.

Along with her group member, Jayanti is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase raw materials for her business like candle-making frames, wax, thread, scissor blades, and to repair her machine for gearing up her work and increasing her output.

Jayanti is eagerly awaiting your kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her business like candle-making frames, wax, thread, scissor blades, and to repair her machine for gearing up her work.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is 23 years old and single. He lives in Bethlehem. Fadi's sister used to work as a nanny in a nursery in the Al-Khader neighborhood, so he got the idea of starting his nursery business to be managed by his sister. It is called it Al-Worood Nursery. Fadi's business faces one challenge, which is the existing of other competitors in the same area.

Fadi requested a loan from ACAD, which he will use to buy safety equipment and toys for his nursery. He plans to promote his business to become known in the neighborhood and in the future open more branches.

loans.use: to purchase safety equipment and toys for his nursery

loans.name: Kumuduni's Group

texts.en:
Kumuduni, standing on the left-hand side in the photograph, is a humble lady who hails from a small village of Odagaon, Odisha, India. She took up tailoring three years ago to be financially independent, when she became a widow. She is now more confident and her productivity has increased.

Kumuduni refers to various magazines and updates her stitching according to the latest styles, so there has been an increase in the inflow of orders over the years. She not only wants to stitch according to customer measurements but also wants to purchase cloth and stitch it up in standard measurements and sell the garments in the wholesale market.

For this, Kumuduni, along with her group member, is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan to purchase more cloth and a new tailoring machine.

Kumuduni is eagerly awaiting your kind help and support for her request.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth and a new tailoring machine

loans.name: Jhili's Group

texts.en:
Jhili is an enterprising and industrious lady, standing to the extreme left in the photograph. She is a resident of a small village of Odagaon, Odisha, India. She is a homemaker and her husband works in a library, so the family income is insufficient to cover the household expenses of their family of five. A toilet is one of the most basic necessities, but unfortunately Jhili does not have access to one. For that reason she has to walk a long distance in order to relieve herself in the dense bushes. She can sense the risk of crime and molestation and does not find this practice feasible in the long run.

Therefore, Jhili, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner, People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a clean and well-equipped toilet, with all basic sanitation facilities. The loan amount will ultimately help her in promoting cleanliness and hygiene and thus leading a disease-free life.

Jhili is in dire need of your kind help.

loans.use: to build a clean and well-equipped toilet with all basic sanitation facilities.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 59 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is a driver. She sells different kinds of girls’ accessories, such as hair clips, head bands, ponytails, fashion earrings, bracelets, and necklaces. She earns an income that serves as a remedy for her family's financial incapacity. At times, her sales do not meet her expectations. There are also circumstances when her capital is not enough. Being one of the breadwinners of the family, she does not want her business to end due to insufficiency. 

Evangeline requested a loan for 17,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell, allowing her to expand her business. She is inspired by the people around her who encourage her, including the people she interacts with every week at a regular fellowship*. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for her inventory

loans.name: Rita's Group

texts.en:
Rita, a differently abled lady standing on the left hand side in the photograph, lives with her husband and 6-year-old daughter in the small village of Odagaon, Odisha, India. Rita is proof that success doesn't come overnight. Success requires patience, perseverance and hard work.

Rita started her goat-rearing business three years ago with a single goat. Slowly but surely, Rita kept investing in more goats. Today she has four goats and earns about 1,000 INR each month. In fact, Rita earns almost equal to her husband, who works as a daily wage labourer.

A woman with conviction and foresight, Rita along with her group member, has applied for a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum to expand her business further and faster. Needless to say, she will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase more goats, which in-turn will help Rita earn more.

loans.use: to purchase more goats

loans.name: Laksmi's Group

texts.en:
Laksmi, a differently abled lady standing on the right hand side in the photograph, is from the village of Odagaon, Odisha, India. She is one of the few fortunate ones to be able to study until the degree level. She lives in a thatched house with her husband, who runs a small workshop, and their son, who is in primary school. With the formal education Laksmi received, she decided to combine her skills in weaving and do a small home business in order to support her family.

She is keen to provide a complete education to her only son, in order to gift him a stable and secure future. While the household income has been small but manageable, Laksmi would like to expand her business to keep up with the rising costs of living. She, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase different coloured thread, fabric and some tools. She has over eight years of experience and is very innovative with her designs.

So, Laksmi has no doubts about demand being met once a little financial support is achieved through the loan.

loans.use: to purchase different coloured thread, fabric and some tools

loans.name: Lili's Group

texts.en:
Lili, standing to the left-hand side in the photograph, is a differently-abled lady. She and her husband live in a village of Odagaon, Odisha, India. Her husband earns a living by selling utensils and the couple have two young teenage children who are both studying in school.

With the kids going off to school and their father setting out to sell the utensils, Lili has a lot of time to spare. She wants to use this time efficiently to add some extra income to the family's kitty. She knows that as the children grow, the expenses will increase as well, and Lili does not want to compromise their education.

She has decided to take up tailoring, the thing she knows how to do best. Lili, along with her group member, is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner, People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan to buy a new tailoring machine which would help her to start up her business.

Lili plans on doing this from home which would not only allow her to manage her household and this activity well, but would also save her the cost of renting a place for her work.

loans.use: to buy a new tailoring machine which would help her start up her business.

loans.name: Elsy Del Carmen

texts.es: Elsy de 44 años es una mujer muy dinámica y amigable que decidió seguir el consejo de sus vecinos al iniciar su negocio de miscelánea en el año 2004, su local está ubicado en el municipio de Soledad, en este instaló vitrinas y estanterías surtidas con útiles escolares y papelería, y con el pasar del tiempo incorporó servicio de pago de servicios públicos y venta de comidas rápidas.  Ella es muy responsable y entregada a su negocio, así que todos los días de la semana apertura a las 7:30 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m. Ella considera que su negocio sería mucho más competitivo si tuviera servicio de café internet, es por ello que realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo, para contar con el capital necesario y comprar computadores nuevos, así como realizar la adecuación del lugar. Elsy logrará llevar a cabo este proyecto de negocio a través de esta financiación que beneficiará el crecimiento de su negocio y a su familia.
texts.en:
Elsy, 44, is a very dynamic and friendly woman who decided to follow the advice of her neighbors by starting her diverse business in 2004. Her store is located in the municipality of Soledad, where she installed display cases and shelves for school supplies and paper.

Over time, she has increased the services offered, such as paying bills and selling fast food. She is very responsible and dedicated to her business. The store is open every day from 7:30 am until 9:00 pm.

She thinks her business would be much more competitive if she had an internet cafe, which is why she is requesting a loan (credikiva), for the opportunity to connect to the financial life through the Mario Santo Foundation. This will give her the necessary funds to buy new computers so the space is more suitable.

Elsy will manage to carry out this business project with the loan, which will benefit the growth of her business and her family.

loans.use: to buy new computers, to make her store more suitable.

loans.name: Rashmita's Group

texts.en:
Rashmita, a differently abled lady standing on the right hand side in the photograph, is the mother of two toddlers: a 5-year old girl who is in Kindergarten and a 2-year-old boy. Rashmita feels blessed that her children can enjoy the gift of education because her own childhood was very different. Rashmita wasn't allowed to go to school because she belonged to an underprivileged community. So Rashmita is all the more determined to work hard and fund her children's education.

Rashmita runs a small milk business and her husband is a labourer. Between the two of them, they earn approximately 8,000 INR a month. In an effort to increase her income, Rashmita along with her group member, has applied for a loan of 30,000 INR. Rashmita will use her portion of the loan amount to buy one more milch (milk) cow. The additional profits from the new cow will no doubt go towards her little daughter's education.

Rashmita is in dire need of your kind help.

loans.use: to buy one more milch (milk) cow.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom lives in a rural area of the Kandal Steong district, Kandal province. She has two children, one of whom is in school while the other one is too young for school. To make a living, she has been working as a garment worker while her husband helps to earn additional income by running small businesses, rice milling and iron welding services, at home. Having been in these businesses for 10 years, they both can earn about $6 per day and can manage to save up to $8 each day after deducting daily expenses.

This is Mom’s first loan with VisionFund. Now she is going to apply for a loan to pay for buying a decent motorbike for commuting to work. She hopes that this loan will allow her to have a new motorbike so she can timely go to work.

loans.use: to pay for buying a decent motorbike for commuting to work

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Agée de 41 ans, Abla est une femme mariée avec deux enfants à charge. Abla vit à Adidogomé et est une revendeuse de balaies et de pagnes qu’elle s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et de quartier en quartier. Abla sollicite ce crédit pour commander des unités de balaies à pied, ordinaire et des pièces de pagnes en vue de bien revendre puis avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants et à couvrir certaines charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Abla, age 41, is a married woman raising two children. She lives in Adidogomé and sells brooms and lengths of African print cloth. She stocks up four times a month at the market and makes her sales out of her home and walking from one area to another.

Abla is requesting this loan to order some foot-brooms, ordinary brooms, and lengths of cloth to be sure she has a big inventory to resell. She wants to maximize her profit so as to help her husband educate their children and cover certain daily family expenses.

loans.use: to buy 1800 ordinary brooms and 450 foot brooms.

loans.name: Kirathimo Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo above is Tabitha, a member of Kirathimo Women Group in Nakuru. She is 35 years old and is a married mother of 5. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in November, 2014.

Tabitha practices maize and bean farming as her main business. With the training she received from HiH EA, she has been able to commercialize her farming, and she is now able to earn more profits from her business.

Tabitha is requesting a Kiva loan to both purchase quality fertilizer and add more chicks to the poultry project that she is starting. This will greatly boost her poultry yields and thus increase her income, enabling her to cover her basic needs.

Tabitha is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to promptly repay her loan portion.

loans.use: to both purchase quality fertilizer and add more chicks to the poultry project that she is starting.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man. He describes himself to be hardworking. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful and he will educate his children. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en: Abraham intends to use the loan facility to buy fertilizers and pay labour for weeding his garden. He grows food crops like maize, groundnuts and beans to sell. He supplements his income with building contracts and a car washing bay business. He started this business to support his family's well being by giving them their daily needs. He has a hope of commercializing agriculture and being a model farmer in his area, but unpredictable weather changes, especially droughts, affect harvests.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for weeding labour.

loans.name: Tanu's Group

texts.en:
Intricate embroidery on traditional skirts makes these wraparounds all the more sought after. Tanu specializes in this embroidery. The lady standing on the right-hand side in the photograph is Tanu. She is a divorcee and a resident of a village in Odagaon, Odisha, India.

She buys half-finished skirts and embroiders them to sell for a higher return. Tanu's business has been doing well for the last nine years. She now hopes to invest in the business and scale it up. For this, she would require a loan.

Tanu, along with her group member, is requesting a loan in the amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner, People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan to buy half-finished skirts in bulk and other fabrics.

Some support in the form of a loan is what Tanu is looking for at this point, and she is eagerly awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy in bulk the half-finished skirts she will embroider and other fabrics, too.

loans.name: Vicky Del Carmen

texts.es:
Con mucho empuje y perseverancia, Vicky desea iniciar un negocio de cría y levante de cerdos en su casa ubicada en el municipio de Lorica.

Esta idea surge a partir de la necesidad de generar unos buenos ingresos para colaborar con el sostenimiento del hogar en que vive con sus hijos y esposo.

Se caracteriza por ser una mujer alegre y muy colaboradora, cualidades que han hecho que se gane el cariño y respeto de la gente de la vereda.
Con este préstamo podrá dar inicio a este negocio.

El dinero será invertido en la compra de cerdos pequeños y en materiales para construcción de una cochera.
texts.en:
With a lot of drive and perseverance, Vicky wants to start a business of raising and fattening pigs in her home, located in the town of Lorica. This idea comes from the need to generate a good income in order to contribute to the upkeep of her home, where she lives with her children and husband. 

She is characterized as being a happy and cooperative woman, qualities that have won her the affection and respect of her neighbors.  

With this loan she will be able to start her business.  The money will be invested in purchasing small pigs and materials to build a stable.

loans.use: to buy small pigs and materials to build a stable

loans.name: Titi's Group

texts.en:
Titi, a divorcee standing on the right hand side in the photograph, has been making baskets and brooms for a few years now. She is a resident of a small village in Odagaon, Odisha, India. Like many other women in the community, Titi has been making these products and selling them in the local market. Titi hopes to take her business to the next level now and would like to avail a loan to do so.

Therefore,Titi along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. Titi will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase raw materials such as bamboo and plywood in bulk.

Titi is confident that she will be able to repay the loan without difficulty. The products she sells are in demand throughout the year and with increased production, she only hopes that sales will increase. Titi is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as bamboo and plywood in bulk.

loans.name: Gouri's Group

texts.en:
Gouri, standing on the left-hand side in the photograph, is a differently-abled lady from a village of Odagaon, Odisha, India. She lives with her husband who is a farmer and two daughters. The area where she lives does not have a proper source of drinking water. Fresh water is one of our most vital resources, and when our water is polluted, it is not only devastating to the environment, but also to human health.

Keeping this factor in mind, Gouri and her group member are requesting a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner, People's Forum. Gouri will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase a water purifier so that she can get clean safe water to drink.

The loan amount will ultimately help Gouri to avoid unnecessary medical expenses and protect and safeguard her family's health. She is in dire need of your kind help and is eagerly awaiting your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase a water purifier so that she can get clean safe water to drink

loans.name: Rajeswari's Group

texts.en:
Rajeswari, a differently abled lady standing on the right hand side in the photograph, and her husband are keen that their only son has a bright future. Rajeswari is a resident of a small village in Odagaon, Odisha, India. While her husband is a farmer and works hard in the field, Rajeswari has not restricted herself to household chores. She has managed to take away some time from her household work and uses her tailoring skills to support the family financially.

For a few years now, Rajeswari has been stitching apparel for a fee. While the flow of orders has increased steadily, Rajeswari hopes to leave no stone unturned. She, along with her group member, is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum to take her business to the next level. Rajeswari will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase fabric, ribbon, glitter and thread in bulk and repair her sewing machine.

Her step towards this expansion shows that she is committed to making this work. Rajeswari is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, ribbons, glitter and thread in bulk and repair her sewing machine

loans.name: Sidra

texts.en:
Sidra is 28 years old and a mother of two children. She lives in her own house with her spouse in the area of Multan, Pakistan. For several years her husband has been running a small general store, which is located in their home. He sells all kinds of items. With what he makes from his sales, he manages to pay for their household expenses.

Sidra is asking once again for a loan for her husband’s small general store. She will use the loan to purchase more dry beans and grains, oil, soups, candies, detergents, soap, soft drinks, etc. to stock her husband’s store and have better revenue.

Sidra and her family will be thankful to Kiva lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy detergent and other items for her husband's small general store.

loans.name: Puspa's Group

texts.en:
Puspa, a divorcee standing on the left hand side in the photograph, is a weaver by occupation. She chose this profession five years ago to supplement her family's income. Living in a small village in Odagaon, Odisha, India, Puspa's family includes her old father who runs a small cycle repair shop and her three children. Her eldest daughter is a weaver and her elder son is a painter. The youngest son, interestingly, earns for the family as a football player.

Puspa is happy that her children are all sustainable, however, she wants to provide them with a better standard of living. She, along with her group member, has applied for a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. Puspa will use her portion of the loan amount to buy cotton threads, starch, chemicals, colours and detergents from the wholesale market.

She plans to sell the finished products to the cloth traders and wholesalers at wholesale rates and to others at retail rates to earn profits.

Puspa is eagerly awaiting your kind help and support.

loans.use: to buy cotton threads, starch, chemicals, colours and detergents from the wholesale market

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex hails from the town of Antequera, Bohol. He earns a living by making native baskets and he also operates a habal-habal (motorcycle) transportation service. He is a 39-year-old man.

Alex decided to join Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in order to access loans and to continue improving his livelihood. He has requested a loan to purchase both gasoline and a pig. In this way, he will be able to finance his transportation service and start raising hogs.

Alex will now start to maximize his resources and augment his income.

loans.use: to purchase both gasoline and a pig.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a thirty-one-year-old single man living in Masindi, Uganda. He rides a motorcycle for his transport business. He has been in this business for eight years.

At first Patrick was riding someone else's motorcycle, but when he realized that he would generate more income, he decided to buy his own.

Patrick is charged with the responsibility of taking care of his children. He dreams of buying a vehicle for transport, but he is challenged by poor roads.

Patrick has requested a loan to roof his house.

loans.use: to buy sheets of iron to roof his house.

loans.name: Keam

texts.en:
Keam is a 43-year-old married mother of three children who are in school. She lives in a village of Sandan district, Kampong Thom province. Keam has struggled to earn a living through growing cassava and rice for 15 years. Besides this, her husband works as a paid worker to earn additional income. Together, they can earn about 25,000 KHR per day. The main challenge for her business is low crop yield resulting from insect pests.

Keam has been with VisionFund for three cycles already. The past loans have helped her to better support her children’s education. Now she is requesting a loan in order to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee and use some of the loan to buy some school materials for her children. She hopes that this loan will enable her to keep her daughter in school until her graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee and use some of the loan to buy some school materials for her children

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is not new to the Fresh Life franchise. She has successfully operated one Fresh Life toilet for over five months now. “This is not just a good business, but a venture that has transformed the Kayaba community beyond our expectation,” says Teresa, whose neighborhood was famous for flying toilets (plastic bags for excrement) along pathways.

Today, her neighborhood is cleaner and the Fresh Life movement has become a source of employment to many youths who have joined in. As for Teresa, joining this movement has helped her become a better provider for her family and she has been able to expand her retail shop business.

On a daily basis she serves at least one hundred customers with early mornings and evenings being her peak hours of business. During this time there are long queues at her premises and she is worried it might escalate to her losing customers who do not like the experience. She is therefore seeking to purchase an additional Fresh Life toilet, which she anticipates will be a solution towards providing better services to her community members.

loans.use: To pay for One Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina, age 42, is a mother of five children and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the market. This shop is the only source of income for the family.

He needs to purchase a tailoring machine and a variety of tailoring materials for the shop, including threads, needles, clothing, etc. These items are very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, he cannot purchase all of the items he needs.

Therefore, his wife, Samina is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase the needful things with the help of the loan amount. Samina is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy threads, needles, clothing etc. for her husband's tailoring services.

loans.name: Hannah Muthoni

texts.en: Hannah uses almost an eighth of her income on fuel every month. She met a Takamoto salesperson who made her realize that she can be spending the money spent on fuel towards her biogas loan repayment, which made a lot of sense to her. With this loan she will be able to own a biogas system in less than three years.

loans.use: To buy a bio-digester for clean reliable cooking.

loans.name: Zahida Parveen

texts.en:
Zahida is 31 and a mother of three children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. But Zahida runs a school canteen to earn an income.

She started her school canteen business four years ago because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses. She is a brave and hard working women.

Nowadays, Zahida wants to buy items such as biscuits, cake, milk, chairs, cups and a kettle from the market for her school canteen, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase more items. She has decided that she would like to buy more items directly from the market so that she can earn a better profit for her family. She has become an expert in her school canteen business. So, Zahida requested a loan so that she will be able to buy raw materials from the market.

Zahida and her family will be thankful to Kiva, the lenders, and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.
.

loans.use: to buy raw materials from the market for her school canteen.

loans.name: Biby

texts.en:
Biby was born in 1962 year. She is hardworking and smart woman. Biby works in a state organization. She is divorced and is the only feed keeper of her 3 children, so she works hard. Biby has additional income from sewing. She sews a variety of woman clothes in her house.

Biby is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy medicines because her child is ill. Biby and her child await your kindness.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment of her child.

loans.name: Anagtan

texts.en:
Anagtan is a 50-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a very hard worker and loves his family very much. He tries to make sure that his family does not have any needs left.

He is involved in his own business to have a regular income in the family. He is involved in manufacturing and selling furniture such as single beds, tables, etc. He started this business at a young age, and now he has grown old and weak as well.

Today, her husband has many regular customers and also takes orders from other cities. This business yields a good income for her husband, but her family's needs are increasing day by day and she needs more money to afford household expenses.

Now, she wants to buy more raw materials for her husband for making furniture in order to expand the business. This is why she came to BRAC Pakistan and wishes to obtain a loan, so that her husband can buy raw materials for making furniture. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for his business as well as for his family.

Anagtan thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her husband's furniture making shop.

loans.name: Sart

texts.en:
As a farmer from Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, SART, 53 years old, is working very hard on the rice field near her house. She is a hard-working mother of four children and one married. SART and her husband can earn approximately 7 USD a day. Being a farmer is the main work that she has done for more than 10 years.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue her farming, SART is borrowing some money from Kiva to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds, insecticides, and other related materials.
So she hopes that this requirement will help to improve her living conditions. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds, insecticides

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married and has a son. She has her own business.

She owns a small cafe called Express. It is located at the train station. Svetlana has been renting space to run her cafe for 5 years. The most popular goods in the cafe are hot dishes, bakery and drinks. She is a responsible and active person.

Svetlana is asking for a loan of 10 000 UAH to purchase pre cooked meals and drinks. The loan will help her to increase the assortment of products and serve more clients.

loans.use: to purchase pre cooked  meals and drinks at the cafe

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Chhun, aged 43, is a resident in Kampong Thom province and a widowed mother of four dependent children, two of whom are in school. To make a living, she has been growing rice and selling grocery items for years. The main challenge to the rice growing business is a drop in the price of rice.

Chhun is now seeking a loan from VisionFund Cambodia to pay tuition fees for her sons to study at a local university, majoring in marketing. She hopefully wants to see her sons studying in university and have a well-paid job for a living.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her sons to study marketing at a local university.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Kampong Svay District

loans.name: Mayranush

texts.en:
This is Mayranush, who is living in Goght village of Kotayq region with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two minor grandchildren.

Mayhranush and her family are engaged in the farming business. Every member in the family has its own work in the farm. They keep a livestock of cows, calves, bees, pigs and oxen and also cultivate apple, cherry and walnut trees. Even small income earned from farming business is very important for this family to cover daily basic needs.

Mayranush requested this loan to purchase two cows, and forage for feeding the cattle. This will sustain the cattle during the winter and also will enlarge number of cows by two, meaning more milk and dairy products to sell.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and forage for feeding the cattle .

loans.name: Mays

texts.en:
Mays is a 32-year-old single woman living in Jenin in Palestine. Mays has a bride dresses store and she requested to take a loan from ACAD to increase her stock and improve her income. She started her business seven years ago by having some capital from the family that helped her in opening her store.

Mays says that the extra money from this loan will help her to expand her store and improve her standards of living. The main challenge of the business is the existing competitor in the same area.
In the future Mays plans to open several bridal dresses stores in the West Bank. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to increase her store's stock

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a new client of UGAFODE microfinance ltd and is 51 years. He is a very active person involved in agriculture especially cattle rearing as well as banana growing. He is married with 6 children and 5 school going, 3 in Secondary school and 2 in basic level.

He has requested for a loan of UGX3,000,000= (Three million five only) to improve his agricultural production. He also trades in cows where he earns additional income and started his business in 2001. He carries his agriculture in the rural area of Kiryemi 1, bukongoro, mutara, mitooma district.
He began the business to earn additional income for development. When he gets the loan; he will use it to buy two dairy cows to increase on milk production. His clients are all kinds of people from the neighbouring places.

Wilson hopes to increase his agricultural business and to improve the welfare of his family.
He is faced by bad weather conditions especially in dry season which reduces on his yields, limited capital to boost his business and also pests and diseases which destroy crops.
He is honest and hard working

loans.use: to buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Jetrida

texts.en: Jetrida is married with seven children. She deals in cassava flour for now eight years. She also does farming as a side income business. She is doing well though faced with a challenge of bad debtors.
