However she is working on that challenge, she no longer gives her goods on credit,but does only on cash payments.She is requesting  for money to buy more cassava flour for sell, because the current stock cannot sustain her clients.

loans.use: to buy more cassava flour for selling.

loans.name: Xhevahir

texts.en:
Xhevahir's wife, Vergjinush has been scheduled for a surgery soon and this loan will make possible for her to pay for the surgery and other related expenses.They both come from the vulnerable ethnic community of Egyptian Albanians and are in their 60's and parents of three adults.They both also receive disability income due to their health status: Xhevahir receives $157.4/month whereas his wife $105.5/month.

"It's been very difficult for us financially. We've got no help and and living in the city limits us from rural activities.Our children are married and have their families to feed, thus, they cannot help us. Our monthly medications, cost us a lot of money. After we pay for our medication, the money left is only to eat little bit of bread with cheese and cooked beans.Lacking nutrient makes us more sick..." said Vergjinush looking way while talking in the interview.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's surgery that is been scheduled to happen soon

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma and her husband (in the photo) live happily in Yeghegnavan village of Ararat region with their two sons. Their two sons work in private sector, and do their best to sustain the family.
Emma's and her husband's occupation is in agribusiness. The keep a livestock of two cows, two oxen and a calf and get dairy products which they sell in the market. This couple also cultivates a grape orchard and get rich harvest during the season.

The requested loan will help them to purchase the wires needed for the improvement of grape orchard, forage for feeding the livestock and cover salary of workers helping them with the cultivation of land. The loan will support Emma's farming business and her whole family hope for the lenders' faith.

loans.use: to pay for wires needed for the improvement of grape orchard, forage for feeding the livestock and cover salary of workers helping her with the cultivation of land

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark is a forty six year old married man with eight children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer who has passion for animals and he rears pigs, goats and cattle and has been in this business for four years. He also grows crops to supplement his earnings. With the income earned he has been able to pay school fees for his children and other basics for the family.

Prolonged drought and high cost of pesticides affect his business expansion, while his dreams are to buy more land for farming and educate his children to attain degrees as minimum qualification. Mark intends to use the loan to buy piglets to rear.

loans.use: to buy piglets to rear.

loans.name: Takudzwa Group

texts.en:
Winnie smiles as she hands a young child much anticipated French fries and thanks her young customer whilst already attending to other scholars and other older customers buying her fries, hamburgers and sausages. She also has an ice cream machine and sells ice cream which is currently selling like hot cakes as the summer of 2015 has been very hot.

Six days a week she sits by the pavement with her chip fryer, gas grill, small table, spices and sauces grilling and frying chips and sausages for her customers. She makes sure that her working area is spic and span, trying to keep in as hygienic as possible. She has earned the loyalty of the nearby shop workers who come to her for their lunchtime meals.

Winnie restocks her ingredients on a daily basis as in her line of business she has to use the freshest of ingredients. She started this business early this year as she realised that sitting at home the whole day was not helping her in any way. She eventually got tired of asking for money for every little need she had from her spouse.

Since she enjoyed cooking and was good at it, she decided to venture into the cooking business. The business took of well and she has managed to establish for herself a good customer base. Her husband has been very supportive and helping her especially during weekends when he is free. Her sales have been good and giving her profit that is enabling her to supplement her husband’s income. Winnie is also a cross border trader occasionally crossing to neighbouring South Africa to buy clothing and accessories for resale.

She is a married mother to three children. She and the other four members of Takudzwa group are friends whose friendship was established on business grounds and the fact that they live in the same area and walking distances from each other. The ladies in the group are involved in cross border, poultry and catering businesses.

With her loan she is planning to buy more catering equipment so that she can be able to cater for big functions and also to buy big items like fridges and furniture items for resale. She has future plans of being a homeowner by acquiring a residential stand in Harare and building a house for her family.

loans.use: o buy more catering equipment so that she can be able to cater for big functions and also to buy big items like fridges and furniture items for resale.

loans.name: Rafiki Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising hand in the photo is Joan, a member of Rafiki Self Help group. She is forty two years old, married and a mother of four. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014.
She does maize farming as her main business. She has benefited much from hand in hand eastern Africa training on enterprise and record keeping and this has enabled her manage business well. 
She is borrowing from Kiva to buy quality fertilizer and seeds so that she can increase her production and income. This will assist her cater for the family needs and in paying school fee. 
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly

loans.use: to buy quality fertilizer and seeds so that she can increase her production and income.

loans.name: Siguitemogoson Group

texts.fr: Kadia Chaka est la femme qui tient le bélier sur cette photo avec un foulard. Elle a 46 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants qui sont âgée de 15 à 25 ans. Elle fait l’élevage de moutons et chèvres aussi bien que son mari. Kadia Chaka fait recourt au prêt de l’IMF pour acheter plus des moutons, et des chèvres pour son élevage enfin de gagner beaucoup de bénéfices. Expérimenté dans son élevage qu’elle exerce depuis 10 ans elle réalise un bénéfice mensuel de 10 000 CFA après ses dépenses, le prêt l’aide à faire face aux différents besoin de sa famille tel que les soins de santé de ses enfants et leur alimentations .Ces achats et vente se font en argent liquide au marché de Kimparana ainsi que dans les autres marchés de sa localité.
texts.en: Kadia Chaka is the woman pictured with a scarf holding the goat. She is 46 years old, married with five children who are aged 15 to 25 years old. She breeds sheep and goats just as well as her husband. Kadia Chaka is requesting a loan from IMF to buy more sheep and goats for breeding in order to make more profits. She has 10 years of experience and her monthly revenue, after her expenses, is 10,000 CFA francs. The loan will help her to meet her family's needs such as her children's health care and nutrition. These purchases and sales are made in cash at Kimparana market and in other markets in her community.

loans.use: to breed sheep and goats to sell and make profits

loans.name: Nurmahmad

texts.en:
Nurmahmad is one of the hardworking and responsible residents of the district of Bohtar. He is 57 years old. In the district he is a respected man where he always helps people in need. For five years Nurmahmad is engaged in an agriculture business but in his free time he works as a taxi driver.

For his good life he is working day and night. This activity is very important for Nurmahmad, because it brings great income. At the moment his car broken and he needs to repair it. For this Nurmahmad applied to take loan. With this loan he will be able to repair his car and gets income. Nurmahmad awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Los Finqueros Group

texts.es: Procedente de una comarca rural del municipio se encuentra el grupo los finqueros, coordinado por Johana, de 31 años, acompañada y con 3 hijos a su responsabilidad. Estando con por 8va vez solicitando crédito requiere del préstamo para su negocio de preparación y venta de comida para el consumo de la población.  Con crédito solicitado invertirá en la compra de carne, granos básicos, perecederos y frutas. Las demás socias son Ingrid de 23 años dedicada a la venta de ropa, como pantalones, camisas, zapatos y más. Héctor de 24 años se dedica a la venta de verduras, Karla de 30 años, a la venta de calzado y Suyamin a la venta de repollo.
texts.en:
The group Los Finqueros comes from a rural district of the Masaya municipality in Nicaragua. The group's coordinator is Johana, who is 31, is in a domestic partnership and has 3 children under her responsibility.  This being her 8th loan request, she needs it for her business preparing and selling food to the general public.  With this loan she will purchase meat, basic food staples, perishables and fruits.  

The other members of this group are: Ingrid who is 23 years old and makes a living selling clothing such as pants, shirts, shoes, etc.; 24-year-old Hector who makes a living selling vegetables; Karla who is 30 and sells shoes for a living; and Suyamin who makes a living selling cabbage.

loans.use: to purchase meat, basic food staples, perishables and fruits.

loans.name: Topclass Group

texts.en:
Irene is 58. She sells gari (powdered cassava) with other food stuffs such as charcoal, yam and wants to invest this loan in the purchase of these items. She started her business when she was 20, selling on a wholesale bases. Bit by bit her business grew until she was able to open her own store. Her clients are her neighbors, as well as nearby restaurants.

Her goals are to improve her quality of life, increase production, offer a variety of food stuffs, improve her income, strengthen her business, and help to pay the household costs. She has had one previous loan with ID-Ghana, which helped her to expand her business. She the group leader of 'top class 1' in the localities of Chorkor in the greater Accra region of Ghana.

loans.use: to purchase cassava, yam and charcoal to sell to her buyers.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson is married with children. He owns a motorcycle spare parts shop. He has dealt in this business for one and half years and is doing perfectly well serving many clients, that his stock can no longer contain them. Nelson lacks some little money to buy more spare parts and meet his clients' needs. He is requesting for a credit facility to buy the spare parts for selling.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for selling.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is married with children. She operates a retail shop for now two years. Her business helps her to look after her family. She is faced with a challenge of competition, but tries to manage it by selling a variety of goods in her shop.

Ellen wants to construct a house thus requesting for a loan to buy construction materials like bricks and she kicks off here.

loans.use: to buy materials like bricks for construction.

loans.name: Herculana

texts.en:
Herculana  is a 61-year-old married woman and has ten children , whom two are still attending school. For many years ago, she started working in  the field to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their household. 

She  is a hard worker who is trying desperately to develop her business, but she is also a sacrificing mother who deprives herself for the sake of her children.  She has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner   CEVI, to to invest in fertilizer.

Herculana  hopes to expand her business more in the future through investing other business ventures to increase her income and improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: to invest in fertilizer

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is 45 years old. She lives with her pensioner mother in Ambrolauri district. The family owns a vineyard and a cow. They produce wine and sell locally. Manana wants to open a beauty salon and requested a loan.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 2000 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase all the needed equipment to open a beauty salon and will serve locals as a stylist. She is very motivated and hopes that the new business will be profitable for her family. Manana awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a beauty salon and serve locals as a stylist

loans.name: Meresiana

texts.en:
Meresiana is an old client of UGAFODE microfinance and is aged 51. She is a very active person involved in agriculture in which she grows matooke and coffee. She also has a firewood and charcoal business where she earns an extra income for her family. She is married with 5 kids and 4 school going.

She has requested for a loan of UGX1,500,000= (one million five hundred thousand only shillings only) to boost her charcoal and firewood business. She works for 12 hours daily and she started his business in 2009. She carries out her business in the rural area of Kigoma,kyamuhunga. She began the business to earn more income in addition to her agricultural products.

When she gets the loan; she will use it to buy more stock of fire wood for sale in the business. Her clients are the restaurant and hotel businesses who use the firewood for cooking since the cost of gas and electricity is high.
Mrs. Meresiana hopes to increase in boosting her business and to construct a big and better house her family. She is faced by limited capital to boost her agricultural production.
She is very honest and hard working.

loans.use: to buy firewood for sale.

loans.name: Terious Group

texts.en:
The baby suckles on its mother’s breast, making noises of enjoyment and fulfillment. The mother patiently feeds her baby, seeing to it that the little stomach is filled with nourishment. This soft and loving display of womanhood and motherhood is a sharp contrast to the woman we see later in the yard, managing her brick making business. She takes on a serious demeanor and sees to it that enough bricks are produced for her customers. She also takes stock of the cement and sand needed for the manufacturing process to see if there are enough raw materials.

Synodia is a young mother of three children. She is 32 years of age and resides in Highfields Harare. After realizing that her husband’s income as a security guard was not enough to sustain them, she decided to step up and help him. She saw that there were many people acquiring residential stands and some that were extending existing properties. She realized that bricks manufactured by big companies were expensive and beyond the reach of the low income earners in and around her neighborhood.

She bought brick molding tools, shovels, and other necessary equipment for the brick manufacturing process. She started producing not only bricks but also precast walling slabs and pillars. Then she identified an experienced young man whom she employed to manufacture the bricks, and she pays him on commission according to the bricks he produces.

Synodia is not just an overseer but also helps to offload the sand being delivered by trucks to her yard. She is a hands-on manager who knows and can do all that needs to be known and done in her business. The business has given her good returns, which in turn have enabled her to feed and clothe her children without any hassles.

She is a member of Terious Group, which consists of three other women who reside in close proximity to her. The other women are cross-border traders and also have a passion to succeed in life and to grow their businesses. The group applied for a group loan from Thrive and was approved after attending all the requisite training sessions.

With her loan, Synodia is planning to purchase more cement and sand for the manufacture of bricks and dura walls. The demand seems to be increasing daily as more people need to erect walls around their properties for added security.

loans.use: to purchase more cement and sand for the manufacture of bricks and dura walls.

loans.name: File

texts.en:
File is in the photograph with Rit, her husband and father of two, 16 and 8 years old.

They are both in their early 40s and live in a little coastal northern town where Rit does fishing to earn an income of $300/month, and File works as a cashier for a monthly income of $134 in a little food market in the same town.

The reason they are requesting this loan is that they want to make some types of repairs and build a fence around their home.

Prior to living in this little town, they lived in the very rural northern part of the country where infrastructure doesn't even exist. "Our lives were so difficult. The village and the surroundings were covered in snow for about nine months a year. There were no opportunities to work or do anything else but dry beans to have them as staple food for winter, and also make smoked pork meat, again for winter. We are so very lucky to have come to this new location and raise our children here," said File, smiling.

loans.use: to make some sort of repairs to their home.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 30-year-old married woman living with her 1 child in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a very poor and needy woman. The major problem with her poverty is that her husband has not adopted a profitable business yet. She is passing her life with her family hand to mouth.

Her husband provides sheltering services to earn money to feed the whole family. Due to continuously working, the planks have broken and lost their smoothness, which means they need to be replaced with new ones.

Now her husband is unable to continue his business without smooth planks, wooden boards and bamboo. Therefore, Rukhsana requested a loan for her husband so that her husband will be able to buy new smooth wooden boards and bamboo to continue his business again.

Rukhsana hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in her life and her husband will earn maximum profit with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to buy sheltering material such as wooden planks and bamboo for her husband's sheltering services.

loans.name: Goluni's Group

texts.en:
Goluni is a differently-abled lady standing on the left in the photograph. She is a humble resident of a small and remote village in Odagaon, Odisha, India. She has a family of six including her husband and children. Goluni's husband works as a farmer and struggles to meet the expenses of his family.

Goluni took up weaving fabrics eight years ago to supplement the family income. Goluni's weaving is very neat, with no loose threads anywhere. She also has a good imagination and taste for designs and incorporates these in her weaving. Because of this, there has been an increase in the inflow of orders, so she wants to weave more.

Goluni, along with her group member, is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan to purchase various raw materials like thread, colors, dyes, etc.

Goluni is eagerly awaiting for your kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase various raw materials like thread, colors, dyes, etc.

loans.name: Frasiah

texts.en:
Frasiah is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a farm where she keeps goats and cows, and where she also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a productive place, and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to be a large-scale farmer within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of fish.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Nara

texts.en:
Nara is a nice and hardworking mother of two sons. Her husband and elder son are migrant workers in a neighbouring country, so Nara has to run their family farm alone. She breeds cattle and also cultivates vegetables in the arable land near their house.

Nara sells products such as wheat, potatoes, milk, sour cream and eggs, and earns income for her family. She requested this loan to purchase potato seeds, fertilizer and fodder for the cattle. She wants to purchase potato seeds, because in this season they are cheap, and this cost saving will greatly help Nara on the farm.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds, fertilizer and fodder for the cattle

loans.name: Nanuli

texts.en:
Nanuli is a 69-year-old married woman from the village of Sartichala. She lives with her husband, and both are involved in agribusiness. Nanuli and her husband take care of dairy cows and produce cheese that is sold at the local open market. The income is not enough to meet all of their family expenses, so the couple lives in poverty.

Nanuli requested financial support to start a stable business and open a general store locally. After several unsuccessful attempts, she applied for credit from MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. Nanuli plans to purchase stock of products and have money for working capital to start her business. She will work as a sales lady and have her own loyal customers among local people.

Nanuli will do her best to develop her trading business gradually. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased when Nanuli opens her general store.

loans.use: to open a general store and get a stable source of income.

loans.name: Izolda

texts.en:
Izolda is 63 years old and from Shuamta village. She is widow woman who lives alone and earns a living from small agricultural activities.

Izolda seasonally harvests nuts, which are sold to local retailers for a good price. Also she gets social assistance from the local government because she has very poor living conditions.

Izolda has the desire to expand her agricultural activity and requested financial support from local credit providers. According to Credo estimations, her family belongs to the vulnerable poor category.

Izolda has requested a Credo loan for the start-up of a dairy farming business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

Izolda will purchase dairy cows and will start milking them. She will start production of cheese and she will sell it at the open market of the nearby town. As a result of the new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, Izolda's income will significantly increase.

loans.use: to start dairy farming and expand her agribusiness.

loans.name: Kumara's Group

texts.en:
Kumara is a widow standing on the right in the photograph. She is a humble resident of Odagaon, Odisha, India. Kumara is a hardworking lady. The rising costs of food grains, education, and other basic needs leaves her with no savings. Kumara has good experience in vegetable cultivation and selling and has put her knowledge to good use.

Kumara, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner, People's Forum. With the loan amount, she will expand the business of vegetable cultivation from her home only. Kumara will use her portion of the loan amount to buy materials required to cultivate vegetables such as fertilizers, seeds, plants, etc. Post harvest, she will sell these vegetables in her local market.

She is confident of repaying the loan amount within the timeline.

loans.use: to buy materials required to cultivate vegetables such as fertilizers, seeds, plants, etc.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es: Doña Angelina, de 66 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, actualmente vive junto a su nieta en el municipio de Mezapa, Atlántida colindando con El Progreso, Yoro. Ella se dedica al servicio de transporte en una moto-taxi desde hace 2 años. Anteriormente solamente se dedicaba a la venta de mercadería. Está solicitando la cantidad de 10,000 Lempiras que invertirá la mitad en el mantenimiento de su mototaxi y la otra mitad en la compra de mercadería como ropa para retomar su negocio donde ya tiene su clientela también. Esto le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos y poder ofrecer un buen servicio a la clientela. Su meta es mejorar como microempresaria y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Angelina is a 66-year-old single mother of 3. She currently lives with her granddaughter in the municipality of Mezapa, Atlántida on the border with El Progreso, Yoro. For the past two years she has made a living offering transportation services with her motor rickshaw. Previously her only means of living was selling general merchandise.  

Angelina is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 Lempiras, half of which she will use to invest in the maintenance of her motor rickshaw and the other half she will use to purchase merchandise such as clothing in order to take back up her previous business where she also has an established clientele. This will help her improve her income and enable her to offer her customers good service.  Angelina's goal is to improve as a micro-entrepreneur and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance of her motor rickshaw and to purchase general merchandise, such as clothing, for resale.

loans.name: Kamanti's Group

texts.en:
Kamanti, standing on the left in the photograph, is a divorcee. She is a lady with strong will and determination. Being an ambitious lady, Kamanti has never looked back in her life. She has raised her three daughters singlehandedly and provided them the best possible education within her capacity. A humble resident of Odagaon, Odisha, India, she has been engaged in making incense sticks for last seven years.

Her product has a very high demand in the village market due to the fragrance she uses in the sticks and the reasonable price of her product. Kamanti, along with her group member, is requesting a loan in the amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase raw materials in bulk like scented powder, wooden sticks, glue, and scented ether.

Kamanti is eagerly awaiting your kind help and aspires to expand her business and add on to her product line in the future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials in bulk, such as scented powder, wooden sticks, glue, and scented ether.

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a married mother of four who has been running her convenience store since 1991 to support her husband in covering their family's living expenses. She is 51 and is fully aware of her family's responsibilities and financial needs.

Layla is working hard to provide her children a better living, especially since one of them is still at school.

To increase her selling, Layla is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special offer products for winter. She is looking for future developments, and hopes to achieve them soon.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special offer products for winter to increase her selling.

loans.name: Linah

texts.en:
Linah is 37 years old. She is married and has five children.

She has had a dairy farming business for 14 years. She will use the loan to purchase dairy feed to feed her dairy cows for more production of milk to sell to her clients. She hopes the additional income will help her educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her dairy farming.

She is in her ninth loan cycle and has borrowed KES 20,000.

loans.use: to purchase dairy feed.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 53 years old, married to Samwel and blessed with six children aged between 25 and 14 years. She has been into the vegetable and tea selling business for eight years, and earns a monthly income of KES 25,000.

This being her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, she intends to buy more vegetables and tea for resale. With the anticipated profits, she will be able to help her husband to pay school fees for their children from the expanded business.

Her dream is to be able to maintain her farm well for high productivity.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and tea for resale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his tuk tuk. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a competitive place and his primary customers are locals.

He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to maintain and service his tuk tuk. His business goal is to have a transport company within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to maintain and service his tuk tuk

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a farm where he grows maize, beans and other crops. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.en:
Anastasio used a recent loan worth PHP 8,000 to meet his daily household expenses and develop his variety store business. His improved inventory increased his competitiveness in their community. He also added some amount in his savings. He happily extends his deep thanks to you, and wants you to know that his previous loan was faithfully paid.

This time, he would like to take another loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to buy additional products. He trusts that you would help him again. He prays for a better and comfortable life in the near future.

He meets weekly with his fellowship group* to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional products for his variety store

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a competitive place and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loan was repaid successsfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
The woman in the picture is Salvacion, 45 years old. She operates her own sari-sari store (a Filipino term for a small variety store) for a living. The store is occupying a small space in their humble house in Fatima, General Santos City, South Cotabato. Operating for eight years now, she has managed to keep the business running and growing despite the rigid competition in this line of business.

At some point, she experiences lack of needed capital to buy her products because she has to compromise her funds to pay their bills. Instead of buying groceries, she has to consider the household needs first, what they have to eat for the day, the payment for electricity and water, etc. There are also instances when her neighbors delay their payments for the goods they get from her store, causing her business to suffer.

She hopes to improve her inventory by adding assorted groceries, beverages, basic school supplies, and other usual commodities. She is applying for a loan amount of PHP 18,000 and praying that her request will be granted. She promises to use the amount for the said purpose and pay it back to the best of her ability.

She wants her children to finish schooling and have a progressive business that can help other people. She is a faithful member of Center for Community Transformation. Micro-entrepreneurs like Salvacion are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 members. They meet on weekly basis to share the goodness of God in their lives and their experiences on the very unique work of transformation that CCT offers.

loans.use: to add assorted groceries, beverages, basic school supplies, and other usual commodities

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a Kiva borrower. He has 4 children. He operates a retail business where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. He hopes that in the future, he will have better living conditions.

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to open another outlet.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a 56 year old married man with 10 children all living in Fort Portal Uganda. He has a business of distilling waragi, a local drink in his village. He is also a farmer growing sugar cane and dairy farming on a large scale. He started these businesses in 1990 having a goal of earning an income for his family.

He faces challenges of unpredictable price changes that hinder him from expanding his business. Besides that, he has hopes of having rental houses where he can yield more income. Amos has asked for a loan to help him buy covering materials, doors and windows for his house.

loans.use: to buy covering materials, doors and windows for his house.

loans.name: Kouméalo

texts.fr: Mère de trois enfants, Kouméalo est une veuve femme âgée de 37 ans résidant à Adidogomè. Kouméalo  prépare et vend de la boisson locale appelé « Tchoukoudou » faite à base du mil. Kouméalo s’approvisionne du nécessaire pour la préparation au marché. Pour commander des sacs de mil, Kouméalo demande ce prêt pour financer son achat ; ce qui lui permet d’augmenter sa quantité de marchandises, éviter les ruptures; de fidéliser ses clients et avoir plus de bénéfices pour participer aux charges de son foyer puis aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
The mother of three children, Kouméalo is a widow aged 37, living in Adidogomè. She prepares and sells a local beverage called Tchoukoudou, made out of millet. She buys the necessary ingredients for preparing it at the market.

So as to place an order for some sacks of millet, Kouméalo is requesting this loan to finance her purchase. This will permit her to increase her inventory, avoid running out of her drink, retain her customers, and make more income to use in covering the household expenses and helping her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of millet.

loans.name: Dorcas Njoki

texts.en: Dorcas got interested in Takamoto biogas loans because of their flexible loan repayment and reliability. She relies on firewood for fuel and would want to switch to biogas because of its convenience and ease of use.

loans.use: to buy a biodigester for clean, reliable energy for cooking.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 25-year-old man from Jabalia City. Mohammad was living with his family in a small, humble house, but during the latest war on Gaza, his house was destroyed completely, and he had to rent a small apartment in the same area.

Recently Mohammad took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit and Development (FATEN) in order to rebuild his old house. The loan will allow Mohammad to finalize the needed construction in a short time and return his family to their normal life.

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to rebuild his old house.

loans.name: José Humberto

texts.es:
José de 29 años de edad, es agricultor, su grado académico es hasta 9° grado, sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos y por esa razón no pudieron mandarlo a estudiar en grados superiores, está acompañado, junto a su pareja han procreado 3 hijos, todos estudian y su compañera de vida es ama de casa.

José se ha dedicado desde muy pequeño a la agricultura y la ganadería, sus padres le infundieron estos trabajos para que tuviera ingresos y pudiera llevar el pan de cada día a su casa, hoy José agradece ese esfuerzo que hicieron sus padres ya que debido a eso, es hombre de bien, él siembra maíz, el cultivo lo tiene a una distancia cercana de su  vivienda, sus hijos le ayudan mucho, debido a que ya aprendieron bien este trabajo y son ellos los que apoyan en la siembra y mantenimiento del cultivo, también tienen unas vacas lecheras, venden leche, queso, entre otros lácteos y de esas ventas ellos pueden comprar sus alimentos diarios.

José con el préstamo comprará 2 novillos de repasto, para engordarlos durante un periodo de tiempo, luego los venderá para cancelar a tiempo su préstamo.

El sueño anhelado de José es luchar para agrandar mas su negocio para generar mas ganancias y darle a sus hijos un nivel de vida mejor.
texts.en:
José is 29 years old and is a farmer. His education level is the ninth grade. His parents had limited economic resources and that´s why they could not send him to study at higher grades.
He lives in a relationship. He and his partner gave birth to 3 children. All of them are studying and his partner is a housewife.

José is working in agriculture and ranching since he was a little boy. His parents instilled these works in him so that he could have an income and bring the the daily bread at his home.
Nowadays José recognizes these efforts that his parents made, because thanks to these he is a good man. He is sowing corn. He has the crops in a near distance from his home.
His children are helping him a lot since they already learned this work very well. And it´s they who are helping with the sowing and maintenance of the crop. They also have some milking cows, sell milk, cheese, among other dairy products and from those sales they can buy their daily food.

With the loan, José will buy 2 grazing steers, to fatten them for a certain period of time. Afterwards he will sell them, to pay off his loan on time. The dream José yearns for is to strive to further expand his business to generate more earnings and offer his children a better living standard.

loans.use: to buy two grazing steers, to fatten them for a certain period of time. Afterwards he will sell them.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 39 years old. She is married with 5 children.

She has had a rabbit farming business for 2 years. She will be using the loan to purchase timber and materials for constructing a new rabbit den and hopes this will help her educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are expand her rabbit farming and start dairy farming.

She is in her second loan cycle and has borrowed KShs 30,000

loans.use: to purchase timber and materials for constructing a new rabbit den

loans.name: For Christ Group

texts.en:
Nafisatu is a 26-year-old married mother of one child. She is a hard working woman who puts much effort into supporting her husband and in making their living.

Nafisatu is well known in her region with her good reputation. Four years ago she started working from her house. She is a trader who sells toothbrushes and toothpaste. She runs her business from her house, but is seeking to expand her business to increase her sales and income at the same time.

Thus, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner ID Ghana to buy more inventory of toothpaste and brushes for her business. She is the group representative of the For Christ Group.

She hopes that one day she can open a shop and display specially-released home products, attracting everyone.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste and brushes

loans.name: Shamshad Bibi

texts.en:
Shamshad is a 27year-old married woman living in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She has been running an embroidery business for 8 years ago to meet the family’s expenses. Her embroidery business is very famous in the area and that is the reason her business runs well. Due to good relation her business has increased.

Shamshad buys materials such as Hand- Embroidery kit, ribbons, needles and embroidery machines from the market. Another person handles her transactions with her customers.

She has decided that she would like to sell her embroidery items directly in the market, so that she can earn better profit for her family. So, Shamshad demanded a loan so she will be able to buy raw materials from the market.

She wants to meet the demand for bridal dresses. That is why she wants to buy threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors in advance, to have in stock. She requires some capital to buy the desired items but does not have sufficient cash on hand.

Therefore, Shamshad humbly requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan. Through this loan, she will be able to buy all that she needs.

Shamshad and her family will be thankful to the Kiva, lender s and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.
.

loans.use: to buy embroidery raw materials for herself.

loans.name: Gwa Ka Lay Village Group

texts.en:
The previous Kiva loan helped Gwa Ka Lay Village group members purchase high-quality feed, which boosted their overall income. They could also repair their unstructured duck farms and purchase pigs.

This re-listed loan will help 20 members expand their livestock business by purchasing more ducklings. It will also allow them to generate additional income that will help to cover their children's school fees, especially for secondary and high school students. The whole group is very thankful for all the generosity that they are receiving from the Kiva community.

loans.use: to purchase ducklings.

loans.name: Jak

texts.en:
Jak's sons do seasonal work in Italy and now they needed traveling tickets and this is the reason why Jak is applying for this loan. Jak is 52 and a married father of three: 27, 24 and 14 with the two older kids doing labour seasonal work in Italy.

He's been repairing motorcycles for the past ten years and this has been his source of income ever since ($145/month). His wife receives a disability income of $43.7/month. In the little two dynym yard that they have, they mainly plant for their own consumption and have some oranges and tangerines again for their own use. "We live in a coastal village, but our living is difficult. With the money we make, it's tough. Our both son's go to Italy for labour work these three months of the year and whatever they make there, bring it here, yet still...'" said Jak to the branch assistant who called him up to learn more about the reason of the loan.

loans.use: to pay for tickets of his sons who go for seasonal work to Italy

loans.name: Gerald Warui

texts.en: Gerald is a small scale farmer and has always wanted to own a biogas system but did not know a reliable installer.  He learnt of the flexible repayment schedule of Takamoto biogas and got interested.  With this loan he will be able to enjoy clean and convenient fuel.

loans.use: To buy a bio-digester for clean reliable cooking.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 26 years old. He is married to Soipei who is a farmer and a livestock keeper, and they are blessed with 4 children. 

He has had a farming business for 5 years, currently earning a monthly income of KES. 25,000. He has borrowed KES. 75,000 from VisionFund Kenya as his second loan, after paying the previous loan successful. 

Patrick will use the loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and seedlings. With the anticipated profits, he will be able to repay his loan as well as educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to enjoy an improved life with his wife and kids.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 22 years old. He is not married with 1 child.

He has had a retail of assorted goods business for 4 years. He will be using the loan to purchase more stock of assorted goods and hopes this will help him to expand his business and attract more customers.

His hopes and dreams for the future are open a retail shop.

He is in his first loan cycle and has borrowed KShs 5,000

loans.use: to purchase more stock of assorted goods

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 28 years old married to Henry and blessed with two children .

She has been into snacks business for two years and earns a monthly income of Kshs. 6000.She also practices dairy farming for additional income.

This being her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, she intends to buy bales of wheat flour, sugar, salt and baking powder for resale for her food stall as she anticipates to help the husband in paying school fees for their children from the expanded business profits.

Her dream is to open up a restaurant in the village center.

loans.use: to buy bales of wheat flour, sugar, salt and baking powder for resale for her food stall.

loans.name: Ilia

texts.en:
Ilia is a 35-year-old married father of three children, who are 12, 7 and 5 years old. He's been photographed with his youngest one.

Ilia's family lives in a very rural village, where his wife has been doing some clothing repairs and stitching clothes and drapes and other related things from her own home for annual earnings of approximately $900, while Ilia has been working in a nearby hydro, and earns $230 a month.

Their village is built on a mountain, and so there is no land where they can plant anything, and it is also covered in snow most of the year. Villagers, though, manage to keep one or two cows at home for family consumption, and to feed them, they have to buy food most of the year. In the village there are two coal mines, a high school and a cantonment.

The loan that Ilia is seeking will be used to improve sanitation. He will build a washroom and sewage system with the loan proceeds.

loans.use: to improve sanitation by building a washroom and sewage system.

loans.name: Rafiki Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising hand in the photo is Joseph, a member of Rafiki Self help group. He is forty four years old, married and a father of seven. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014.
He does maize, beans and dairy farming as his main business. He has benefited much from hand in hand eastern Africa (HIHEA) training on enterprise and financial management that has enabled him to manage his business well.

He is borrowing from hand in hand to purchase more quality farm inputs that will consequently increase his income. This will assist him to cater for the family needs such as food, medicine and in paying school fees for her children.
He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase more quality farm inputs that will consequently increase his income.

loans.name: Santi's Group

texts.en:
A dairy farmer by occupation, Santi and her family of three live in a thatched-roof home in a remote village of Odagaon, Odisha, India. She has been rearing cows for five years now, and handles both her household and the business well. After having single-handedly managed the business well for so long, Santi strongly believes she is ready to take it forward.

Santi, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase another cow for her farm. The additional cattle will add and increase the amount of milk that Santi can sell and multiply the profits from the business.

Also, Santi smartly manages her dairy cattle at home, which cuts down any extra costs for sheltering the animals. With a skills set of a pro, Santi promises to repay her loan on time.

Santi, a single mother, is standing to the left hand side in the photograph.

loans.use: to purchase another cow for her farm.

loans.name: Chung

texts.en:
Mrs. Chung is 57 years old, and she is a hardworking woman. She is married, and has four children, two of whom have jobs.

The loan can help her to build a sanitary latrine, which can contribute to improving the health of her family as well as to environmental protection. Husbandry and fishing are the main income sources of her family, so she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Nhan

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhan is a hardworking woman, 33 years old. She is married and has two children. Her family’s income is mainly from small business.

She would like to take a loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family’s member. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Nuong

texts.en:
Mrs. Nuong is 51 years old, married and has three children. She lives in rural area and raising poultry and cattle are her main job, which she has been doing for more than 20 years.

The loan can help her to build a sanitatary latrine in order to improve her living standard, especially her children.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Rutendo Group

texts.en:
Pedzisai of Rutendo Group hopes to improve her standard of living through working hard for her family. Rutendo is a vernacular name which means faith and being hopeful in any situation.

Pedzisai, far left in the photo, was based in South Africa, where she sold clothes for a living. Due to homesickness, she decided to come back to Zimbabwe where she would stay close to her family and care for her children. Pedzisai is a mother of five: four boys and a girl.

Pedzisai is now in the cross-border business of buying and selling java and wax cloths; she buys them from Zambia. On average, she sells 60 wax cloths per month, as well as other clothing like trousers and socks, in and around the community. Through this business, she is now able to buy more furniture for her house and pay her children’s school fees.

Lack of adequate capital was hindering her ability to grow her business to its full potential. Pedzisai came to know about Thrive Microfinance through a friend and decided to learn about financial literacy and business management as well as borrowing. Through Thrive Microfinance training, she has furthered her business knowledge in terms of marketing her products as well as making informed decisions on her capital.

Pedzisai is looking forward to opening up a boutique and reaching her full business potential as her business is booming. Through a loan from Thrive, she hopes to increase her capacity--as she is now facing a capital shortage crisis--to restock more clothes and wax cloths from neighboring countries.

loans.use: to restock more clothes and java design and wax cloth for sale.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Ms. Phuong is a hardworking woman, 25 years old. She is single and lives with her parents. Her income is mainly from husbandry and salary. She would like to borrow a loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family members. With support from her parents, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 30 years old. He is married to Seiyan, who is a farmer, and they are blessed with four children of ages between eight and two years.

He has had a farming business for 7 years, currently earning a monthly income of KES. 30,000.

He has borrowed KES. 70,000 from VisionFund Kenya as his second loan, after paying the previous loan successfully. He will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs.

His hope and dream for the future is to enjoy an improved life with his wife and kids.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Mushegh

texts.en:
Mushegh is young farmer living in Ejmiatsin town with his wife and their infant kid.

Mushegh is involved in pig breeding. He has pigs, piglets and some hens. He feeds and sells pigs, and is already skilled in that field.

The requested loan will help Mushegh to purchase three sows and forage for feeding the cattle.

He would be very thankful to lenders for their support, as he works hard to develop his farm and earn income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for three sows and forage for feeding the cattle.

loans.name: Amon

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Amon. He is fifty-six years old and a father of 4 children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in December 2014.

Amon is a maize and bean farmer. He also rears chickens. He is grateful to HiH EA for enterprise training and instilling in him a culture of saving.

He is taking a Kiva loan to purchase more sheep and chicken feed. He hopes to satisfy customer demand for mutton and chicken and hence earn more income. With this additional income, he will be able to not only provide for his family's needs such as food and children's school fees but also save for the future.

Amon is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their support. He promises to promptly repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep and chicken feed.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Mrs. Lien is 40 years old, married, and has two children.

The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine, which can improve the health of her family members, especially her children.

She has daily income from pig raising and fishing, so she is able to repay the loan monthly as scheduled.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 32 years old, married to Japhet and blessed with four children aged between 11 and 4 years. She has been into the clothes business for two years, and earns a monthly income of KES 5,000. She also does horticultural farming, which earns her additional income.

This being her first loan, she intends to buy more clothes for resale in the village, as she anticipates helping her husband to pay school fees for their children from the expanded business profits.

Her dream is to become financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes for sale

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia, 33, runs a grocery store in the heart of her hometown, Beirut. She is single and lives with her parents, who are both unemployed.

The grocery store was initially established by her father more than 25 years ago, but she has been running it for 5 years. It is the family's only source of income, which pushes Dalia to constantly improve it by maintaining competitive prices and a friendly environment in the store.

For the first time, Dalia is asking for a 1,029,765 Lebanese pounds from Kiva's partner Ibdaa. She needs it to buy supplies (food products for the store).

She has ambitious plans for her business and is working hard to increase her sales and income. She is very well known in the area since her father already had a good reputation among his clients.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her grocery store

loans.name: Kikonda Youth Farmers Saving And Credit Group

texts.en:
Robert is a member of Kikonda Youth Farmers Saving and Credit, where members guarantee each other when borrowing and paying back the loan. He is aged 29 with 6 children, including 2 pairs of twins, living in Fort Portal, Uganda.

He operates a produce business selling items like beans, ground nuts, maize and cassava flour, which he started six years ago. He is charged with the duty of taking care of his family, paying school fees and looking after his parents. He also faces hardships of inadequate capital and customers delaying to pay him, resulting in low profits and a failure to expand his business.

Robert has asked for a loan to help him buy dry foods, like beans, to sell.

The extra person in the photo is also a group member with savings; he has guaranteed others, but has not taken the loan this time.

loans.use: to buy dry foods, like beans, to sell.

loans.name: Wara 2015 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “WARA 2015” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Leonarda es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de vajilla, taller de costura, venta de helados, venta de zapatos de cholita, venta de perfumes, venta de comida, librería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Leonarda es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de vajilla; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio por iniciativa propia hace veinte años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de platos y tazas de porcelana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de Oruro y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución y las reuniones de pago con su asociación comunal.
texts.en:
A.C. "WARA 2015" will begin their first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of Centro Focal Alto Lima. It comprises eight members and is directed by a board where Ms. Leonarda is the Treasurer. The businesses that the members of the community association carry out are varied. They include: tableware sales, sewing, selling ice cream, selling ladies' "cholita" shoes, selling perfumes, food sales, and book sales. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit small micro-enterprises where Ms. Leonarda is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer by the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business in tableware sales; she makes it known that she started this business of her own initiative 20 years ago. 

The loan that she will now take out will be used to increase capital (through the purchase of porcelain plates and cups in bulk) that she will acquire from wholesale vendors from Oruro and later commercialize in her retail space. This kind of work allows her to generate an income to support her family economically, now that she is married and has three children. When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the health options offered by the institution and the payment meetings with her community association.

loans.use: to purchase porcelain plates and cups in bulk

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
ABISHYIZEHAMWE is a group led by Stephanie, who is 37 years old. The group name means “Alliance” in English. She is married with four children between the ages of 2.5 and 13 years; they all go to school.

She has a shop and has been running this business for the past four years. The group members sell different items and they all wish to work hard and have a better future.

With the loan, she would like to buy more soap, sugar and salt to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and make savings.

loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Theophile

texts.en:
Theophile is 29 years old and married with five children, ages 8 to 17 years old and all in school. She sells domestic animals, like goats, and has been doing this business for the past 21 years.

With the loan requested, Theophile would like to buy more goats to sell. With the profits from the business, she would like to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Twisungane Ii Group

texts.en:
Gaspard is the second person from the left in the photo raising his hand, and is the president of TWISUNGANE II Group. He has worked with Vision Finance Company since 2008 to develop his business, and is happy to report that he is a repeat client, which shows his diligence and commitment.

Gaspard is a 59-year-old father of seven children. He has owned and operated an agriculture business selling rice for the past 14 years, an enterprise that requires him to work from 6:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. every day, and still manage his household.

Gaspard has requested a Koramuhinzi loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand his agriculture business by cultivating more rice to sell. The Koramuhinzi loan product is a pre-harvest loan where the borrower will not be required to pay off the principal until after the harvest. This loan will allow Gaspard and his family to maintain their current standard of living until proceeds from the harvest arrive. With the pre-harvest funds, Gaspard will be able to pay his children's school fees and provide family support until his crops are ready to sell.

He intends to use the profits from his harvest to save for the future. The other members of TWISUNGANE II Group have the same business, requiring an influx of funding to continue the success and expansion of their businesses.

loans.use: to cover his personal expenses while expanding his agricultural business by cultivating more rice to sell.

loans.name: Dao

texts.en:
Dao is a hardworking woman who is 42 years old. She is married and has three children. Her income is mainly from fishing. With more than 15 years experience and with support from her husband, with her income she is able to repay the loan monthly as requested.

Dao is interested to improve the living standard for her family and she really needs the loan to build a toilet.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Souraya

texts.en:
Souraya, 50, is a Lebanese owner of a beauty salon, living in Beirut with her husband and 3 children. Her eldest son works and helps his parents with the house expenses while her youngest daughter is finishing her university studies and will graduate next year.

Souraya and her husband have been running the beauty salon together since 1980. Her husband is the hairdresser and she handles the make-up and the beauty services for women.

For the first time, Souraya is asking for a loan of 1,234,327 Lebanese pounds from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She needs the loan to upgrade some of her salon's equipment, which is expected to increase her revenue. She also needs to purchase some additional coloring shampoo and supplies before the Christmas season and end of year holidays.

Souraya and her husband have their loyal clients who appreciate their professionalism, and their business has been working well for several years which motivates them to keep working hard to expand it.

loans.use: to upgrade her beauty salon's equipment.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Ms. Huong is a single woman, 22 years old. There are four people in her family.

She has daily income from her chicken, pig and vegetable garden.

With this loan, she can build a hygienic latrine to improve the living conditions and health of her family. She is able to repay the loan monthly with support from her parents.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh is 45 years old and married with two adult children. She would like to improve her living standards but lacks capital.

The loan can help her to build a hygienic latrine. Farming and wages are the main income sources for her family so she will be able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine o improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Duan

texts.en:
Duan is 55 years old, married and has two children. She lives in a rural area and raising poultry and cattle are her main sources of income. She has been doing this for more than 20 years.

The loan can help her to build a hygienic latrine to improve her living standards, especially for her children.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en:
Ngan is 55 years old. There are five people in her family. Cultivation and animal husbandry are her main sources of income. She can cover her family’s daily cost and education from pig raising income.

With this loan, Ngan is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve the health of her family members, especially the kids. She has a daily income from gardening vegetables and raising chickens and pigs.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Egla

texts.en:
Egla is 34 years old. She is not married with 5 children. 

She has had a motor bike transport business for 1 year. She will be using the loan to purchase dry maize.

With the anticipated profits, Egla will be able to educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are open a dry maize store.

She is in her first loan cycle and has borrowed KShs 10,000 to be repaid in 6 months

loans.use: to purchase dry maize

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is from the Lusadzor village in the Tavush region, where she has been involved in farming.

Hasmik runs the farm with her husband and father-in-law. Besides farming, Hasmik also works as an army cook and her husband is an army officer.

The farm specializes in cattle breeding and the requested loan will help Hasmik to purchase a cow and cattle fodder.

Hasmik hopes to receive lenders' support, as the income from agribusiness is vital for her family's living.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and cattle fodder.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Tha is a hard-working, 55-year-old married mother of two children. She needs a loan to build a hygienic latrine to improve the health of her family and also for environment protection.

Her family’s income is mainly from business so they have a regular monthly income to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit, who is 23 years old young man, lives in village Kobiaantkari, with his wife and 2 children. As there is high unemployment rate in the region and Davit has only secondary education, he had started work as a private artisan. He gets small income that isn't enough even meeting basic needs of the family. In order to increase the productivity somehow, Davit wants to be involved in trading business and get another source of income. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions.

After several unsuccessful attempts, Davit applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses.

Davit will purchase stock of fruits and vegetables and will have money for working capital to develop his trading business. He will sell the products among local people and through the district also. He is very enthusiastic and hard working person with a great desire to ensure his children with good education for progressing in life. This credit will be a great support for the family.

Davit is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate additional income.

loans.use: to start trading business with fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Marleny Alicia

texts.es:
Marleny cuenta con una experiencia de muchos años en la actividad de la confección, desea montar su taller independiente.
Trabajará durante todo el día y con su taller desea generar empleo para personas con muchas necesidades. 
Esta actividad la aprendió de su madre quien le enseñó desde muy pequeña. La ventaja es que ya tiene reconocimiento en el sector.

Para cumplir su objetivo, Marleny requiere de un préstamo para comprar una máquina plana. Su mayor anhelo es salir adelante con su taller de confección y poder tener en su hogar unas mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar junto a sus 7 hijos.
texts.en:
Marleny has many years of experience in the occupation of dressmaking and she wants to start her own workshop.

She will work all day and with her workshop she wants to create jobs for people in need. She learned this occupation from her mother who taught her from a young age. Her advantage is that she already knows this business well.

To achieve her goal, Marleny needs a loan to buy a sewing machine. Her greatest wish is to get ahead with her dressmaking workshop and be able to have greater economic opportunity in her home so that she can succeed along with her seven children.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Gai

texts.en:
Mrs. Gai is 59 years old. There are four people in her family. Salary and husbandry are her main sources of income. She can cover family’s daily cost and education from pig raising income.

With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve the health of her family members, especially the kids. She has daily income from her vegetable garden, chicken and pig.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 46-year -old Lebanese woman living with her husband in a rented house in Beirut. After getting married, Fatima and her husband decided to open their own clothing shop in the neighborhood where they grew up and where they know a lot of people.

They started their business in 2002, which gives Fatima over 13 years of experience in clothing sales, since she also used to work in one of the biggest clothing shops in the area before she met her husband.

For the first time, Fatima is asking for a 1,850,990 Lebanese pound loan from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She needs to buy a series of clothes collections for her shop before the Christmas and New Year holidays. Thus she will be able to get a lower price for larger quantities, reduce her costs and increase her profit.

With the help of this loan, Fatima will be proud to see her shop satisfy its loyal clients. It will also help her and her husband build on their success and expand their business.

loans.use: to buy a new clothes collection before the holidays for her shop.

loans.name: Samia

texts.en:
Samia is a 38-year-old married mother of 4, who lives with her beloved family and works from her house selling clothing and other family needs.

She lives in a Palestinian refugee camp since it is hard for her and her husband to afford the high cost of living outside the camp. Thus through her home-based business, Samia is able to help her husband, who works for a limited monthly salary, cover the family's expenses.

Samia is working hard to develop her business, and she intends to move it outside her house in the future. Accordingly, she is acquiring a loan today from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua so she can increase her business merchandise with special winter blankets and clothing.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special winter blankets and clothing.

loans.name: Nkimbiri Tukorrehamu Farmers Group

texts.en:
Theopista is a member of Nkimbiri Tukorrehamu Farmers Group, where members guarantee each other's obligations when borrowing and paying back the loan. She is aged 51 with five children, all living in Fort Portal Uganda.

She has a business selling matooke and vegetables, which she has been practicing for 14 years. She started this using her husband's savings, and got support from his older daughter. Theopista is faced with the hardships of limited means of transport to market and limited capital to expand her business. However, she is working very hard to make sure she educates all her children to her levels of learning. She has asked for a loan to help her buy matooke to sell.

The baby in the photo belongs to a member, and is breast feeding. So, at the time the photo was taken, she was with her mother. The extra person in the photo is also a group member who has not taken the loan.

loans.use: to buy matooke to sell.

loans.name: Truc

texts.en:
Mrs. Truc is 25 years old, is married and has two children. She works hard to support her family.

She would like to improve her family’s living standards, especially those of her children, but lacks capital. The loan can help her to build a sanitary latrine, and she is able to repay the loan from husbandry and cultivation.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve a health of her family.

loans.name: Heinys Elena

texts.es:
Heinys es una joven de 20 años de edad, la cual se dedica a atender un salón de belleza, ella inició su negocio con la ilusión de obtener la libertad financiera e independizarse.
Ella es una mujer humilde, ayuda a su madre con la comida, está pagando sus cursos de belleza, quiere progresar, tener vivienda, carro, y que mejor manera que trabajar con empeño en su propio negocio.
En su afán por mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio, contar con mayores insumos para realizar más tratamientos a sus clientes, la joven solicita un préstamo para realizar reformas al local, visuales y de confort y comprar químicos para tinturado y lisado de cabello.
texts.en:
Heinys is a 20-year-old woman who has a hair salon. She started her business with the hope of achieving financial liberty and independence. 

She is a modest woman who helps her mother with food expenses. She is paying for her beauty classes and wants to get ahead in life: to have a house and a car. She thinks that there is no better way of achieving her goal than through dedication to her own business. 

She is requesting a loan to renovate her store and buy chemicals for hair dying and straightening, which will improve her business' infrastructure and allow her to have more supplies to help her customers.

loans.use: to renovate her store and buy chemicals for hair dying and straightening.

loans.name: Clovis

texts.en:
Clovis is a very hardworking man, aged forty-four and living in Fort Portal, Uganda. After failing to raise enough money to continue with his schooling, he decided to venture into farming and has since reaped tangible benefits.

His business is paying off and with the money that he generates he is able to pay for his children's school fees and other basics for his family. However, while inadequate capital to venture into modern farming is his major challenge, he still dreams of becoming a modern farmer.

Clovis is in need of a loan to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to pay his children's school fees.

loans.name: Tulgonoi

texts.ru: Тулгоной успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве на сегодня есть 2 коровы, на 1,80 Га земли выращивает хлопок для реализации. Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) с целью развития ее бизнеса, а именно, на запрошенную сумму Тулгоной планирует приобрести коров. Доходы от кредита Тулгоной будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и завершение строительства дома.
texts.en:
Tulgonoi successfully repaid her loan, using it for its designated purpose. She is thankful to Kiva and to everyone who helped with her financing.

Today, Tulgonoi's farm has 2 cows, and she grows cotton for resale on 1.80 hectares of land. She has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 25,000 som (KGS) to develop her business. More specifically, Tulgonoi plans to purchase cows with the requested sum of money. She will use the income from the loan to continue developing her business and finish construction on her house.

loans.use: to buy some cows in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Orozgul

texts.ru: Орозгул, 50 лет, замужем, есть дочь и 2 сыновей. Образование-среднее, много лет занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 5 овец, на 1,50 Га земли она выращивает кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход Орозгул составляет около 19,000 сом (KGS). Орозгул обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 коров для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Орозгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота и обучение сына в университете.
texts.en:
Orozgul is 50 years old, married, and has a daughter and 2 sons. She has a secondary-level education, and she has done agricultural work for many years -- animal and field husbandry. Today, her farm has 3 cows and 5 sheep, and she grows corn on 1.50 hectares of land. Orozgul's monthly income is around 19,000 som (KGS).

Orozgul has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy 4 cows to increase the size of her herd. Orozgul plans to use the income from her loan to continue increasing her headcount of livestock, and to pay for her son's university education.

loans.use: to purchase four cows to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Mrs. Phuong is 39 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom are in school. She would like to improve her family’s living standards, especially her children, but suffers from a lack of capital.

This loan can help her to build a sanitary latrine. She will be able to repay the loan with income from cultivating crops in her garden and selling chickens.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson who is in his early 40's is single with three children, one is still in school and other other two are grown up. He has been a food vendor for ten years now. He works from 6 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase on the food stock and has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of the group which is doing fine. He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan, paid rent for the place of business,built his own house, bought sofa sets and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in mamalishe store and to start selling fruits and vegetables. He dreams of opening an other food place.

Benson will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in mamalishe store and to start selling fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Twizerane Cb Sub B Group

texts.en:
