Pascal is the group leader and he is 30 years old. He is married but has no children yet. The group is called TWIZERANE which means “Let's trust each other” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses in order to earn more income and have a better future.

Daniel is a motorcyclist and has been riding a motorcycle for a living for the past two years, while his wife is a student. With the loan, he would like to buy spare parts for repairing his motorcycle. With the profits from the business, he would like to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for repairing his motorcycle.

loans.name: Femi Turner Group

texts.en:
Dankay is a 47-year-old businesswoman. She is married with seven children aged 27, 23, 20, 17, 13, 10 and six, one of whom is at university while the others attend mainly senior secondary school. She is one of the four members of the Femi Turner solidarity group (in the group photo, Dankay is standing second from the left).

Dankay established her local food business based on fish 23 years ago to support her children in their schooling. She pays school fees, buys learning materials, and provides food for her children. She opens her business six days a week from 9 am to 6 pm.

The Femi Turner group needs a total loan of 5,400,000 SLL. Dankay is entitled to 1,500,000 SLL of this loan which she will use to buy additional bags of rice, maggie (a type of seasoning), gallons of palm oil, four cartons of fish, etc. for her business.

She hopes that this loan will help her to generate more profit to support her family. In the future, Dankay plans to save more money to provide for her chidren’s university education. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.

Dankay and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of rice, maggie (a type of seasoning), gallons of palm oil, and four cartons of fish.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is an enterprising young man aged 28, and he hails from Fort Portal, Uganda. Four years ago after realizing that depending on his parents was never going to be sustainable, he decided to venture into farming. He mainly grows bananas and since there is a ready market, he has been able to reap tangible benefits from this business.

He aspires to own at least twenty acres of bananas and also to buy a motorcycle to help with transportation. He could also use the motorcycle to earn extra income by transporting passengers.

Like most farmers he faces the challenges of unpredictable weather and impassable roads, but says this will not hinder his determination to become a model farmer.

Richard is in need of a loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman with two children both of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

Caroline has operated a school business for the past two years, providing education to the students. She mentioned that parents sometimes delay paying school fees on time. With this loan, she wants to purchase stock of chalk, tables, and books for her school business. 
She decided to join Yehu to access loans and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of chalk, tables, and books for her school business.

loans.name: Sadick

texts.en:
Sadick is in need of a loan to buy land. He is a thirty-six-year-old man who is married with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.

Sadick is a farmer but also trades in fish in order to earn enough money to support his family. He is challenged by both the seasonal nature of his businesses and inadequate capital. He dreams of specializing in commercialized agriculture.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Kumushay

texts.ru: Кумушай успешно погасила свой кредит, она использовала средства по назначению и очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто ей помог в финансировании. Она по-прежнему занимается полеводством на 2,0 Га земли. Кумушай выращивает кукурузу табак, яблоки для реализации. Прибыль в среднем 26,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Кумушай все накопленные средства старается вкладывать в развитие своего бизнеса. Однако дому Кумушай требуется ремонт, поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов для проведения ремонтных  работ. Полученные доходы от бизнеса Кумушай планирует вкладывать в его развитие и улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en:
Kumushay successfully repaid her loan, using the funds for their designated purpose. She is very thankful to Kiva and to everyone who helped with her financing.

As before, Kumushay does field husbandry work on 2.0 hectares of land. She grows corn, tobacco, and apples for resale. Her income averages 26,000 som (KGS) per month.

Kumushay tries to put all her saved funds toward developing her business. However, Kumushay's house requires repair, so she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy construction materials to carry out the repair work. Kumushay plans to use the profits from her business toward developing it, and toward improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to repair her house.

loans.name: Nancy Liliana

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer de 30 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja, se dedica atender un negocio de entretenimiento nocturno, un bar pero con pista bailable, ya que el municipio de peque es conocido por ser un lugar muy alegre que disfrutan del baile.
La temporada de diciembre representa el mes donde más frecuenta su bar, ya que es una época muy alegre, donde disfrutan mucho de la bebida y las canciones de parranderas (música popular de fin de año en Colombia).
Para estar preparara y contar con el surtido de bebidas suficiente la señora Nancy solicita una importante suma para la compra de cerveza, aguardiente y ron, productos 100% legales ya que pro esta época se ve mucho trago malo, y quiere brindar esa tranquilidad a sus clientes que en su negocio solo se sirve trago 100% garantizado, esa es la razón del monto elevado.
texts.en:
Nancy is a 30 year-old woman who is in a common-law marriage.  She has a business providing nighttime entertainment, which consists of a bar with a dance floor. She lives in the municipality of Peque, where her business is well-known for being a happy place where people enjoy dancing.  December is her busiest month, because it is a happy time when people enjoy drinks and Parrandera music (popular music that is enjoyed in Colombia during the end of the year).

In order to be prepared and to stock up with enough beverages, Nancy is requesting a significant sum to buy beer, aguardiente (a type of liquor), and rum.  These products are 100% legal, and this is important because during this season you see a lot of bad drinks, and she wants her customers to be assured that her establishment sells only 100% guaranteed liquors.  This is the reason for the loan that she is requesting.

loans.use: to buy beer, aguardiente and rum

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es:
Cruz, de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está casada, su esposo es pescador artesanal y junto a él tiene 5 hijos que están estudiando.

Cruz, desde hace 20 años se dedica al comercio de pescado, camarón y tamales, mientras se dio el conflicto armado en el país, ella anduvo combatiendo unos años pero después de los acuerdos de paz volvió a su vida normal; este negocio lo inicio para ayudar a su esposo con la venta de pescado.- Ella compra el producto en su cantón y sale a venderlo a los cantones vecinos y los tamales los venden en el caserío y su día comienza a las 5:00 a.m.

Cruz, necesita el préstamo para comprar una ternera y otra parte para comprar camarones.

Su sueño es, ver graduarse a su último hijo de una carrera universitaria, además necesita comprar un estanque para sembrar camarón.
texts.en:
Cruz, 46 years old, went to school until the fifth grade. She is married, and her husband is an artisanal fisherman. Together they have 5 children, all of whom are in school.

For 20 years Cruz has worked in the businesses of fishing, shrimp, and tamales. During the country's armed conflict, she fought for a few years but after the peace agreement she returned to her normal life. She started this business to help her husband sell fish. She buys the product in her canton and goes out to sell it in neighboring cantons. The tamales she sells in her neighborhood. Her day begins at 5:00 a.m.

Cruz needs this loan in order to purchase a calf as well as shrimp. Her dream is to see her youngest child graduate from university. She also needs to purchase a pond for raising shrimp.

loans.use: to purchase a calf as well as to purchase shrimp.

loans.name: Matta

texts.en:
Matta is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Matta has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Matta would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Matta can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Matta will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Matta is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to ensure that all her children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest
